loans.name: Edwin Javier

texts.es: Javier es un joven trabajador, tiene 24 años de edad, el se dedica a la crianza y comercio de pollos, Javier trabaja cosechando flores, Javier vive en una casa por la que paga arriendo  y allí tiene galpones  en donde tiene a sus animales,  Javier solicita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de pollos, Javier espera mejorar su negocio para asi salir adelante y tratar de mejorar la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Javier is a hard-working young man. He is 24 years old and earns a living raising and selling chickens. Javier works harvesting flowers. He lives in a house he is renting, and there he has sheds in which he keeps his animals.

Javier is requesting the loan to invest the money in purchasing chickens. Javier hopes to improve his business and thus his financial situation and he is trying to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase chickens.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es: Don Luis, tiene 62 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 3 hijos y reside en una aldea del municipio de Petoa Santa Bárbara. Sus hijos viven aparte, el vive solo con su esposa y siempre a trabajado en agricultura y realizando trabajos en jornal. Hace un año decidió por su propio negocio donde vende golosinas como churros, dulces, naranjas, mangos, refrescos y revende  Combustible por galón. El quiere ver su negocio mas surtido y ha solicitado un préstamo para comprar mas churros, dulces, refrescos, bolsa con agua, combustible y frutas para reventa. Su propósito es tener su negocio fuerte y estar estable con su esposa.
texts.en:
Luis is 62 years old, married and has three children. He lives in a village in the municipality of Petoa Santa Barbara. His children live on their own and he lives alone with his wife.  Luis has always worked in agriculture and as a day laborer. 

A year ago he decided to start his own business selling snacks such as chips, sweets, oranges, mangoes, and soft drinks, and reselling fuel by the gallon. He wants his business to be better stocked, so he has applied for a loan to buy more chips, sweets, soft drinks, bags of water, fuel, and fruit for resale.

His goal is for his business to be strong  and to have stability with his wife.

loans.use: to buy more chips, sweets, soft drinks, bags of water, fuel, and fruit for resale.

loans.name: Honeilyn

texts.en:
Honeilyn is 36 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for 15 years and also earns an income from feeds retailing.

Honeilyn has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store. She has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer De Marquez Group

texts.es: Lina es una mujer emprendedora que pertenece al grupo Nuevo Amanecer de Marquez, grupo de 6 personas trabajadoras y responsables que decidieron juntarse,Lina es madre de 4 hijos ya adultos, Lina se dedica a la venta de desayuno seis horas diarias desde hace 8 años,Lina se siente muy satisfecha con los logros obtenidos en este negocio ya que le permite tener contacto con la gente vecina que siempre van a degustar sus variados desayunos,Lina sueña con poner un local estable grande y bonito donde además de desayuno venda almuerzo,cena y algunos antojitos,Lina agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por el prestamos otorgado ya que le a ayudado a surtir sus productos y darles una mejor atención a sus clientes,Lina dice Muchas Gracias por la oprtunidad brindada amí y mis compañeros del grupo, les prometemos que no los vamos a defraudar y que sigan ayudando a mucha gente más, para que puedan lograr sus sueños.
texts.en: Lina is an entrepreneur that belongs to “Nuevo Amanecer de Marquez”, a communal bank comprised of six hardworking, responsible people that decided to join together.  Lina is a mother of four adult children.  For eight years, she has been engaged in selling breakfast, six hours a day.  She feels very satisfied with the profits she has earned in this business, which has allowed her to have contact with the neighboring people who always enjoy her varied breakfasts.  Lina dreams of establishing a nice large, stable local where, in addition to breakfast, she can sell lunches, dinners, and some snacks.  Lina is grateful to the Kiva investors for the loans they have granted because they helped her stock up on products and provide better service to her customers.  She says “thank you very much for the opportunity provided to me and my group members.  We promise you that we are not going to disappoint you.  Please continue helping many more people so that they may achieve their dreams”.

loans.use: to purchase milk, sugar, rice, and other products.

loans.name: Lutgarda

texts.en:
Lutgarda is 36 years old and married with four children. With three of her children in school, Lutgarda works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods, soap, shampoo, coffee, candies and other groceries. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell, like bread, canned goods, beverages, and other groceries.

Lutgarda has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like bread, canned goods, beverages, and other groceries

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Jonah works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig-raising. Jonah is borrowing PHP 18,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell through her general store business, like canned goods and personal care products. 

Jonah has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods and personal care products.

loans.name: Vilma Del Carmen

texts.es:
Vilma, es madre 4 hijos, estudió hasta cuarto grado, para ayudarles a sus padres tuvo que trabajar desde muy joven, realizo oficios domesticos, está acompañada y su esposo es albañil y agricultor, actualmente en su casa viven ella y su esposo.

Vilma, se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos, esta actividad la practica desde hace muchos años junto con su esposo, quien fue el que le enseño de cultivos, además de trabajar sus propios cultivos también vende comida típico fuera de su vivienda los fines de semana; para ir a sus cultivos diariamente tienen que viajar 3 kilómetros en trasporte público y después tiene que caminar 2 kilómetros.

El préstamo sera utilizado para comprar abono, pesticida y otra variedad de semilla, para su cultivo de maíz y frijol; con lo cual mejorara sus ingresos y su producción.

Vilma, desea seguir trabajando y ampliar sus cultivos y así poder ayudarle a su esposo al sostenimiento del hogar.
texts.en:
Vilma is a mother of four children and went to school until fourth grade. She had to work since she was very young to help her parents with household chores. She is married and her husband is a bricklayer and farmer. At the moment she and her husband live in their house.

Vilma is earning a living growing basic grains and beans. She has been doing this for many years, together with her husband, who taught her how to grow it. In addition to the work on her own farm, she is also selling typical food in front of her house on weekends. To get to their crops, they have to travel 3 km [2 miles] by public transport and then walk for 2 km [1 1/4 mile].

This loan will be used to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and a greater variety of seeds for her cultivation of corn and beans, with which she will improve her income and production.

Vilma wants to keep on working and extend her crops and this way be able to help her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and a greater variety of seeds for her cultivation of corn and beans.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Meet Fred, a family man and smallholder farmer from Chepchoina village in Kenya. He is married to a lovely wife known as Ann and together, they have 5 children, the youngest being only a year old. 
Fred started farming 4 years ago to supplement his monthly salary. He aspires to grow his agri-business, become self-employed and to employ others. Currently, his 0.5 acre farm has 3 cows, 30 heads of poultry and 2 sheep. 

To scale up his business, he is seeking a loan to buy a brood of hens. 
Your loan investment will grow the quantity of poultry products and byproducts from his farm by over 300%. Income from his salary and milk sales will be used to make initial loan repayments until his investment on poultry starts paying off.
 
Fred plans to use the expected income from poultry to further grow the agri-business and to meet his family's basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase poultry to expand his farming activities

loans.name: Zhuljeta

texts.en:
Zhuljeta is a 39-year-old married mother of three with the oldest being 20 and the youngest 8 years old.
Zhuljeta has been doing livestock for about ten years now and with the loan that she is requesting from you, she will use it to buy fodder for the animals. Currently, she has only two dairy cows selling about 18 liters of milk a day for most of the year; she also sells two calves a year. In some agricultural land that she owns, she mostly plants food for the animals so that she doesn’t have to pay for it, but she cannot produce enough. While she does this activity for a little living, her husband works as a night man for a pay of approximately $160/month. 
Under the communist era the village were Zhuljeta and her family lives, was full of deportation camps for hundreds of people with political opposing ideas.

loans.use: to buy fodder for her animals, as she cannot produce enough on her land

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with four children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes and bags. She has been involved in this business for three years.

Elizabeth's business is located in a good area and her primary customers are individuals. She says that her biggest business challenge is low working capital. She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more clothes and shoes to sell. She hopes that in the future she will have a big business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Bardhok

texts.en:
Bardhok and Lucije are both villagers and in their early 50s with two children. The loan that they are seeking from you will be used to buy fertilizers for the animal feed plantations and also some part for the motor scythe. 
Their family income is generated through livestock and the service Bardhok offers to other villagers with the motor scythe. 

All in all, they got two dairy cows from which they sell roughly 15 liters of raw milk a day for about nine months a year and also two calves a year. In addition, they have two sows that, between the months of March to November they sell sixteen piglets.  In some agricultural land they own, they plant mostly feed for the animals such as corn, wheat and Lucerne.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and also replace some broken parts of the motor scythe that he rents out to villagers for extra income

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis, 43, is a smallholder farmer from Kaisagat village in Kenya. He is married and has 4 children aged between 5 and 16. Francis started farming 8 years ago to provide food for his family. 
Today, Francis has shifted his focus from subsistence farming to commercial farming. 

He is seeking a loan to purchase poultry so that he can sell the extra products and byproducts to generate more income for his family. 
With the new income from the loan investment, Francis plans to spend it on family basic needs, children's education and loan repayment.

loans.use: to buy poultry to expand his range of farming activities

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Mary Jane works hard to support her family.

She has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling bananas. Mary Jane is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Mary Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 38 years old and married, with one child.

Jenelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 19,500 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Jenelyn has borrowed and paid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from food-vending.

Jenelyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es: Efraín, tiene 56 años de edad, esta casado, tiene dos hijos y reside en una aldea del municipio de Villanueva Cortes, cerca de Cofradía.  Don Efraín siempre se a dedicado a la agricultura cultivando maíz, frijoles, yuca y sandia. Esta producción la vende en la misma zona en el mercado local. Lleva varios prestamos solicitados en la institución con los cuales ha mantenido activo sus cultivos. Actualmente solicita otro por 11,000 lempiras para comprar fertilizantes y pago de limpieza del cultivo de yuca para poder sacar mejor cosecha. Su meta es ahorrar para comprar un vehículo de trabajo y  mas terreno.
texts.en: Efraín is 56 years old, married and has two children. He lives in a village in the municipality of Villanueva Cortes, close to Cofradía. Efraín has always worked in agriculture growing corn, beans, yucca and watermelon. He sells his production in his area in the local market. He has had several loans with the institution which has kept his business running. Currently he is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pay to clear his yucca crops to produce a better yield. His goal is to save to buy a work vehicle and buy more land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay to clear his yucca crops.

loans.name: Denis José

texts.es:
Denis es un pequeño productor de café que se dedica a este rubro desde hace 20  años. Su finca está certificada por comercio justo, UTZ y C.A.F.E. Practices, a través de la asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC), a la cual está afiliado, y como resultado del buen manejo que ha sabido dar a su cafetal.

Para conservar las certificaciones y mejorar la productividad de su finca, Denis ha diseñado un plan de mejora nutricional de sus plantas, y para su implementación este ciclo, está solicitando un financiamiento para comprar los abonos y fertilizantes que requiere su café para lograr su meta.

Este pequeño productor, además de manejar su finca con un enfoque sostenible, también contribuye con su comunidad generando algunas plazas temporales en su finca. Su sueño es incrementar la productividad de su finca y con ello los ingresos para su familia y en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Denis is a small coffee producer who has been in this business for 20 years. His farm is UTZ and C.A.F.E. Practices fair trade-certified through the Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC) association with which he is affiliated. His good management of his farm was also a factor in his certification.

In order to keep his certifications and improve his farm's productivity, Denis has designed a plan to improve the nutrition of his plants. He is requesting financing so that he can implement it in this cycle. He will use the money to buy the manure and fertilizers his coffee requires to meet this goal. 

In addition to managing his farm with a sustainable approach, this small producer also contributes to his community by creating some temporary jobs at his farm. His dream is to increase his farm's productivity and consequently, his family's and his community's income.

loans.use: to buy the manure and fertilizers he needs for his coffee farm to ensure a good harvest.

loans.name: Mentor

texts.en: Mentor a 32-year-old married father of a little 2-year-old, owns a bar-restaurant-hotel that was built in 1939.  It is located in a 14 dynym forest not far from seashore in the northern part of the country. He wants to replace the doors and windows using a loan of 200,000 Albanian Lek that he is requesting from you. Mentor has no other means of an income but this. “The earnings I make from this depends on the time of the year or the economic conditions or even political events. While I would say that so far I have been enjoying running this place, I would also say that it hasn’t been any easy at all in many aspects including marketing and maintaining the original architecture,” said Mentor to the loan officer.

loans.use: to repair doors and windows to a bar-restaurant that was built in 1939 and now need replacing

loans.name: Joaquín

texts.es:
Joaquín tiene 42 años y vive junto a su en una pequeña finca al norte de Nicaragua. Toda su vida ha estado relacionado con la producción de café, la cual es la principal actividad económica para su familia, y realiza con el soporte técnico de la asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC).

Para este ciclo, este pequeño productor está solicitando un financiamiento para comprar los fertilizantes y abonos que requiere su cafetal, con el fin de asegurar una buena cosecha y con ello mayores ingresos para su familia.

El sueño de Joaquín es lograr que una finca productiva y sostenible, y dar a su familia mejores condiciones económicas que las que él pudo tener.
texts.en:
Joaquin is 42 years old and he lives with his family on his small farm in northern Nicaragua.  All of his life he has been connected to the production of coffee, which is the principal economic activity for his family.  He does this with the technical support of the association Pueblos en Accion Comunitaria (PAC).

For this cycle, this small producer is requesting a loan to buy the fertilizers and manure that his coffee plants require, with the goal of assuring a good harvest and with that, greater earnings for his family.

Joaquin's dream is to succeed in having a productive and sustainable farm and to give to his family better economic conditions than those that he was able to have.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and manure that he will use for his coffee plants and achieve greater productivity

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en: Mustafa is single and has three sisters and a brother. He helps his father with the family income through a grocery store business. Mustafa requested a 5,000 EGP loan to buy grocery products such as tea, cheese, and oil to increase his sales, especially during Ramadan and feast seasons. Increased sales would mean more income for his family.

loans.use: To buy grocery products such as tea, cheese, and oil.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a married woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells tractor spare parts. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in urban area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuation. 

She will use the Kes 95,000 loan to buy more stock of tractor spare parts. Her business goal is to expand business and start selling other types of spare parts within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have  a large scale business. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: buy more stock of tractor spare parts

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a married man. He has three children. 

He operates a retail business where he sells pipes, other pipe connecting materials, and other plumbing items. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low working capital. 

Paul will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stocks of pipes, plumbing, and tap connection items. His business goal is to have a warehouse within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was successfully repaid. He will use the anticipated profits to increase his stocks.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of pipes, plumbing,and tap connection items.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 35 years old and married with two children, both in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like canned goods, condiments, home care products, and other groceries.

Marites has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as soap, shampoo, alcohol, toiletries, biscuits, condiments, vinegar, and other groceries. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like canned goods, condiments, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Melisa

texts.en:
Melisa is 40 years old and has ten children. She is married and has six children who are in school.

Melisa is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Melisa has been in this business for two years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Melisa would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 48 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines and is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Julie has been raising pigs for 15 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is 56 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy additional household goods to sell.

Esperanza has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Esperanza would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional household goods to sell

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 40 years old and married with seven children. With five children in school, Nilda works very hard to provide for them.

Nilda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal product care and other groceries.

Nilda has been in this business for 1 year and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, shampoo, soap, noodles, coffee, milk and other groceries. 

In the future, Nilda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 48 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Lourdes is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Lourdes has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from frozen foods.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Cristhian Jonathan

texts.es:
Cristhian es un joven de 18 años, nació en la provincia Andrés Ibáñez del departamento de Santa Cruz – Bolivia, vive con sus padres y su hermano con quienes comparte los gastos de la casa.

Actualmente Cristhian trabaja en el área de atención al cliente en una empresa comercial donde los ingresos económicos que percibe los utiliza para ayudar en los gastos de su hogar por lo que no le alcanza para cubrir los costos de la universidad, es por este motivo que solicita un crédito educativo para comenzar su carrera en Administración de Empresas. 

Cristhian manifiesta que su más grande inspiración para seguir adelante es su madre, pues es la persona que siempre lo motivó a alcanzar sus sueños y le enseñó que aunque se presenten dificultades en su camino, podrá cumplir sus objetivos con perseverancia, esfuerzo y entereza. 

Cristhian se ve en el futuro trabajando en una empresa internacional del área comercial y especializado en alguna rama que apoye la carrera que hoy ha elegido, y ayudando a su familia a tener una mejor calidad de vida. 

Cristhian se siente muy agradecido con aquellas personas que a través de sus recursos económicos le brindan la oportunidad de hacer realidad sus sueños, lo que lo hace sentirse seguro, estable, feliz y motivado.
texts.en:
Cristhian is an 18 year old young man. He was born in the Andrés Ibañez province in the Santa Cruz department of Bolivia. He lives with his parents and his brother and shares the household expenses with them. 

Cristhian currently works in customer service for a business firm using the economic income he receives to help with the household expenses and consequently cannot cover the university costs. It is for this reason that he is requesting an educational loan to start his university career in Business Administration.  

Cristhian states that his biggest inspiration to keep moving forward is his mother, since she is the person who always motivated him to achieve his dreams and taught him that even though there will be difficulties along the way, he will be able to achieve his goals with perseverance, effort and strength.

Cristhian sees himself working at an international business firm in the future, specializing in a branch that supports the career he has chosen and helping his family have a better quality of life.

Cristhian is very grateful to those who through their financial resources, provide him with the opportunity to make his dreams a reality, which makes him feel secure, stable, happy, and motivated.

loans.use: to pay for his degree in Business Administration.

loans.name: Heng's Group

texts.en:
Living in Kampong Cham province, Heng is 40-year-old and has three children. Nowadays, she earns income to support her family condition via cassava growing and raising pigs to earn extra income for ages. The sources of her business income are about 102,200KHR per day. 

Heng has been with VisionFund for two cycles already and repaid back her loan successfully. She is now leading a group of four to take the new Kiva loan. As the group leader, she will manage her loan portion to buy pesticide, cassava seed and pay for paid workers wages. She expects her cassava plantation to get more yields and her ability to expand her farming.

loans.use: to buy pesticide, cassava seed and pay for paid workers wages

loans.name: Fahriddin

texts.en:
Fahriddin is a hardworking man. He was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1966. He lives in a district with his family. He is married and has three children. His wife is an agrarian. He is a farmer.

He has many years of experience doing business with livestock. He knows his activity well and is trying to enlarge his herd of livestock to open a farm. His children are helping him to keep and take care of the livestock. Recently he has three cows and two calves.

Fahriddin's daughter is sick. She needs to be supported and awaits special treatment at a hospital. As a father, Fahriddin wants to see his daughter healthy, and he is now searching to finance her treatment. He appealed to IMON and Kiva, asking for a loan to have his daughter treated in hospital. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's needed medical treatment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice, canned goods, soft drinks, beverages, sugar, soaps, noodles, breads, assorted candies and seasonings to resell

loans.name: Carlos Edwin

texts.es:
Carlos Edwin tiene 39 años de edad, conviviente, tiene 3 hijos menores, vive en casa propia junto a su familia. Él es natural del caserío Buenos aires, que pertenece al distrito de Morropon, en la Región Piura, Costa Norte del Perú. La comunidad es pequeña los pobladores se dedican mayormente a la crianza de ganado menor y a la agricultura siendo su principal producto el plátano.

La actividad que desarrolla Carlos Edwin es el servicio de transporte público en su mototaxi, tiene más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio, sus recorridos son dentro de la zona, con buenas referencias laborales y crediticias. Además de trabajar en la agricultura ya que su padre le ha cedido un terreno para que el siembre.

Destino del crédito es para realizar el mantenimiento a su mototaxi, esto le permitirá trabajar de forma óptima (sin fallas mecánicas, lo que le generará mayores ingresos y le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos Edwin is 39 years old. He is in a common-law relationship and has three children. He lives in his own house with his family. He is a native of Buenos Aires, which belongs to the district of Morropon, in Piura region, on the North Coast of Peru. It is a small community and most of it's inhabitants work in raising small livestock and in farming, the main product being bananas.

The business that Carlos Edwin does is providing public transport on his motorcycle taxi and he has more than 5 years experience in the field. His trips are in the local area and he has good work and personal references. He also works in agriculture as his father gave him a plot of land to grow on.

The loan will be used to have maintenance done on his motorcycle taxi. This will allow him to work efficiently (with no break-downs) which will generate more income and allow him to improve his quality of living and that of his family.

loans.use: to have maintenance done on his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. She has four children. 

She operates a retail business where she sells meat. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. 

Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low working capital. 

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of meat. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of meat

loans.name: Carlito

texts.en:
Carlito is a 44-year-old, married man. A father of four children, ages 19-24 years old respectively, he lives in Talibon, Bohol. He engages in fishing. He catches and sells fresh fish to the locals in the community. He has been engaged in fishing for more than 20 years. 

Carlito is asking for a loan to purchase fishing materials and plywood for boat renovation. These tools are essential in order to boost his ongoing yield. With these items, he could sell a greater quantity of fish and be able to provide for the needs of his family. His finances will be stable and Carlito would start to expand his fishing livelihood.

He works hard to be successful in his fishing livelihood and also to finance the schooling of his children for a brighter future.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials and plywood for boat renovation.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is grateful that she was granted a 25,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Through her earnings, she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expense. 

She would now like to apply for a 30,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy large quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, and frozen foods which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Marivic dreams of having a bigger general store and prays that God will proper her family spiritually and materially. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries, and beverages for her business.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is 39 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines and is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Josefa has been farming rice for nine years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 55 years old and married with nine children. Nilda works very hard to provide for them.

Nilda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

Nilda has been in this business for 8 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, shampoo, soap and other groceries. 

In the future, Nilda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is 29 years old and married with two children.

Michelle works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Michelle has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Michelle aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
This is second loan of Artur from Kiva. The first loan helped him to handle training programs in conflict resolution for his students and he has paid it successfully. Artur continuous his work in the university as a lecturer. He needs this loan for publishing the book on this subject which will be used for his course.
 
The loan requested from SEF will help him to cover printing and research costs. 

Artur has now been approved for a loan within the framework of joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

Artur will be very glad to receive lenders' support and make his dream come true.

loans.use: to pay for printing of his book on conflict resolution and to cover further research costs

loans.name: Bhambie Laine

texts.en:
Bhambie Laine is 33 years old, married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell.

Bhambie Laine has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from buy and sell charcoal.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Raquel is 57 years old now.

Raquel has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. Raquel requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed.

Raquel has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Raquel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her bicycle transport and other needed materials

loans.name: Sotun's Group

texts.en:
A woman from Kampong Cham province, Sotun is a mother of two children and her age is 39. 

The sources of her family’s living income have been construction working and rice farming for nineteen years. Her daily income is about 25,800 KHR per day. 

She is now leading a group of two members; she will take her first Kiva loan via VisionFund. Through her loan portion, she will be able to pay the plowing fee and she will use the rest of money buy wood to renovate her old house. 

Sotun hopes her business will grow and earn her more income through this loan.

loans.use: to pay the plowing fee

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula, es madre de 4 hijos, uno de ellos está casado, 2 trabajan y el otro permanece en casa porque está enfermo, ella está casada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y ella lo ayuda; estudio hasta primer grado, debido a que sus padres no alcanzaban económicamente para pagar sus estudios; actualmente en su casa viven 4 personas las cuales dependen económicamente de ella. 

Paula, se dedica a la agricultura desde que estaba muy pequeña, debido a que su familia siempre se dedico a esta labor, porque era la única fuente de ingresos que ellos poseían en esos tiempos; aparte de dedicarse a la agricultura, tiene una venta de tamales, en este negocio le ayuda su nuera y en la agricultura su esposo.

Paula, utilizara el préstamo para comprar abono, pesticidas y herbicidas para el cultivo, todo para mejorar la producción y obtener buenas ganancias.

Paula, sueña con tener un cultivo en buenas condiciones, que le generen buenas ganancias y de esta forma sacar adelante a su familia.- Tambien, sueña con que su hijo que está enfermo se recupere, para que tenga una vida normal.
texts.en:
Paula is the mother of 4 children, one of whom is married, 2 of whom work, and the other remains at home because he is sick. She is married. Her husband makes a living in agriculture and she helps him. She was in school until first grade, but her parents didn't have enough money to pay for her studies. Currently 4 people live in her house who depend on her economically.

Paula has made a living in agriculture since she was very small. Her family always did this work, because it was the only source of income they had in those times. Other than agriculture, she sells tamales, in this business her daughter in law helps her. She helps her husband in agriculture.

Paula will use the loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and herbicides for farming, all to improve the output and get good earnings.

Paula dreams of having crops in good conditions, which generate good income and in this way provide for her family. Also, she dreams that her son who is sick will recuperate, so he can have a normal life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and herbicides for farming.

loans.name: Chhoeun's Group

texts.en:
A woman from Battambang province, Chhoeun is 56 years old and a mother of four children. For her living, she grows cassava and works on another farm for fees to income for ten years. Her daily income is about 55,600KHR per day to support her living. 

This is third loan cycle for Chhoeun via VisionFund and she has fully repaid back her past loan completely. She is now leading a group of two; as a group leader, she will spend her loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farming. She hopes to update her family’s living and gets more yields than last year through this loan portion.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farming

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula, es madre de 3 hijos, estudio hasta tercer grado, debido a que sus padres eran de escasos recursos y no alcanzaban para que estudiara, por ese motivo tuvo que dedicarse al trabajo, para ayudar a sus padres con los gastos de la casa, actualmente vive con uno de sus hijos y es el único que depende económicamente de ella.

Paula, se dedica a la venta de empanadas y tamales desde que tenía 16 años de edad, sus padres le enseñaron  a dedicarse al negocio para que aprendiera a tener sus propios ingresos, actualmente tiene 42 años de dedicarse a este negocio, aparte de estos ingresos ella criá animales de corral para engordarlos y venderlos, posteriormente en ocasiones su hija le ayuda con la venta en los alrededores de la comunidad.

Paula, utilizara el crédito para comprar plátano, azúcar, harina, manteca, sal; para su negocio de empanadas y tamales, ademas invertirá otra parte del dinero para elaborar pan, porque pretende dedicarse también a este negocio.

Paula, sueña con realizarle mejoraras a su casa, ya que su casa es de baharreque y el techo es de láminas y ya no sirve, porque cuando llueve le caen goteras.
texts.en:
Paula is a mother of three children. She went to school until third grade because her parents had scarce resources and not enough money for her to further study. So she began to work to help her parents with the household expenses. At the moment she lives with one of her children and it is the only one who financially dependents on her.

Paula is earning a living selling empanadas [filled pastries] and tamales since she was 16 years old. Her parents showed her how to run her business so she can make her own income. She has been running this business for 42 years. In addition to this income, she raises farmyard animals to fatten up and sell them. Subsequently, her daughter is helping her occasionally with the sales in the surroundings of the town.

Paula will use this loan to buy bananas, sugar, flour, butter, and salt for her empanada and tamales business. Moreover, she will invest a part of the money in baking bread because she is intending to earn money this way.

Paula dreams of making improvements to her house. Because, as of now, her house is made of waddle and daub, and the roof is made of corrugated iron sheets, which is leaking when it rains.

loans.use: to buy bananas, sugar, flour, butter, and salt.

loans.name: G.s Santa Elena Group

texts.es:
EL G.S. SANTA ELENA ESTA CONFORMADO POR  TRES INTEGRANTES DOS HOMBRES Y UNA MUJER, SON ORIGINARIOS DEL SAUCE, LUGAR QUE ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA NORTE DE LA REGIÓN, SE CARACTERIZAN POR SER TRABAJADORES, RESPONSABLES, CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL. EL SAUCE SE CARACTERIZA POR SER UNA ZONA PRODUCTORA DE LECHE, CUAJADA, QUESO, POR LO TANTO SUS ACTIVIDADES ECONOMICA CONSISTEN EN LA VENTA DE LECHE, CUAJADAS. DESDE MUY JOVEN SE DEDICA A DICHA ACTIVIDAD PARA PODER AYUDAR CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR. LAMENTABLEMENTE NO PUDIERON ESTUDIAR POR FALTA DE RECURSOS ECONÓMICOS, EN LA ACTUALIDAD LUCHAN PARA BRINDARLES A SUS HIJOS LAS OPORTUNIDADES DE ESTUDIOS QUE ELLOS NO TUVIERON, Y PODER REALIZA SUS SUEÑOS DE TODOS PADRE  COMO VER FORMADOS  A SUS HIJOS EN PROFESIONALES.
GRACIAS A A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE LA CORDINADORA ES  ERLINDA Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA LA VENTA DE LECHE Y CUAJADA EN SU CASA DE HABITACIÓN Y POR ENCARGO EN LAS PULPERIA DE LA LOCALIDAD. ELLA DEDICA A SU NEGOCIO UNAS OCHO HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS PRODUCTOS, PARA SASTIFACER LA DEMANDA DE SUS CLIENTES, BRINDARLE UNA BUENA ATENCIÓN AL CLIENTE, Y EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. EL OBJETIVO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO EN LA COMPRA DE LECHE Y  CUAJADA Y POSTERIORMENTE SU VENTA. G.S. SANTA ELENA AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LE BRINDAN LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA PARA TENER UN NEGOCIO PROPIO Y APOYAR ECONÓMICAMENTE EN SU HOGAR.” GRACIAS INVERSIONISTAS”
texts.en:
The Santa Elena solidarity group is made up of three members; two men and a woman. They are from Sauce which is located in the northern part of the region. They are known as responsible, hard workers with a desire for personal improvement. 

Sauce is known as a milk, curd, and cheese-producing area and therefore most people engage in selling milk and curds. They do so starting at a very young age to help with household expenses. Unfortunately, they were unable to go to school because they did not have the money. Today they struggle to provide their children with the opportunity to have the education that they did not have, and to realize every parent's dream of seeing their children become professionals. 

Thanks to her desire to get ahead, Erlinda is the group's coordinator. Her occupation is selling milk and curd from her house and by special order in the village grocery stores. She devotes about eight hours every day to her business, offering her products to meet the demand of her clients and providing good customer service.  In the not-too-distant-future she hopes to increase her income. Her goal is to invest working capital in the purchase of milk and curd for resale. 

The Santa Elena solidarity group thanks Kiva investors for their help so they can have their own businesses and support their households financially. "Thank you investors."

loans.use: to buy and sell milk, curd, and cheese.

loans.name: Saum

texts.en:
Saum is a married woman with 4 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes, flour, sugar, sweets and other items. Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are locals. 

She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more stock of tomatoes, flour, sweets and other items. Her business goal is to she will have a wholesale business within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of tomatoes, flour, sweets and other items

loans.name: Musalamoi

texts.en:
Musalamoi is a generous woman. She was born in the west-northern part of Tajikistan in 1969 anda  is living in big city with her daughter. She is divorced. She is a cleaning woman and works at a college. Beside her work she additionally prepares salads to orders to canteens. 

Recently, she has holidays and she is planning to treat her teeth. She is requesting a loan from IMON and KIVA to treat her teeth at a dentist. She hopes to be supported and healthy after treatment. She awaits Kiva's lenders kindness.

loans.use: to treat her teeth at a dentist

loans.name: Rorelyn

texts.en:
Rorelyn is 43 years old and married with five children. With three children in school, Rorelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Rorelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like liquor, canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

Rorelyn has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, biscuits, soap, shampoo, coffee, candies and other groceries. 

In the future, Rorelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like liquor, canned goods, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Roselle

texts.en:
Roselle is 32 years old and widowed with three children. With two children in school, Roselle works very hard to provide for them.

Roselle runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk foods, home product care, personal product care and other groceries.

Roselle has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, shampoo, toiletries, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Roselle would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk foods, home product care, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like direct selling avon products and raising pigs.

Myrna dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Rolina

texts.en:
Christina is 16 years old and is first of three children in the family. Her mother Rolina, who is the member of NWTF-Project Dungganon, supports the family through her buy and sell rice business in the Philippines.

Christina, the daughter of Rolina, is studying for a BSED major in mathematics and is currently in the first year of this four year-course.

Rolina is borrowing PHP 7409 to pay tuition fees of the first semester/ 2015-2016.

When she graduates, Christina plans to look for a job to help her parents and to send her brother and sisters to school.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Mercedes Guadalupe

texts.es:
Mercedes, es madre de 3 hijos, los cuales son mayores de edad y solo uno vive con ella los otros dos están acompañados, estudio hasta primer grado, ya que su familia era de escasos recursos y no podían darle la formación educativa que necesitaba; actualmente en su casa vive uno de sus hijos y su padre el cual cuida porque ya esta muy anciano.

Mercedes, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 30 años, sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra para que fuera independiente y para que tuviera sus propios ingresos, actualmente le apoya su hijo en la siembra de granos básicos y aproximadamente tiene que caminar 1 kilómetro para llegar a su lugar de trabajo.

Mercedes, utilizara el crédito para comprar abono, insecticidas y semilla, con estos insumos, la cosecha será más productiva y dará mayores ingresos.

Mercedes, sueña con tener más terreno para sembrar y así mejorar sus ingresos, ya que lo que ella trabaja apenas le alcanza para los gastos de su hogar y no le ajusta para hacerle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a mother of three adult children.  Only one lives with her; the others are in common-law relationships.  She has a first grade education because her family was poor and couldn’t provide her with the education that she needed.  Currently, one of her children lives in her home as well as her father, who she takes care of because he is very elderly.  

Mercedes has been engaged in farming for thirty years.  Her parents taught her how to work the land so that she could be independent and have her own income.  Currently, she helps her son sow basic grains, and has to walk about one kilometer to get to work.

She will use the loan to purchase manure, insecticide, and seeds and, with these inputs, she will be more productive and have more income.

Mercedes dreams of having more land to farm, and thus improve her income because what she earns is barely enough for the household expenses, and she cannot adjust it to make home improvements.

loans.use: to purchase manure, insecticide, and seeds.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is ambitious, admirable and a hard-worker who wants to triumph. She wants to leave her mark on the world. She is very independent and runs her own mixed farming business. She is very pragmatic and considers herself more hardworking than others. Jane started farming ten years ago from scratch to provide for her family. Today, she keeps animals, grows vegetables and other food crops on her farm. 

Jane is seeking a loan of 20,000 KES to pay for farm inputs. Her farm is already ploughed and ready for planting season, scheduled on rain onset. She is going to use the loan money to pay for inputs such as labour, seeds and fertilizer. She will make initial loan repayments using income from her small personal business as she waits for the crops to mature for harvesting. Income from this investment will be used to meet her family's basic needs.

loans.use: To pay for farm inputs to help increase her farm produce

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy construction materials (bags of nails, valves, reinforcement bars, sheet metal, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy his 3rd dairy cow to increase milk production and his income

loans.name: Delmi Antonia

texts.es:
Delmi, de 31 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, está acompañada, su pareja es motorista y tienen dos hijas que están pequeñas y viven en su casa.

Delmi, se dedica a vender ropa para niños y adultos en su cantón y otros alrededores, se dedica a este negocio desde hace tres años, decidió dedicarse a este negocio, porque quiere ayudarle a su pareja a aportar un poco en los ingresos del hogar.

Delmi, solicita el préstamo para comprar más ropa y para comprar un cerdo para cuidarlo y luego venderlo a mejor precio, de esa manera tendrá una mejor calidad de vida.

Delmi, sueña con llegar a tener un bazar de ropa y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Delmi is 31 years old and went to school until fourth grade. She has a partner, who is a driver, and they have to small daughters, who live with them.

Delmi is earning an income selling children's and adults' clothing in her canton and the surroundings. She has been doing this for three years. She started this business because she wants to help her partner and contribute a little to the household income.

Delmi is requesting this loan to purchase more clothing and to buy a pig to raise and sell later for a better price. This way she will have a better quality of life.

Delmi dreams of being able to have her on clothing store and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing and to buy a pig to raise and sell later.

loans.name: Choeun

texts.en:
Choeun is 55 years old and lives in a rural area of the Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of five children and only two of them are in school. 

For ages, the sources of her family’s income are from doing rice farming and raising piglets. Because of her struggles in life, Choeun could make around KHR 69,400 per day to support her family. 

Choeun is now applying for the first loan from VisionFund Cambodia. Through this loan, she will buy more pig feed to support her current business. She expects her business will earn her more income which will help support her family.

loans.use: to buy more pig feed to support her current business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a widowed woman, with 2 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a good area for business and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low working capital. 

She will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. This will enable her increase sales hence increase in profits.. She hopes that in the future, She will be successful. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be visionary. 

She operates a food stall. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low working capital. 

Mary will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to have a stable business within five years. 

She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 44 years old, with three children. With three children in school, Rowena works very hard to provide for them.

Rowena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, and other groceries.

Rowena has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as beverages, canned goods, biscuits, junk foods, soap, shampoo and other groceries. 

In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, and other groceries

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 57 years old and widow with nine children. Two of her children are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines and is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Jesusa has been raising pigs for 16 years and also earns additional income from clothing sales.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 24 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Roselyn is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Roselyn has been in this business for 1 year and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 48 years old and married with eleven children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, detergent soap, cereals, sugar, etc., to sell.

Maribel has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Maribel aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, detergent soap, cereals, sugar, etc., to sell

loans.name: Vannak's Group

texts.en:
Vannak, a farmer living in Battambang province, is 35-year- old mother of four small children. Nowadays, she earns income to support her family living via cassava growing, raising duck and works on other farm fee around ten years. She makes about 113,600KHR per day. In a group of five, she is the group leader. 

She will take her entire loan portion to buy cassava seed, pesticide and pay on plowing fee to support her farming. She hopes to improve her family’s living condition through this loan.

loans.use: to buy cassava seed, pesticide and pay on plowing fees to support her farming

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel, is aged 22, and still single. She manages a direct selling business in their village for almost two years and earns a net income of PHP 3,000 a month. Her net income on her business was usually spent on her school allowances. Due to insufficient capital on her business she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 12,000 to purchase talc powder, lotion, make ups, body spray, and colognes to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase talc powder, lotion, make ups, body spray, and colognes to sell.

loans.name: Birahima

texts.en:
Birahima is a kind woman. She was born in the west-northern part of Tajikistan in 1986 and now is living in a big city with her family. She is married and has two children. 

She has many years of practice in sewing traditional Tajik women's dresses. She sews accurately and in fashion. The design and length of dresses that she sews are attractive to clients. Each day she has regular clients who are ordering dresses for her to sew. She likes to do business serving women at home. 

Her income is enough to feed her family. Her husband is sick and she wants to treat him. She appealed to IMON asking financial support to buy drugs and treat her husband. She hopes to be supported and awaits Kiva lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to buy drugs and treat her husband

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a married woman. She has 7 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a milk farm where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy modern animal feeds to increase milk production. She hopes that in the future, She will be successful. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy modern animal feeds to increase milk production

loans.name: Ma. Nancy

texts.en:
Ma. Nancy runs a sari-sari(variety) store. She sells basic household commodities like edible oil, canned goods, noodles, beverages and toiletries.  She  is 37 year old married woman with three dependents ages 3,5 and 9 year old respectively. Aside from running a sari-sari(variety) store, she engages in buy and sell business. She sells seafood. It has been 13 years now that she engaged in that kind of business.  

She is asking for a loan to buy additional goods for the store, such condiments, soap, biscuits and assorted groceries.  These stocks will attract more buyers to shop and able to augment her income. Thus, Ma. Nancy could now start to pay her obligations and handle her finances. 

She  dreams to improve her both sources of income to improve the family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy additional goods for her store

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.

She earns a living by pig raising in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 27000 through NWTF to buy additional feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She supplements this income with earnings from her fishing.

Marites dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college

loans.use: to buy additional feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Rosebem

texts.en:
Rosebem is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who is 40 years old, with three children who are in school.

She has a car washing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to buy new tools and equipment for her car washing business.

Rosebem has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her car washing business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Maria works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell dried fish and vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Maria is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional dried fish and vegetables to sell for her buy and sell dried fish and vegetables business.

Maria has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Shangwe Group

texts.fr: Denise est commerçante, trésorière  du collectif de crédits «Shangwe», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 30 ans, mariée a un infirmier, mère 3 enfants tous étudient. Elle est distributeur des cartes de communications  dans une avenue animée de la ville depuis 9 ans. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu du salaire de son ancien travail. Pour accroitre son activité, elle va s’approvisionner en cartes d’appel. Elle  souhaite, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Denise is a shopkeeper, treasurer of the loan group Shangwe, an IMF Hekima customer, 30 years old, married to a nurse, and a mother of 3, all of whom attend school. She has been a distributor of calling cards on a lively avenue in the city for 9 years. She started her business with the funds she got from the salary at her former job. In order to grow her business, she is going to stock up on calling cards. She wishes to pay for her children’s schooling and food. In the end, she thanks Hekima for supporting unbankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to stock up on calling cards

loans.name: Heshima Group

texts.fr: Habamungu est commerçante qui s’entraide avec son mari, membre du groupe de crédits «Heshima», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 32 ans, mère 9 enfants dont 6 étudient et 3 sont encore gosses. Elle est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires dans un dépôt du marché de la ville depuis 12 ans. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu d’un crédit. Elle va s’approvisionner en 33 sacs de pommes de terre. Elle souhaite acheter un véhicule pour la faciliter le transport, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Habamungu is a shopkeeper, who works with her husband, a member of the loan group Heshima, an IMF Hekima customer, 32 years old, and a mother of 9, 6 of whom attend school and 3 of whom are still young. She has been selling edible goods at a kiosk at the city market for 12 years. She started her business with the funds from a loan. She is going to stock up on 33 sacks of potatoes. She wishes to buy a vehicle to facilitate transport and pay for her children’s schooling and food. In the end, she thanks Hekima for supporting unbankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to stock up on 33 sacks of potatoes

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane continuous her work as a teacher working with children with disabilities in Metsamor town of Armavir region. She has fully paid her previous loan from Kiva and has a great credit history behind her. 
Gayane asks her second loan to be able to purchase laptop, technical supplies for teaching process and also furniture (table and chairs) for the training room.
 This loan will be a big support for Gayane to improve her working conditions and provide better service for her children. 
She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides informal businesses that do not have access to credit products with start-up loans with soft conditions.
Gayane hopes to receive lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for laptop, technical supplies, to teach children with disabilities and also furniture (table and chairs) for the training room

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy grocery items for resale in her general store

loans.name: Leap's Group

texts.en: Living in a remote area of the Kampong Cham province, Leap is 45 years old. She has three children and only one of them is in school. The sources of her family’s income are from pepper growing and fishing. She could earn about 56,100KHR per day for supporting her family. She is now applying to take the first Kiva loan via VisionFund to create a new business, feeding chicken. Through this loan, she will manage to buy chicken feed and pay for making chicken’s cage. She expects that her business will provide her more income to upgrade her lifestyle than before.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and pay for making chicken’s cages

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Chany's Group

texts.en:
A young woman from Kratie province, Chany is 27 years old and a mother of two small children. 

The sources of her family’s income for living have been growing cassava and working on other farms to get a fee for six years. Her daily income is about 73,900 KHR per day. 

She is now leading a group of three to apply for a Kiva loan via VisionFund. As a group leader, she will manage to buy cassava seed for farming. She hopes to improve her family’s living through this loan.

loans.use: to buy cassava seed for farming

loans.name: Sapha

texts.en:
Sapha is 32 years old, living in Kampong Cham province, and a mother of two small children. 

Nowadays, she has earned income to support her family via cassava growing and a rubber plantation to make more income for ten years. 

She will take the entire portion of her third loan to buy cassava seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide. 

She hopes to get extra income via her business to support her family’s living  and to be able to keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy cassava seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells shoes, socks, basins and other items. He has been involved in this business for three years. His primary customers are locals. 

He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes, socks, basins and other items. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. He hopes that in the future he will educate his children. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes, socks, basins and other items.

loans.name: Farzona

texts.en:
Farzona is a generous woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1988. She is living in her district with her family. She is married and has two children. She has eight years of experience doing business in agriculture and service. 

Farzona plants vegetables in her yard and also sews traditional Tajik women's dresses. She is gentle and an honest person. She takes care of her land and sews accurate dresses that attract clients. She is asking for a loan from IMON and Kiva to buy chemicals for her land in order to have a good harvest. She awaits Kiva lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to buy chemicals for her land in order to have a good harvest

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 59 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Rita is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rita has been farming rice for thirty years and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Deserie

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Deserie works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Deserie has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling herbal medicines in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of herbal medicines to sell. Maribeth has been in this business for eight years. Maribeth earns more income from fish vending.

Maribeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of herbal medicines to sell

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen works hard to support her family. She is married with two children and has a buy-and-sell seafood business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy shrimp, crabs, oysters, fish and other seafood to sell.

Carmen has been in this business for 10 years now, and also earns additional income from a general store. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy shrimp, crabs, oysters, fish and other seafoods to sell.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a rural woman who has had to endure many hardships in life, but she has always found the strength to press forward and continue making progress with her family. For the past thirty five years she has been involved in mixed farming, and her primary source of income has been growing maize, cabbage, tomatoes, and also she keeps dairy cows. Florence has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. Although she has been making profits selling a variety of food crops, she is faced with a challenge of the timely delivery of the produce to the market. This challenge has not made her give up. “I have to do something for my family," she said. 

Florence mobilized other woman in her village and joined Juhudi Kilimo which is a microfinance institution that assists aspiring women like her. She is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike. Florence is from a remote village that has poor feeder roads, and transporting her produce to the market has been a challenge, hence suffering so many losses. Perishable products such as milk, vegetable and tomatoes require timely delivery to the market if you are to fetch a high price and through this loan Florence is going to achieve her dream and goals. Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle, but Florence feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva that help out women so that they can gain respect and equality among their male counterparts. The benefits of this loan are astronomical because Florence will never suffer losses due to delay in delivery of produce to the market. Also she will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market, hence increased income level. Florence is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community because she intends to employ someone who will be riding the motorbike and helping in farm work. With your loan, Florence will improve her living conditions and assure her children a secure future.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport produce to market in a timely manner

loans.name: Jemima

texts.en:
The lack of capital has been a great worry in the life of Jemima, a woman who is dedicated in body and soul to agriculture. For the past five years, she has been actively involved in mixed farming. Jemima says, “I have always had an affinity for farming, and it runs in my blood.” Because of how much she likes farming, she has even nicknamed one of her many cows. She is a very proud farmer, especially when she is milking her cows. Through her dairy cows, she is able to get between 10-15 litres of milk a day, and this helps her support her family. 

Jemima also practices crop farming. She has not been making good profits because of poor farming implements. . This is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. Through this loan, she will be able to buy high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques, and therefore using high-quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and increased profit levels. Jemima is very visionary. 

Her goal for the season is to boost her crop production and be able to get more crop output than the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill. Jemima believes that through this loan, she will be able to turn around her family's life and be able to give her children a solid educational background. This loan will be Jemima’s way out of poverty.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs, high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Betsy

texts.en:
With children to raise, water to fetch and food to cook, Betsy has little time to make money to provide financial support for her family. Betsy is a hardworking and honest smallholder farmer who hails from the Nkubu area of Kenya. From the wonderful Kiva lenders she is seeking a loan worth 60,000 KES to buy seedlings and grow her horticulture business. 

Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident by the steadily rising exports. While experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction because it increases employment and generates income, the government takes little care to ensure that small and poor farmers are not excluded from the opportunities in this market sector. 

It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to give Betsy access to a loan that will aid her in growing her horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increasing employment opportunities and bringing about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. With your loan, Betsy’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and grow her horticulture business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Teresita is 54 years old and has two children who are in school.
