Teresita has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries like canned goods, snack foods, and personal care products to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries like canned goods, snack foods, and  personal care products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs to improve productivity on her farm

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
María, de 42 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, está acompañada, su pareja vive en Estados Unidos desde hace 8 años, tienen cuatro hijos, pero todos son mayores de edad, dos estudian y otros trabajan pero viven en casa propia.

María, tiene diez años de tener tienda de artículos de primera necesidad, venta de ropa y perfumes, ella decidió colocar este negocio, porque su pareja se fue y quedaron pequeños sus hijos y no podía salir a trabajar, por no 
dejarlos solos.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar artículos para su tienda y comprar más ropa y lociones, de esa manera mantendrá sus negocios y podrá asegurar el futuro de sus hijos.

El sueño de María, siempre ha sido que sus cuatro hijos estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Maria, 42, has a fourth grade education, and is in a common-law relationship.  Her partner lived in the United States for eight years.  They have four children, all adults; two are students and the others work, but live in their own home.   

For ten years, Maria has had a store where she sells basic goods such as clothing and perfume.  She decided to set up this business because her partner left, and since her children were small, she couldn’t go out to work and leave them alone. She needs the loan to purchase items for her store, and purchase more clothing and lotions.  In this way, she will maintain her business and be able to ensure her children’s future. Maria’s dream has always been that her children study and become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase items for her store, and purchase more clothing and lotions to sell.

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a 51-year-old married father of three children and a Palestinian refugee. He has been working in his grocery shop for seventeen years to cover his family's needs and expenses. He is a hard worker who is trying hard to develop his business and improve his family's living conditions. 

Today, Imad is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to pay his children's school fees. This loan is very important to him for it will guarantee his children's future.

Imad hopes to expand his business in the future to increase his income and improve his living condition.

loans.use: to pay his children's school fees

loans.name: Kumri

texts.ru: Кумри из А. Джоми добрая и жизнерадостная женщина. Ей 47 лет. Она живет с мужем и 3-мя детьми. Уже 5-ый год как Кумри занимается животноводством. Она очень любит свою деятельность. С самого детства ей нравилось ухаживать за животными. В этом нелегком деле ей всегда помогают ее муж и дети. Присматривать за скотом она еще научилась до замужества в доме своих родителей. Она обеспечивает свою семью, близких и родных молочными продуктами. В данный момент Кумри хочет закупить несколько телят, откормить их и продать с наценкой. Её основная проблема в том, что она не имеет достаточно денег. Кумри надеется на Вашу доброту и понимание.
texts.en: Kumri, from Abdurahmana Dzhami, is a kind and cheerful woman. She is 47 years old. She lives with her husband and three children, and this is the fifth year that she has raised animals. She loves her business very much, and has enjoyed taking care of animals since childhood. Kumri's husband and children are always helping her with her difficult work. She learned how to care for animals before she was married, in her parents' house. Kumri provides her family and relatives with dairy products. At the moment, Kumri wants to buy a few calves, fatten them up, and sell them at a profit. Her main problem is that she does not have enough money. Kumri relies on your kindness and understanding.

loans.use: to purchase a few head of small calves.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is a married woman and has one child. She describes herself to be humble. She operates a retail business where she sells beauty products. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low working capital. 

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable business and educate her children. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products.

loans.name: Sehila Enriqueta

texts.es:
Sehila es una mujer de 34 años de edad, soltera, tiene 2 hijos varones de 6 y 8 años y una hija mujer de 12 años, y su negocio es el tejido de mantas de vicuña. 
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, generosa, comprensiva, paciente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘San Nicolas’, caracterizada por encontrarse sobre una avenida que une la carretera y atraviesa varias zonas de este distrito. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Sehila es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa suelto, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la realiza junto a sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la elaboración de mantas de vicuña; su trabajo consiste en caminar largas distancias en el altiplano en busca de lana de vicuña, la cual asea para luego hilvanarla, una vez que tiene suficiente lana se dispone a tejerla en un telar. Su trabajo es netamente artesanal y cada manta lleva un promedio de 2 a 3 semanas en terminarla, “me inicié en el negocio tejiendo para otras personas, fui conociendo el mercado y me independicé, por el bienestar de mis hijos…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con una lista de clientes continuos, la desventaja es la falta de maquinaría para hilvanar la lana. Su sueño es abrir un atienda de tejidos artesanales, Ella desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de lana de vicuña por mayor, para contar con material de trabajo para trabajar la temporada de invierno. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 7 años que lleva realizando esta actividad de forma independiente. 
Es por esos motivos que Sehila solicita un préstamo para la compra de lana de vicuña por mayor para trabajar en invierno y con los beneficios comprar una máquina para hilar lana.
texts.en:
Sehila is a 34 year-old woman. She is single, has 2 sons who are 6 and 8 respectively and a daughter who is 12. Her business is to weave vicuña blankets. 

She is a good, enterprising, generous, understanding, patient, responsible and hard-working mother.  She carries out her business in the ‘San Nicolas’ area, which is in an avenue that joins the road and passes through different areas of this district. The climate is cold and dry and temperatures range from 0 to 12ºC during the day.

Sehila is dark-skinned, has brown eyes, long black hair which she wears loose, she is short and of slim build. Her mother tongue is Aymara, which she speaks with her family, and speaks Spanish for general knowledge and because of the business she carries out. She lives with her children who are studying in a school. They live in their own house built of brick and cement. The ceiling is made of corrugated metal sheet and the floor of wood. The house has drinking water, electric power, household natural gas and sanitation.

Her business is to make vicuña blankets. Her job is to walk long distances in the high plateau looking for vicuña wool. Afterwards she prepares the wool to tack it. Once she has enough wool she weaves it in a loom. Her work is purely handcrafted and every blanket takes an average of 2 to 3 weeks to be finished. "I started in the business weaving for other people, then got to know the market and became independent for the well-being of my children" she says.

The advantage of her business is that she has a list of regular clients and the disadvantage is the lack of machinery to tack the wool. Her dream is to open a shop of crafted fabrics. She wishes to invest in her business through the purchase of wool in bulk to have enough material to work during the winter season. This is the first group of loans with the institution in 7 years that has been doing this activity independently.
For this reasons Sehila is requesting a loan to buy vicuña wool in bulk to work in winter and buy a spinning machine for wool with the profits.

loans.use: to buy vicuña wool to weave in winter and buy a spinning machine for wool with the profits.

loans.name: Almabilla

texts.en:
Almabilla is a 49-year-old mother of two boys age eight and twelve from Badian, Cebu. Almabilla is engaged in P.O. businesss. P.O. means Purchase Orders. Almabilla gives the stores or malls a Cash Bond in order to become a PO guarantor. This way she will be given PO cards that she can give to her clients which they can use to buy items from the store and Almabilla in return earns an income from the commission that she receive from the malls. She also owned a tricycle transportation business. Her business is thriving and Almabilla is asking a loan to be used as an additional capital for her P.O. business. It will be used as an additional cash band so she can ask for more P.O. cards.

Her income will be for her sons' school fees and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: as an additional capital for Purchase Orders.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos is a single man. He operates a farm where he grows French beans, tomatoes, and other vegetables. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of piped water. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy water pipes for irrigation. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy water pipes for irrigation

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is thankful that she was granted an 11000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expense. 

She would now like to apply for a 15000 PHP loan which she will use to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, frozen foods which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Erlinda dreams of having a bigger general store and aims to give her children the best education to allow them better opportunities in life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for groceries, beverages and toiletries to sell in her small store.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 60 years old now.

Leonida has a buy-and-sell jewelry business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more jewelry to sell. She has been in this business for three years. In the future, Leonida would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Sarah is 55 years old and has three children who are in school.

Sarah has a rice vending business in the Philippines. Sarah requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell.

Sarah has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Sarah would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Lorelyn

texts.en:
Lorelyn is 31 years old and married with seven children. With three children currently in school, Lorelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Lorelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Lorelyn has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, coffee, etc. 

In the future, Lorelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Jovita works hard to support her family.

She has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Jovita is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to purchase additional containers of coconut wine to sell for her coconut wine vending business.

Jovita has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Bridgette

texts.en:
Bridgette is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Bridgette is 47 years old and has three children who are presently in school.

Bridgette has a fishing business in the Philippines. Bridgette requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fishing net, gasoline for her boat, bamboo, and other material for her fishing business.

Bridgette has been in this business for one year. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net, gasoline for her boat, bamboo, and other material for her fishing business

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 57 years old and married.  She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Merlinda requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Merlinda has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Merlinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Erna works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store.  Erna is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to  buy additional fish net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat, and other materials for her business.

Erna has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat, and other materials for her business

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 34 years old and married with six children, four of whom are in school, Melanie works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. 

Melanie has been in this business for three years.

In the future Melanie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc

loans.name: Sok Hean's Group

texts.en:
Sok Hean is a mother of two children who is one in school and others are too young to attend school. Nowadays, she is 37 years old and lives in a remote area of the Kampong Cham province. The sources of her income are from selling grocery items and fishing to earn extra income for ages. She can make around 83,900KHR per day to support her family. 

This is the second cycle for Sok Hean with VisionFund and she has fully repaid back her past loan. She will use her loan portion to purchase more grocery items for resale, to buy pig feeds and build pig cage to support her new business. She hopes to improve her family’s living life style and keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items for resale

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan a 36 years old married woman, lives in Magsaysay, Baliangao. She is a responsible mother for her 2 kids who are now at school age.  Together with her husband who also works with her with their vegetable vending which is the primary source of their income. She has a little space near their house in Magsaysay and plan to plant some corn and beans to earn more for a living and make the land useful. She became a member of Paglaum MPC since year 2006.
Joan think of a better future for her family and make her business more fruitful, she decided to apply for a loan that will enable them to buy seeds, compost and fertilizer, among other items also so that they can provide the best for their needs as the kids are growing up.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost and fertilizer and among other agricultural items, to provide income for the family

loans.name: Mahina

texts.ru:
Ей 26 лет ее зовут Махина. Она замужем. Махина живет вместе с мужем и его родителями. Махина всегда хотела иметь большую и дружную семью и надеется скоро стать мамой.
    Она около 5 лет занимается продажей мужской одежды на базаре. В работе ей помогает свекровь, но в основном за прилавком она торгует сама. Чтобы заработать и обеспечить себя самих и родителей, ей и мужу приходиться выйти на работу в любую погоду. Ее муж рабочий строитель. 
  На данный момент семья Махины решили отремонтировать дом, так как дом срочно нуждается в ремонте и может даже не пережить следующую зиму. Махина обратилась за кредитом для купли шифера и стройматериалов. Ее муж сам будет ремонтировать дом. Махина верит, что благодаря кредиту проблема с домом решится.
texts.en:
Mahina is 26 years old, and is married. Mahina lives with her husband and his family. She has always wanted to have a large and harmonious family, and hopes to become a mother soon.

For about 5 years, Mahina has sold men's clothing at the bazaar. Her mother-in-law helps her with her work, but Mahina usually works at the clothing stall alone. In order to earn money and care for themselves and their parents, Mahina and her husband must go to work no matter the weather. Her husband is a construction worker.

At the moment, Mahina's family has decided to repair their home, as the house is greatly in need of repair and might not last through the next winter. Mahina has applied for a loan to buy roofing and construction materials. Her husband will repair the house himself. Mahina believes that, thanks to the loan, the problem with their house will be solved.

loans.use: to buy roofing and construction materials.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with 3 children. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows. She has been involved in this business for 11 years. Her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of animal feeds due to dry weather. 

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy animal feeds to improve milk production. She hopes that in the future, she will start another business. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds to improve milk production

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a married man. He has 1 child. He operates a retail business where he sells vitenge, cosmetics and also makes clothes. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a good area for business and his primary customers are regular. He will use the Kes 25,000 loan to buy an electronic sewing machine and tailoring materials. His business goal is to have a bigger shop within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy an electronic sewing machine and tailoring materials

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
Carina is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Carina is 53 years old now.

Carina has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. Carina requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like shirts, pants, etc..

Carina has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Carina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shirts, pants, etc.

loans.name: Jojie Aimee

texts.en:
Jojie Aimee is 31 years old and has two children. Jojie Aimee is married and has two children who are in school.

Jojie Aimee is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Jojie Aimee requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and additional piglets for her business.

Jojie Aimee has been in pig fattening for 7 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jojie Aimee would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and additional piglets for her business

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 60 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like breads, canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, etc.

Lydia has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years, and also earns an income from fishing. Lydia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like breads, canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Carillo

texts.en:
Carillo is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 41 years old and has two children who are still in school. She has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

Carillo has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing net, gasoline for her boat, bamboo and other materials for her business. She has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, gasoline for her boat, bamboo and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Salustia

texts.en:
Salustia is 66 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

Salustia has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Salustia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman and has three children. She describes herself to be patient. She operates a retail business where she sells bananas. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of good means of transport. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of bananas. Her business goal is to buy a lorry for transporting bananas within five years. She hopes that in the future she will educate her children. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bananas.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Rosalinda works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Rosalinda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials like fishing net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat, etc. for her fishing business.

Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat, etc. for her fishing business.

loans.name: Shodimurod

texts.ru: Это Шодимурод. Ему 34 года. Он из района Шахритус. Шодимурод живет вместе с матерью, братом, женой, снохой, сыном, дочкой и племянниками. Его жена швея. Она дома занимается шитьем женской одежды на заказ. Шодимурод талантливый и умный мужчина. Он занимается резчиком у себя дома. Шодимурод дома производить сундук и колыбель для детей. У него клиенты возрастают, потому что сейчас сезон свадьбы. Все заказывает сундук и колыбель для свадьбы. Ему нравится заниматься резчиком. Он 10 лет продвигает свою любимую работу. У него много заказов и он не успевает сделать заказы, потому что у него мало инструменты  для производство колыбель и сундук. Шодимурод запрашивает кредит для купли инструменты для работы и доска для производство сундук и колыбель. Он очень нуждается на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
This is Shodimurod. He is 34 years old, and is from the Shahrituz region. Shodimurod lives with his mother, brother, wife, son, daughter-in-law, daughter, and nephews. His wife is a seamstress, and works at home making women's clothing to order. 

Shodimurod is a talented and intelligent man. He works as a wood-carver from home, making boxes and cradles. Because it is currently wedding season, he has had an increase in clients. Everyone is ordering boxes and cradles for weddings. Shodimurod enjoys working as a wood-carver, and has been advancing in his favorite work for 10 years. He has many orders and he can't work quickly enough to finish them, as he has very few tools to make cradles and boxes. Shodimurod is requesting a loan to buy tools for his work, and to buy wood to make boxes and cradles. He really needs your support.

loans.use: to buy wood-working tools and wood to make boxes and cradles.

loans.name: Hanadi

texts.en:
Hanadi is a 44-year-old, married mother of three children. Thirteen years ago she started selling scarfs to help her husband in covering their family's needs and expenses. She has succeeded throughout the years, with her professional sales skills, to gain loyal customers. She now has a good reputation among her region.

Hanadi is an ambitious lady and hardworker who is trying to develop her business. Thus, today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her merchandise with a new collection of fashionable summer scarfs, which will help her satisfy her customers' needs. Hanadi hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new collection of fashionable summer scarfs.

loans.name: Janis

texts.en:
Janis is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past five years, Janis has operated a cereal shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned transportation as a major challenge. Janis dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 15,000 Janis wants to purchase maize ,beans ,rice and maize flour for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize, beans, rice and maize flour for resale

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is a fish vendor residing in the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with six children. Her oldest child is 20 and the youngest is 4.  Her husband is a fisherman. She is the one responsible for selling his daily catch to earn a living. She needs funds to support her source of income.

Raquel has requested a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP to buy fishing net and a motorboat engine. It will really help improve her husband's catch and enable her to sell more fish. Thus, she can provide her family with nutritious diets and better living conditions. She hopes to be able to handle her business properly for the improvement of the family's status of living.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and a motorboat engine.

loans.name: Kimya Group

texts.fr: Alya est commerçante, membre de la banque communautaire «Kimya», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 53 ans, mère 4 enfants  dont 1 scolarisé et 3 sont mariés. Elle est vendeuse des poissons salés au marché de la ville depuis 30 ans. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu d’une aide de son amie. Elle va s’approvisionner en 400 poissons. Elle souhaite augmenter son capital, construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Alya is a merchant, a member of the community bank known as «Kimya», and a client of MFI Hekima. She is married, aged 53, and mother of four children of whom one is enrolled in school and three are married. 

Alya has been selling salted fish in the town market for 30 years. She began her business with funds she received as help from her woman friend. She would like to buy 400 fish to resell. Alya hopes to increase her working capital, build a house, and feed and educate her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for the support it brings to women who are not served by conventional banks.

loans.use: to buy 400 fish for resale

loans.name: No Jesus No Life Group

texts.en:
The "No Jesus, No Life" group is on its sixth loan cycle. They are requesting a total loan amount of GHS 5,600 to expand their various businesses. The group consists of very hardworking women who believe that this loan will help them take care of their families. Each of the group members will  hold each other responsible for loan repayment. The members each sell different items, including jewelry, banku (corn and cassava paste), fish, wood, underwear, fruits, eggs, and wine glasses. 
One member, Cecilia, makes a living selling underwear. Cecilia wants to get ahead and is sacrificing certain things in order to improve the quality of life for her family and loved ones. She will use this loan to buy more underwear and continue with her sales. This will allow her to earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy more underwear and  sell to customers.

loans.name: Unity Group

texts.en: This group of two members is called the Unity Group. Their average age is 40 years old and they have an average of two children at home. They both live in traditional extended families in Chorkor, one of the neighborhoods in Accra-Ghana. Both members are relatives and neighbors who work together, buying and selling such items as mobile phone accessories, noodles, assorted soap and eggs. After successfully repaying all their previous loans, this is the fifth group loan for the members of the unity Group. Mustapha is a member of this group and intends to use his loan funds to buy mobile phone accessories. He purchases his supplies at the main market and sells to diverse clients, who pay in cash. Mustapha hopes to make a good monthly profit, which he will use to meet his family expenses related to health, food, clothing, and school fees. He will reinvest the remainder into his business.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone accessories and sell to customers.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Imagine how small things can change lives! Jocelyn was recently granted a loan that helped her a lot to establish her sari-sari (variety store) business. Through your small act of help, she was able to supply her small store with more grocery stocks which resulted in a higher income and salary. 

Jocelyn would like to ask your sympathy as she pushes her goal further to improve what she has started. She is requesting a 48,000 PHP loan to buy additional stocks of grocery items to sell along with other stuffs.  Jocelyn’s loan will surely bring joy and gladness to her since she sees this opportunity as a milestone to success. Even though at times she faces and walks the narrow roads of life, Jocelyn doesn't lose hope and continues to persevere for her family, especially for the education of her kids. 

To further strengthen this kind of faith, Jocelyn faithfully attends a weekly gathering of her colleagues to study the word of God and share their life stories. Together, they find the hope to continue the race. You are a big part of her milestone! And don't waste this chance to help her reach her goals eventually!

loans.use: to buy grocery items and other items to sell

loans.name: Segundo Eloy

texts.es:
Segundo Eloy tiene 51 años de edad, vive con su conyuge sus 3 hijos menores, los cuale 2 estudian en colegio secundario del caserio El Arenal del distrito de Santo Tomas y 1 en el colegio primario de Palma Central, vive en casa propia de material rustico ,en una comunidad pequeña, es natural del Caserío Palma Central del Distrito Santo Tomas de Cutervo, de la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

La actividad que realiza es la agricultura, cultiva cafe, de la variedad catimor sembrando 1 ha de cafeto de su propiedad,además se dedica a la agricultura hace 14 años y hace 3 años cultiva cafeto, tambien se dedica a cria y venta de animales menores y cultivo de productos de pan llevar, cuenta con mucha experiencia en el rubro,lo que le hace acreedor de buenas referencias.

El destino del crédito será para mantenimiento de dicho cultivo, con ello obtendrá buen rendimiento y mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Segundo Eloy is 51, and lives with his partner and their 3 small children, 2 of whom are in the high school, in the rural settlement of El Arenal in Santo Tomas district, and one is in the primary school in Palma Central. He lives in his own house , made of simple materials, in a small community. He is from Caserío Palma Central  in Santo Tomas de Cutervo district in the Cajamarca region of Peru's central highlands.,

He is a farmer and grows catimor coffee, planting 1 hectare of his property with coffee. He has been farming for 14 years and growing coffee for three years. He also raises and sells small animals and grows basic staples. He has a lot of experience in this line which makes him a borrower with good references. 

The loan will be used to maintain his coffee crop. With this he will obtain good profit and greater income so that he can improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: To maintain his coffee crop.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
A pastor’s wife is considered a model to church members and the whole community in terms of her faith and integrity. Honesty is expected of her when she operates any business or endeavor. Judy reminds herself about this always, and she keeps up her faith to be a good example. She is married to a Baptist Pastor and they have children. They live in Oton, Iloilo where Judy raises hogs for additional income. It is a known fact that being a pastor is a vocation, and monetary return is limited. The good thing is, a pastor’s family is rich in love and care from their parishioners. 

Judy embarked on hog raising as an additional income generating project. Her profits from this project help a lot in their daily expenditures, but she still needs to save a lot for her children’s education. She’s planning to buy more piglets, feed and vitamins to boost her income and savings. She prays for a PHP 22,000 loan to procure all these. Your generous assistance is truly a blessing to her and will surely make her business prosper. She dreams of a bigger space for her piggery someday. She also aspires for a successful life and career for her children, after finishing their college education. 

Judy regularly meets with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more piglets, feed and vitamins for hog raising.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase additional cartons of milk, sugar, sardines.

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es:
Dora, de 53 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, es madre soltera de una joven mayor de edad y está estudiando en la universidad la carrera de enfermería y está cursando su ultimo año.

Dora, desde que su hija nació, se vio obligada a poner un negocio de frescos y panes para poder mantener a su hija, ya 
que el padre nunca se hizo responsable, fue ella con esfuerzo y dedicación que ha sacado adelante a su hija.

El préstamo lo necesita para ofrecer más variedad de productos en su negocio, como por ejemplo panes con diferentes rellenos y frescos de todo sabor, ella quiere ayudar a su hija para que no le falte nada para la graduación.

El sueño de Dora, es que su hija se gradué de enfermera y que encuentre un buen trabajo.
texts.en:
Dora, 53, has a seventh grade education, is a single mother of an adult daughter who is in her last year of nursing school.  From the moment her daughter was born, Dora knew that she needed to start a business selling drinks and breads in order to provide for her daughter since the father never took responsibility. Through her effort and determination, she has been able to get her daughter ahead.  

She is in need of this loan in order to offer a greater variety of products in her store, such as breads with different fillings and beverages of all flavors.  She wants to help her daughter so that she is able to graduate without any issues.  Dora's dream is for her daughter to graduate from nursing school and find a good job.

loans.use: to offer a greater variety of products in her store such as breads with different fillings and beverages of all flavors.

loans.name: Savoeun's Group

texts.en:
Savoeun is a 36-year-old, living in a rural area of the Kratie Province. In addition, she is a mother of four children, two of them are in school and the others are too young. Nowadays, she earns income to support her family condition via cassava growing and also has worked on another farm for five years for fees to make more income. She can make around 80,900 KHR per day. 

She will take her entire second loan portion to pay for labor fees for her cassava plantation. She hopes to get extra income for supporting her family’s living via her business.

loans.use: to pay for labor fees for her cassava plantation.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy materials to make school uniforms.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more of the best selling drinks in the grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a hair drier and other shampoos for use to attract more customers and to earn more income.

loans.name: Saran

texts.en:
Saran is a 29-year-old married factory worker with three young children, who lives in the Kampong Chhnang province in Cambodia. She has been working in the factory for over 10 years. Her husband is a 29-year-old worker cutting the bamboo trees for payments and he also earns additional income from climbing the palm trees to get palm juice to produce palm sugar to sell. One of the three young children attends school. Both Saran and her husband can make a daily income of USD10 a day. 

She has decided to take out a loan because she wants to buy a cow to fatten and breed for calves to sell. This loan will help her have enough finances to buy a cow and improve her family's finances when the cow is able to produce calves. In the future, Saran is going to save money to renovate her house and help her children to earn higher education.

loans.use: to buy a cow to fatten and breed for calves to sell to help with the family income and savings

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase stock in his genge (small store) business.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Thanks for your kindness and willingness to help lenders. Because of your support previously to Juanita, she was able to improve sales from her small operating business- sari-sari store. The income she got from this well aided the family needs then. 

To resume the enterprise, she humbly asks for a financial assistance through a loan worth PHP 50,000. She would like to use this loan as an additional capital for buying more quantity of merchandise products like grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

She hopes that you will not get tired of helping other people like her, because through this scheme of helping, many lives are being changed and transformed for the better. She prays that her business will someday expand and that her family will always remain healthy and strong. 
As of now, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: for buying more quantity of merchandise products like grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase spare parts such as tires, wheel boosters and windscreens, so as to offer better and faster transport to clients and meet both client and family needs.

loans.name: Angelito

texts.en:
Angelito didn't graduate college. This is the very reason why sometimes he has lesser opportunities to high-paying jobs. However, he's never giving up. He's doing all his effort to the very extent to provide for his family. In fact, he has a food stall business right now that he's currently managing. Aside from that, he also sells yakult products. From here, he gets the amount for their family's daily expenses. 

Thank for those who have helped him previously in his loan used to buy greater supplies of yakult. He was able to repay it faithfully back then. This time, he wants again to ask a little of your blessings. He wants to continue the operations of his food stall business and he needs an amount to purchase larger quantities of raw ingredients that he would need in cooking more food recipes. With a PHP 21,000 loan, he thinks this could be possible. He truly hopes that you'll consider his request. 

Angelito hopes that his business will grow bigger and have someday his own business place.He also dreams to have better living conditions and his children finish their studies. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase larger quantities of raw ingredients that he would need in cooking more food recipes.

loans.name: Ana Lidia

texts.es: Ana, tiene 42 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 5 hijos y reside en un sector del municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Ella se ha dedicado al cuidado de su familia, es muy responsable, emprendedora y humilde y siempre a realizado actividades de negocio. Lleva dos años que estableció la venta de tamales de carne de pollo y la elaboración y venta de tortillas de maíz. Está solicitando un préstamo por 3,000 Lempiras para comprar material y rellenar el  patio y nivelar el piso de la cocina donde prepara los alimentos para vende,r ya que cuando llueve tiene ese problema de estancamiento de agua en su cocina y también va comprar un poco de insumos para la elaboración de tortillas. Ha solicitado este préstamo para seguir creciendo y para tener una experiencia crediticia. Su meta es arreglar poco a poco su vivienda para que sus hijos vivan mejor.
texts.en: Ana is 42 years old, married, has 5 children, and lives in a part of the municipality of Cholomo, Cortes. She has worked caring for her family. She is responsible, enterprising and humble, and always has done business activities. She began the sale of chicken tamales and the preparation and sale of corn tortillas two years ago. She asks for a loan of 3,000 lempiras to purchase material and to fill the patio and level out the floor in the kitchen where she prepares the food to sell since when it rains there is a problem of water pooling in the kitchen and also she will buy some supplies to make tortillas. She has asked for this loan to continue growing and to have a credit experience.  Her goal is to fix up her house bit by bit so that her children live better.  established

loans.use: to purchase supplies to make tortillas and also to purchase filler material to repair the patio and kitchen floor.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is 46 years old and married with nine children.

Eliza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

Eliza has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns an income from repair shop.

Eliza aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly is 43 years old, married and has four children.  

She is in the agricultural business pig fattening in the Philippines. Shirly requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feeds and vitamins.

Shirly has been pig fattening for 1 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and vitamins

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 44 years old and married with one child. For the past six years, she has run a general store in the Philippines. Analyn works hard to provide for her family. She has borrowed and repaid six previous loans from NWTF.

Analyn is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell such as canned goods, eggs, soap, milk, and other items. In the future, she aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, eggs, soap, milk, and other items

loans.name: Hannatu

texts.en:
Hannatu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Gogarma village. Hannatu joined Babban Gona to create a better life for her children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Hannatu will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizer, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see her increase her household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Hannatu now has the opportunity to increase her yields and income and use her additional earnings to build a better home for her family.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase the farmer’s yields

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en:
Hamza is a Babban Gona farmer from Tafida Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realize better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Hamza no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to feed his family and children. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top-of-the-line farm inputs such as fertilizer, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  This will see him increase his income considerably.  This season Hamza has ambitious plans to harvest 50 bags of maize. 

Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Hamza now has the opportunity to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Pe's Group

texts.en:
Pe is 35 years old and a mother of two children who are still in school. She is a local resident living in Pursat province. Pe is a rice farmer and she also works as a laborer on another farm to earn additional wages. She generally earns about 22,100 KHR per day.

Pe is the leader of a three-member group loan. She will use her loan portion to buy cassava seed, fertilizer, and pay plowing fees. This will be her fifth cycle. In the future, Pe hopes that her family will have sufficient household supplies with her increasing business income.

loans.use: to buy cassava seed, fertilizer, and play plowing fees

loans.name: Deborah Group

texts.en:
Barbra and Sinikiwe are the two remaining members of the Deborah Group. Barbra is a tailor who specialises in sewing uniforms, sofa covers and bed-spreads. She crosses the border to South Africa to sell these bedspreads and sofa covers. On her way back to Zimbabwe, she buys clothes and shoes to sell in her neighbourhood. 

Barbra has always been one of the strongest and committed members in this group; she has been helping her group members by teaching them how to sew and guiding them on how to run their businesses. With profits from her business, she has been able to buy a new sewing machine to replace the old one. The other group member, Sinikiwe, runs a poultry business from her home. She usually keeps batches of 150 birds at a time. She has been able to send her 4 children to school with the income from poultry rearing.
Deborah group is currently on their fifth loan cycle and so far, they have a good repayment history. The Deborah group needs a $1200 loan and from her portion of the loan, Barbra plans to buy another sewing machine so that she increases her production levels. This cotton industry has just come to life in Zimbabwe and rural farmers will be selling their produce at several market places set up by cotton buyers. Not only will she supply her South Africa market as usual, she will be able to make use of the opportunity that has arisen locally.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her tailoring business

loans.name: Lemuel

texts.en:
This is Lemuel, 29 years old and his partner, Flora May, is 22 years old. They have two small children. They are starting a family and undergoing some adjustments at this stage.

Lemuel runs a “sari-sari” (variety) store in Oton, Iloilo and he continues to work hard in order to maintain and improve it. He is targeting to increase his income and enhance his savings for his family. However, the profit derived from his store varies from time to time as it is usually affected by the competition within the area. Its stability is also shaken by some of his neighbors who have the habit of paying later for those items they get. Sometimes it takes few days or weeks before they pay. He is a kind-hearted person who cannot refuse his neighbors because he understands that there are times when it’s really hard to earn money. But since he also needs to save for his small children, he has to make his business more stable. He can do it by acquiring additional capital of PhP 50,000 to buy more stocks of dry goods and grocery items for his store. With this additional capital, he would be able to boost his income and savings. He’s praying that you have the kind heart to extend support to him and his starting family. It will surely go a long way. He plans to expand his business and open new enterprises someday with the help of his partner.

Lemuel prays for good health and good future for the whole family especially for his children. He shares his aspirations and life reflections with his co-fellowship* members at CCT who regularly meet every week to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of dry goods and grocery items for his variety store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase seeds and manure for reseeding.

loans.name: Apple

texts.en:
Apple is 27 years old and married with one child who is in school. For the past five years, she has run a general store in the Philippines where she sells a variety of items such as shampoo, fabric conditioners, cereal, coffee, sanitary pads, biscuits, candies, and other products. Apple works very hard to provide for her family. 

Apple is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Daiza

texts.en:
Daiza is 25 years old and married. For the past two years, she has been raising pigs in the Philippines. Daiza has borrowed three previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business.

Daiza is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins

loans.name: Mauricia

texts.es:
Mauricia, de 43 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, ya que donde ella vive le queda lejos la escuela, está casada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, tienen tres hijos pero todos son mayores de edad y le ayudan a sembrar granos básicos.

Mauricia, desde joven se ha dedicado a la elaboración de hamacas, pero debido a que donde ella vive no hay tiendas de productos de primera necesidad, decidió colocar una pequeña tienda en donde también sus hijos le ayudan a vender 
después que regresan de trabajar la tierra.

El préstamo lo solicita para comprar más productos para la tienda, ya que sus clientes buscan productos que ahorita no tiene.

El sueño de Mauricia, es mantener su tienda y poco a poco comprar más productos hasta llegar a tener un mini-super.
texts.en:
Mauricia, 43 years old, went to school up to the third grade since where she lives the school is far away. She is married, her husband works in agriculture, and they have three children but all are adults and they help them to plant basic grains. 

Mauricia, since she was young, has worked making hammocks, but since where she lives, there are no stores of basic products, she decided to establish a small store where her children also help her to sell after they get back from working the land.

The loan she asks for is to purchase more products for the store since her customers look for products she doesn't have right now.

Mauricia's dream is to keep her store and little by little purchase more products until she has a mini-supermarket.

loans.use: to purchase more products for the store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle that will allow him to make home deliveries.

loans.name: Maria Maximina

texts.es:
Maximina, de 39 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a la agricultura y la ganadería, tienen tres hijos, dos ya son adolescentes y el otro está pequeño.

Maximina, desde que se acompaño se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y gallinas.

Maximina, solicita el préstamo para comprar concentrado y pulimento para cerdos y gallinas, con esto obtendrá lo necesario para tener más ingresos.

El sueño de Maximina, con seguir trabajando para ayudarle a sus hijos.
texts.en: Maximina, 39, has a sixth grade education.  She is in a common-law relationship, and her partner is engaged in farming and raising cattle.  They have three children; two are teenagers and the other is small.   She has been engaged in raising pigs and chickens since she began her relationship.  She is requesting the loan to purchase concentrated feed and polished rice hulls for the pigs and chickens, and with this, she will obtain what she needs to have more income.  Maximina’s dream is to continue working to help her children.

loans.use: to purchase concentrated feed and polished rice hulls for the pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a food producer from Chepchoina village in Kenya. He and his wife have 3 children, who help them with the farming activities. For the last 23, he has been growing maize of the highest quality. He has also been engaging in dairy and poultry farming to diversify his farm and generate more income. 

This season, Stephen needs external financing to produce more food in order to give his family decent diets and better income. He is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as seedlings and fertilizer. His goal is to obtain a better yield and be able to produce high-quality crop produce.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies, seedlings and fertilizer to improve his farm for high quality crop produce

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jeanette is 33 years old and has four children who are in school.

Jeanette has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. Jeanette requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of ready to wear to sell to her customers.

Jeanette has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Jeanette would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ready to wear to sell to her customers

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for more than five years and she earns well from this. Having a bigger family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her three children. She had to work hard, with the determination of having better income, to provide their children with better education. 

To improve sales, Alicia would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With PHP 26,000, she could already purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Alicia hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family and expnad her business. She also prays that God will always protect and guide her family. 

Alicia meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to increase her product inventory.

loans.name: Rodesa

texts.en: Rodesa is 18 years old, single, and a second-year college student. She is studying a Business Administration major in Marketing Management. She is the eldest child. Her mother manages a retail store for income, while her father is a farmer. Her parents had unstable income; that is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to pay her tuition fees. She wanted to finish her studies so that someday she will get a job that pays well.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores works hard to support her family. Dolores is a widow and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

In the future, Dolores would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a smallholder dairy farmer from Thika, Kenya. He is married and has 2 children. To earn income and meet his family's needs, Fredrick, who is also a vegetable vendor, keeps 1 dairy cow and 5 fowls. His main income source is milk. He has been doing dairy farming for the last 20 years. This year, he wants to solve a problem that has been his main challenge for years. 

Fredrick is seeking a loan to buy a motorcycle. With the motorcycle, he will no longer have to worry about transporting his produce to the market on time. Besides an elegant solution to his transportation challenges, the motorcycle also provides him with an opportunity to make more income by offering transportation services to members of his community.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to deliver his milk and produce quickly to market

loans.name: Karanja

texts.en:
Karanja is an elderly farmer from Thika, Kenya. He is married and has 3 children, all in their 30's. Karanja relies on farming to provide for his family. He started farming 30 years ago and he still enjoys every day of it. His 2.5 acre has 1 cow, 650 heads of poultry and 100 trees. 

Over the years, Karanja has faced serious challenges during dry spells. Lack of water negatively affects crops and animals  that he relies for his income. 
Karanja  is seeking a loan to buy a water pump and pipes. Your loan investment will help Karanja to pump water in huge volumes from the river to his farmstead during dry seasons. He hopes that with this investment, crop failure and animal dehydration will be a thing of the past.

loans.use: to buy a water pump and water pipes to bring water from the river for his animals and farm use during dry spells which has negatively impacted his farming before

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a resident of Ireda-Shamba, Lira district. She is a single mother of two children. She fends for her children by selling cooking oil. However, she wants to improve her business to wholesale to satisfy the increasing demand of her clients.

Betty has applied for a loan of UGX 3,000,000 from UGAFODE to boost her cooking-oil business, which is her main source of income. She anticipates it will increase her sales and profitability. She has plans of building her own business premises to cut down on rent costs.

She describes herself as a hardworking and honest person and equally appreciates Kiva support and UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd for the support rendered to her. She is optimistic she will pay well so that she can access more loans in the near future.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil for sale

loans.name: Chimphagu Group

texts.en:
Married with four children, Esmie sells pots to people in her community. She would like to obtain another loan in order to buy more pots for her business. Esmie started obtaining loans at the microloan foundation, as she wanted to alleviate her household's level of poverty. 

The profits from her business have greatly helped her to improve her family's wellbeing, as she is now able to provide food and clothing to her children. Esmie hopes to build a better house for her family members.

loans.use: to buy pots

loans.name: Saidmurod

texts.en:
Saidmurod is a responsible man. He was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1978. He is living in a remote district with his family. He is married and has four children.

He is a constructor. He has ten years of experience in constructing houses and getting orders to repair rooms. He knows his activity well. He works in order to feed his family and for their standard of living.

He has a sick father, whom he wants to treat. He is asking for a loan from IMON and Kiva to treat his father in hospital. He hopes that his father will be safe and awaits Kiva lenders’ kindness.

loans.use: to treat his father in hospital.

loans.name: Pha

texts.en:
Pha, 32, lives in a small community of Pursat Province, Cambodia. He has two children. To make a living, he manages and operates a farming business of growing rice for sale. On average, he can make earnings of USD 8.00 a day. So far, he has been in this career for more than ten years.

He wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use because there is no latrine in his house now. Therefore, he is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, he can help his family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. He is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow so as to increase the number of litres of milk supplied to clients daily.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more timbers for use in construction, to sell and earn more income.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Flor, de 29 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, está acompañada, su pareja trabaja de jornalero, tienen dos hijos pequeños, viven en casa familiar.

Flor, desde muy joven su madre le enseño a elaborar hamacas, ahora que ya se acompaño siempre trabaja de lo mismo, con el propósito de ayudarle a su pareja para obtener otros ingresos económicos.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar abono y pesticidas, ya que es la época donde se siembran granos básicos.
El sueño de Flor, es que sus hijos tengan un buen futuro y se preparen academicamente.
texts.en: Flor, 29, has a seventh grade education.  She is in a common-law relationship, and her partner works as a day laborer.  They have two small children, and live in their family home.  When Flor was very young, her mother taught her how to make hammocks.  Now that she is in a relationship, she is working in the same trade, with the goal of earning additional income to help her partner.  She needs the loan to purchase manure and pesticides as this is the season when basic grains are grown.  Flor’s dream is that her children have a good future and are academically prepared.

loans.use: to purchase manure and pesticides.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a married woman with two children, who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marites is 46 years old.

Marites has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Marites requested a 13,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fruits to sell.

Marites has been in this business for six years. In the future, Marites would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad, de 57 años de edad, no estudio debido a que sus padres no tenían muchos recursos económicos, solo le enseñaron a tejer hamacas; está casada, su pareja también es agriculto, pero tambien sabe elaborar hamacas y juntos sacan el trabajo a tiempo y viven en casa propia.

Natividad, se dedica a tejer hamacas desde que estaba pequeña y a continuado haciendo este mismo trabajo, ya que solo así pueden obtener dinero para comprar lo que necesitan.

El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar hilos de seda, para la elaboración de hamacas y matatas, ya que se venden rápido, de esa forma lograran cubrir la necesidad que tienen. 

El sueño de Natividad, es tener las fuerzas necesarias para seguir con su trabajo y lograr tener más clientes que compren hamacas.
texts.en:
Natividad is 57 years old. She never studied in school because her parents had limited financial resources but they taught her how to make hammocks. She is married and her husband is a farmer but also knows how to make hammocks and they work together and live in their own home.  

Natividad has been making hammocks since she was young and she continues in this same work. This is the only way she earns the money to buy the things that she needs. 

The loan will be used to buy silk thread for making hammocks which are selling quickly. In this way she is able to cover the costs of her basic needs. 

Natividad's dream is to have the necessary strength to continue in her work and be successful in having more customers buying hammocks.

loans.use: to buy silk thread to make hammocks.

loans.name: Sonila

texts.en:
Sonila wants to add another dairy cow to the existing herd consisted of three cows. Since her family doesn’t own any land where she could plant, the only solution to make an income for the entire family is to expand the livestock.  She is 34 and a married mother of two. From the cows she currently has, she makes cheese, cottage cheese and salted butter; she then sells them to the local farmers’ market located in the nearby city of Korca. Her parents-in-law who live with them as usually happens in the rural contribute their retirement pension of $287/month both.
 
Here is what Sonila said to the Branch Assistant who took part of her interview: “Adding another cow, will create more work for me especially morning times when I have to milk each one of them in a small place like this stable filled with manure during the night, but I’ve got to do it because I have to make a better life for all of us.”

loans.use: to add another dairy cow to the existing herd and making this the primary and only source of income for the family

loans.name: Voeun

texts.en:
Voeun, 43, lives in a small community of Pursat Province, Cambodia. He has four children. To make a living, he manages and operates a farming business of growing rice for sale. On average, he can make earnings of USD 5.00 a day. So far, he has been in this career for fifteen years.

He wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in his house now. Therefore, he is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, he can help his family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration.

He is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Pov, 33, lives in a small community of Pursat Province, Cambodia. He has three children. To make a living, he manages and operates a farming business in which he grows rice for sale. On average, he earns 7.00 USD per day. So far, he has been in this career for ten years. He wants to improve the general living conditions of his entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in his house now. Therefore, he is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, he and his family members can gain access to sanitation, promote health, and lessen environmental deterioration. He is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow so as to increase the number of litres of milk supplied to clients daily.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and maize seeds for planting on his farm so as to get a better harvest for selling and feeding his family.

loans.name: Luema

texts.en:
Luema is 38 years old and married with two children. With two children currently in school, Luema works very hard to provide for them.

Luema runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Luema has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, candies, biscuits, detergent soap, soft drinks, etc. 

In the future, Luema would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Evelyn is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Yesaria

texts.es: Yesería  tiene la edad  de 54 años, está casada y vive con el esposo  y una hija actualmente. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de mas mercadería para su negocio. Con el fin de aumentar las ventas y con ello las ganancias y asi poder ayudar con estudio de su hija y además  mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.  Es el segundo   préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. Élla no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado los préstamos con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Yesería is 54 years old, she is married and lives with her husband and their daughter. With the loan she hopes to buy more merchandise for her business with the end goal of increasing her revenue. With the money she will be able to help with her daughter's education and improve the living conditions for her family. 
This is the second loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR.  She has not previously had other loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR has given her a loan with better terms and lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Adelina is 48 years old and has two children who are in school.

Adelina has a firewood retail business in the Philippines. Adelina requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of firewood to sell.

Adelina has been in this business for two years. In the future, Adelina would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 65 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a business buying and selling in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Amelita has been in this business for 20 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia, is aged 54, married and blessed with three children. She owns and manages a recycling business in her village and earns a net income of PHP 4,000 a month. Due to inadequate capital in her business she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 12,000 to purchase scrap materials, used plastic bottles and other recycled materials for her business. She's hoping that her business will continue to become more productive and profitable.

loans.use: To purchase scrap materials, used plastic bottles, and other recycled materials for her business.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita was encouraged that she was granted an 11,000 PHP loan, which she used to buy ingredients needed in her bakery business. Her earnings help support her personal and household needs.

She would like now to apply for a 20,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy flour, shortening, sugar, milk and other ingredients needed to bake her "hot pandesal" and partly for the maintenance of her oven. "Hot Pandesal" is a rounded bread that is very popular in the Philippines. It is a favorite during breakfast, but is also eaten as a snack. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her, for it will surely help fund her daily needs. 

Lolita dreams that all her hard work will bear fruit, and she will open up branches of her bakery someday. She prays for the good health of her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for ingredients to bake bread and maintain her bakery's oven.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
This is Elisa, 61 year old widow and a resident of Oton, Iloilo.  She can still manage to run a variety store and a small canteen or food stall. For almost eighteen years, her business has been the source of their family income. It provided for their daily expenses and children’s education. 

Small canteen is commonly known in the Philippines as “carenderia”. Most of Filipino families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal.  But if there is only one or two family members present for dinner, they would prefer to buy cooked viand or food. This is a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one or two people when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw food.
