This is the reason why Elisa’s carenderia business is considered valuable. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community, students and working people. 

But the presence of other carenderia threatens her business. She needs to improve her place by placing some appliances like electric fans or a television for the benefit of customers. This method will make her carenderia more desirable. She is praying for a PhP 60,000 loan to buy these appliances. Part of the loan will be allotted for additional quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings. Even at her age, she needs to compete and remain strong in her business, because as a self-employed widow, she has no medical benefits or pension when she retires. She only relies from her savings and any help from her children who are raising their own families too.

She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from her studies of the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy appliances and additional quantities of meat, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings for her small canteen or food stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock up on inventory items for his small bar-cafe.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita, 49, is married to a fisherman. They are blessed with two children. 

For the past five years, Elenita has been selling fried chicken in her town. She earns PHP 1,500 daily. Due to insufficient funds, she is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase dressed chicken, cooking oil, food seasoning, and salt. She hopes that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase dressed chicken, cooking oil, food seasoning, and salt

loans.name: Noryn

texts.en:
Noryn is 34 years old, married, and has two children. Currently, one of her children is in school. Noryn works very hard to provide for her family.

For the past four years, Noryn has run a general store in the Philippines. She she sells a variety of goods in her store. She is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her store. These items include canned goods, rice, feed, soft drinks, milk, cereal, and detergent soap.

Noryn would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy additional items, including canned goods, rice, feed, soft drinks, milk, cereal, detergent soap, to sell in her store

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es:
Doña Gloria, es una mujer muy valiente, que se ha abierto paso en la vida y ha sacado adelante a sus hijos mediante su tienda, donde ofrece a sus clientes ropa y zapatos para adultos, ella es una mujer muy comprometida con su trabajo y una gran clienta para Kiva y MiCrédito, dado que ha tenido, no uno, sino varios préstamos para el crecimiento de su negocio. 
En esta temporada, Gloria, necesita comprar mercadería nueva y a la moda, dado que sus clientes así lo están demandando, esta trabajadora mujer no quiere perder la oportunidad de que su negocio se fortalezca y es por eso que ha solicitado un préstamo que le dé la oportunidad de surtirse de nuevos artículos. Su sueño es poner tiendas en los centros comerciales de su ciudad.
texts.en:
Gloria is a very brave woman who has broken through in life and has provided for her children through her store where she offers her customers adult clothing and shoes. She is a woman who is very committed to her work and she is a good client for Kiva and MiCrédito given that she has had not only one but several loans in order to grow her business. 

At this time Gloria needs to buy merchandise of new and fashionable clothing as this is what her customers are requesting. This hardworking woman does not want to lose the opportunity to strengthen her business and this is why she is requesting a loan that will give her the opportunity to stock up on new items. Her dream is to have stores in the shopping malls in the city.

loans.use: to buy merchandise of new and fashionable clothing.

loans.name: Yenis Patricia

texts.es:
Yenis, de 26 años de edad, no estudio porque la escuela estaba lejos, está acompañada, su pareja es ayudante de albañil, tienen dos hijas pequeñas, que todavía no van a la escuela.

Yenis, desde niña su madre le enseño a elaborar hamacas, ya que en esa zona solo de eso trabajaban, ahora que ya está 
acompañada siempre trabaja de lo mismo, con el propósito de ayudarle un poco a su pareja a conseguir un ingreso más 
para sostener a su familia.

El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar fertilizantes para sembrar maíz y para comprar materiales para elaborar hamacas, de esa forma lograran obtener más dinero.

El objetivo de Yenis, es mantener el mismo trabajo y enseñarles a sus hijas y sobre todo ayudarles para que vayan a la escuela y que sean profesionales en un futuro.
texts.en: Yenis is 26 years old, and didn’t go to school because it was far away.  She is in a common-law relationship, and her partner is a bricklayer’s assistant.  They have two small children that aren’t in school yet.  When she was a young girl, Yenis’s mother taught her how to make hammocks because people in this area only work in this trade.  Now that she is in a relationship, she is working in this same trade, with the goal of helping her husband to obtain a little more income to support the family.  She will use the loan to purchase fertilizer to plant corn, and to purchase materials to make hammocks and, in this way, obtain more income.  Yenis’s goal is to keep doing the same work and teach it to her children and, above all, to help them go to school and become professionals in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to plant corn, and to purchase materials to make hammocks.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa works hard to support her family. Leonisa is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in the market.

Leonisa has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Leonisa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in the market

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is 28 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ana Marie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. 

Ana Marie has been in this business for three years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Teresita

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Ma. Teresita works hard to support her family.

Ma. Teresita has a ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from bicycle transportation.  Ma. Teresita is requesting PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell at her store, including shirts and blouses.

Ma. Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, such as shirts and blouses

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is married and works hard to support her family. She has had a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines for the past five years.

Antonieta has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Terry

texts.en:
Terry is 30 years old and married.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Terry is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Terry has been farming rice for five years and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Chroep

texts.en:
Chroep, aged 41, is married with three children and lives in a community in the Kandal province in Cambodia. Her husband, aged 41, is a worker who works in a nearby country and one of her children is also a worker. The two of them earn approximately $14 a day. 

Chroep would like to apply for a Kiva loan through KREDIT MFI because she needs finance to buy soil to fill in the pits behind her house. In the future, she wants to build a new house and to help her youngest child by paying for a higher-level education.

loans.use: to buy soil to fill in the pits behind her house

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is married and works hard to support her family. She has had a frozen foods and dressed chicken vending business in the Philippines for the past six years.

Paulina has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more packs of frozen foods and dressed chicken to sell to her customers. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more packs of frozen foods and dressed chicken to sell to her customers

loans.name: Rafael Adrian

texts.es: Rafael Adrián  tiene la edad de 50 años, está casado  y vive con la esposa y dos hijos actualmente . El crédito lo quiere para la compra de almacigo y abono y dar asistencia a una plantación de café que quieren iniciar. El desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo para que este le permita tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Rafael Adrián, 50, is married and currently lives with his wife and two children.  He wants the loan to purchase seedlings and manure, and for assistance with the coffee plantation he wishes to start.  He wishes to provide adequate maintenance to the crop as this will allow him to have greater production and thus, have more income.  In the future, he hopes to offer his family a better quality of life and more financial stability, and be able to continue growing as a person and as a producer.  This is the first loan that he has received from Fudecosur.  He hasn’t had any other loans from state banks before, but Fudescor has offered the loan with more convenience and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase inputs and coffee seedlings.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is a married woman with five children, four of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosalia is 48 years old.

Rosalia has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Rosalia has been in this business for six years. In the future, Rosalia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell

loans.name: Damiana

texts.en:
Damiana is 64 years old, married, and has eight children. She works very hard to provide for for her family.

For the past twelve years, Damiana has been running a charcoal selling business in the Philippines. She is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Damiana would like to save enough money to provide her family with a secure future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Zelyn

texts.en:
Zelyn owns and operates a sari-sari(variety) store.  She sells various goods ranging from canned goods, cooking oil, noodles, sugar, soap and beverages.  Aside from operating a sari-sari(variety) store, she engages in fishing. She sells fresh fish to the local in her place. She also raises hogs to have additional income.

She is 32 year old married woman with two dependents ages 7 and 9 year old respectively.
She  is asking for a loan to purchase stocks  for the store and fishing materials, like fishing nets, weights and floater. With the presence of these materials, Zelyn's sari-sari(variety) store will improve its stocks and enables her to have a higher yield. She could now be able to prepare healthy diets to the whole family.

Zelyn is determined enough to improve her sari-sari(variety) store business for sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase stocks for the store and fishing materials

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is a 58-year-old widow from the town of Badian, Cebu. She has two sons aged 13 and 17. For the last 10 years, Narcisa has operated a sari-sari (variety) store to earn a living. Her store is attached to her house and from there she sells household basic essentials such as detergent, coffee, sugar, cooking oil, shampoo, bath soap, noodles and canned goods. 

Narcisa is requesting a loan to increase her inventory by buying more bath soap, chips, canned goods, detergent, shampoo and coffee to sell. She is optimistic about expanding her business so she can continue to support her children in the future. Her additional income will be for family consumption and school fees.

loans.use: to buy bath soap, chips, canned goods, detergent, shampoo and coffee to sell

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza previously accessed an 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities of coconuts and other products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, house hold and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan for her to buy more coconuts and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more stocks of coconut and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a proud mother and a very supportive wife. There is nothing she dreams but to take her family out of poverty. That's why she really helps her husband in finding out ways to earn. 

Previously, she was given a chance to borrow a loan that she used to improve her small sari-sari store. She is indeed thankful to have you part of this as helping hands. By this time, she wants to avail again a loan that she would utilize in buying grocery items to sell in larger quantities. She hopes that you truly grant this request. A PHP 21,000 peso would become a big help for the family. 

Someday, Arlene wants her children have good lives but they can't acquire this in just a snap. Of course,they need to finish their studies. Looking forward for this, Arlene makes everything to bring them good education. 

She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to be used in buying grocery items to sell in larger quantities.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Life may not be so easy as it seems, but when you have hope, nothing would be impossible. That's what Carmen believes and she's thankful that you let her borrow an amount that helped her a lot in her food stall business. Because of that, she was able to increase her profit in such a way that she was able to supply her family with their basic needs at home.

She would like to access again another loan that she would use to buy additional raw ingredients for her recipes and other materials needed in cooking or selling. A PHP 15,000 loan is enough to cater these. She really hopes that you'll entrust her again this time. You know that the main reason why she does persevere in her business is to provide and invest for her family a better future. 

 She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients for her recipes and other materials needed in cooking or selling.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Generally, Filipinos are capable of handling many of life’s adversities well. They are like bamboo which bends but does not break, drawing strength and inspiration from solidarity and togetherness. 

Melanie, aged 47, has seven children with her husband, Tomas, who is a laborer with an irregular income. Raising seven children is quite challenging but Melanie doesn’t give in to hardships and poverty. She doesn’t consider the responsibility for her large family as a stumbling block but instead she sees them as companions in her life journey. They give her the inspiration and strength to work hard. 

Melanie earns additional income for her family from her pig-raising business that she has operated for 15 years. As she continues to develop her business, she now needs additional capital of PHP 10,000 to buy more piglets, feed and vitamins to boost her income. Your generous assistance will surely give her and her family a little comfort. Thank you so much in advance. 

Melanie dreams of a successful life and career for her children after they finish their college education. She knows that it’s not impossible if the whole family exerts effort altogether. Their faith in God will also make it work.
 
Melanie regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members at CCT Credit Cooperative every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from their fellowship and the Word of God. She finds encouragement from their inspiring stories and Bible reflections.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feed and vitamins for her pig-raising venture

loans.name: Kibet

texts.en:
Kibet is a food producer from Kaplelatet village in Kenya. For many years, Kibet has been growing maize/corn of the highest quality. He enjoys maize farming and has secured more land to grow more maize this season. His family is supportive and they help him with the farming activities from time to time. 

Kibet needs external financing to afford the farm supplies he needs. He is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to buy agricultural supplies such as seedlings and fertilizer. His goal is to obtain a better yield and produce high-quality produce. Your support will help him produce more food, which will provide his family with a better diet and more income.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita runs a sari-sari(variety) store.  She sells commodities ranging from dried fish, coffee, shampoo, powdered soap, seasonings, noodles, assorted canned goods, fruits, vegetables and many others.  She is 52 year old married woman with five grown children from Talibon, Bohol. She has been running a sari-sari(variety) store for more than 20 years.

She is asking for a loan to buy assorted supplies like  vegetables, fruits,canned goods, medicines and fishing supplies . These will keep her store full of stocks and able to attract more buyers to come. Thus, her income will improve and able to roll her capital. With these, she will be able to pay her obligations and start to balance her finances.

Perlita is determined to handle her business properly to be successful in the coming future.

loans.use: to buy assorted supplies like vegetables, fruits, canned goods, medicines and fishing supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in lamina sheeting, wood, sand, cement and nails to build a new roof and cement the walls of his home

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 54 years, married to Josephine old and he supports 5 children. 

He has been a farmer for the last 26 year and the business earns him KES 10,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to meet client needs in the region through the supply of milk.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate his children. 

His hope is to be financially stable and be a large scale farmer.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to meet client needs in the region through the supply of milk

loans.name: Peñafrancia

texts.en:
Peñafrancia is already 67 years old today. But despite that, she still works hard to sustain a living for her loved ones. As of today, she is busy selling different merchandise products in their area at Pasay City. With what she gains from the business, she is able to provide for her family's food everyday, including the other basic necessities. 

Life is simple but not easy. However, Peñafrancia is thankful that there's this small group of fellowship that she attends faithfully every week, where she finds encouragement and inspiration to move forward for living through studying the word of God. 

It is also through them that she was encouraged to avail a loan here for better improvements in her small store. Peñafrancia is now letting you know that she wants to borrow a loan worth PHP 25,000 that she would use to acquire greater quantities of variety of products to sell. 

This is now your chance to help in just a little way. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to acquire greater quantities of variety of products to sell.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer owns and operates a food stall today simultaneous with selling meat and frozen products. She has been successful in operating the businesses for many years, and she repaid her previous loan faithfully. From these two inventories, she is able to suffice her household with their basic expenses. 

Relative to this, she would like to take a new loan to increase her profit. She is requesting an amount of PHP 15,000 to buy products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, in larger quantities to be used for cooking her recipes. She is hopeful that you'll be able to help her with this. 

Jennifer hopes for her business to grow bigger and better. She dreams of giving her family a good life in the future and be able to send her kids to college and finish their courses. 

She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, in larger quantities to be used for cooking her recipes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a printer for use in his center in order to provide additional services to his customers for more income gain

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
It’s not impossible to have a better living condition someday. This is Maricel’s wish. She’s married to Glen, a fisherman, and they are blessed with one child. She runs a variety store and she saves little by little in order to expand her business into a big grocery store someday. She and her family reside in Barotac Viejo, Iloilo.    

The people in Maricel's community are quite familiar with each other. When her neighbors ask for credit for her goods, she cannot refuse them. Sometimes it depletes her capital.

As of now, she needs additional capital of PhP 17,000 for her business. She will use it to buy additional items in her inventory. It will stabilize her business and improve her profit despite many debtors in her store. She is praying that you would be one of God’s instruments to help her. She would really appreciate your kind support.   

Maricel is committed to CCT Credit Cooperative’s vision to alleviate poverty and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional items for her variety store

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan, 54, lives in Barotac Viejo, Iloilo, in the Philippines. She is married to Edmundo, who is unemployed. 

Susan provides for her family's daily needs through her “sari-sari” store, which is a small convenience store. Her store is stocked with dry goods and packaged commodities, with almost all of her products being essential household items and food. She buys these goods at wholesale prices and then sells them retail to her neighbors and the local community. 

Because sari-sari stores are very common in the Philippines, competition is stiff. Customers tend to visit the stores with wide selections. This is Susan’s fundamental problem. As you can see in the photo, her store offers a limited selection of goods. Therefore, she needs to display a lot more items to attract customers to her store. 

A PHP 13,000 loan would be of great help to her. She will use the funds to buy goods and grocery items for her store. Your kind heart and generous assistance will solve her problem and may contribute to help Susan attain her dream of having a better life.

All CCT community clients such as Susan are organized into fellowship groups of fifteen to thirty members who meet on a weekly basis. There they share stories of their work, repay microfinance loans, and draw strength and inspiration from their study of the Word of God.

loans.use: to buy stock for her variety store

loans.name: Vecilina

texts.en:
Vecilina works hard to support her family. Vecilina is married and has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines.

Vecilina requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of ready to wear to sell.

Vecilina has been in this business for 10 years now.

Vecilina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ready to wear to sell

loans.name: Elgen

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Elgen works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Elgen is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance for her motorcycle transport business.

Elgen has been sustaining her business activities through NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Ma. Victoria is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Victoria is 50 years old and has one child in school.

Ma. Victoria has a room rental business in the Philippines. Ma. Victoria requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed for the maintenance of the house.

Ma. Victoria has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Ma. Victoria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for the maintenance of the house

loans.name: Nelsa

texts.en:
Nelsa is 33 years old and married with two children. Both of whom are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Nelsa is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Nelsa has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 63 years old and widowed with five children. With one child in school, Maria works very hard to provide for them.

Maria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

Maria has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, Maria would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Wenie

texts.en:
Wenie works hard to support her family. Wenie is married and has a selling ready to wear business in the Philippines.

Wenie requested a PHP 40000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items of ready to wear like kids wear, blouses, shorts, etc. to sell.

Wenie has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Wenie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items of ready to wear like kids wear, blouses, shorts, etc. to sell

loans.name: Yendry

texts.es: Yendry  tiene la edad de 30 años, está casada   y vive con  un  hijo  actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de unos novillos .Ella espera poder engordarlos y venderlos con el peso ideal y  así tener mayores ingresos económicos. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Yendry is 30 years old, married, and lives with her son. She wants a loan to purchase steers. She wants to raise them and sell them at the ideal weight and thus have higher income. She hopes in the future she can give her family a better quality of life, a greater economic stability, and to continue growing. 

This is her first loan received from FUDECOSUR. She does not have previous loans from state banks, and FUDECOSUR has provided the loan with better ease and a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Magret

texts.en:
Magret is 29 years old, married to Cosmas and she supports two children.She has been a dairy farmer for the last 2 years and the business earns her KES 11,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase animal feeds so as to feed her animal and increase milk production produced and sold to clients daily.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her child. Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase animal feeds so as to feed her animal and increase milk production produced and sold to clients daily.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is 31 years, married to Mary and he supports 3 children. 
He has been in a motorcycle transport services business for the last 2 year and the business earns him KES 9,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase spare parts such as tyres, wheel boosters and windscreens so as to offer better and faster transport to clients and meet both client and family needs. 
He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate his children. 
His hope is to be financially stable and purchase more motorcycles to do transport services.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts such as tyres, wheel boosters and windscreens so as to offer better and faster transport to clients and meet both client and family needs.

loans.name: Estilita

texts.en:
It’s the start of rainy season in the Philippines. This season is difficult for fishermen and fish vendors. Practically, it’s dangerous for fishermen to go fishing. The scarcity of fish makes its price higher, and the fish vendors find it hard to afford. 

Estilita, 67, is married to Dionisio, also 67 years old and a fisherman. They have children who are still studying in college and high school. They live in Barotac Viejo, Iloilo. Estilita is a fish vendor who usually sells fish caught by her husband. But due to old age, her husband can hardly go out to the sea to catch fish. In times like this, Estilita has no choice but to buy fish from other fishermen. She needs to prepare for this season of rain, hence she seeks for additional capital of PhP 12,000. Part of it will be used to buy fishing nets for his husband and paint for their fishing boat, while the rest will be used to buy volume quantity of fish. This additional capital will keep her business running even during rainy season because it will strengthen her buying power even if the price of fish is high. You can be the answer to her prayers through your generous support. Thank you so much in advance.

Estilita dreams that someday, she will acquire several fishing boats for rent. The rental fees from these boats will sustain their needs when she can no longer sell fish and her husband is no longer capable of fishing.  She remains a zealous member of CCT where she gains inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who regularly meet once a week to study the Word of God and share stories of their life and businesses. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and paint for her fishing boat; to buy volume of fish for sale

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers for her fish vending business.

Arlene has been in this business for 30 years. Arlene earns more income from a general store.

Arlene has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 50 years old and married with eight children. With three children in school, Nancy works very hard to provide for them.

Nancy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

Nancy has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future, Nancy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn works hard to support her family. Evelyn is married and has a dried fish making business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to make a dried fish.

Evelyn has been in this business for 13 years now.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to make a dried fish

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a food producer from Kaplelatet location, Kenya. He, his wife and children enjoy farming. For many years, Geoffrey has been growing tea among other crops. He also runs a transportation service business on his motorcycle to generate more income. 

This season, Geoffrey needs external financing to produce more food. He is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as seedlings and fertilizer. His goal is to obtain a better yield and be able to produce high-quality crop produce. Your loan investment will boost food production which will give his family decent diet and better income at the end of the season.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as seedlings and fertilizer to have an improved yield

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en: Alfred is 36 years old, married to Mary and supports a family of 4 children. He has been operating in the motorcycle transport for the last 7 years earning KES6,000 per month. Alfred has applied for his first loan of 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy spare parts for his motorcycle for efficiency to customers for income gain. He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to start a taxi business in the area. His future hopes and dreams are to financially stable.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his motorcycle for efficiency to customers for income gain.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 38 years old, married to Henry and she supports 5 children. 

She has been a farmer for the last 12 years and the business earns her KES 10,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops in her farm so as to increase nutrients in the soil for a better harvest and meet client and family needs.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her child. 

Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops in her farm so as to increase nutrients in the soil for a better harvest and meet client and family needs.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 31 years old, married to Daniel and she supports 4 children. 

She has been a farmer for the last 3 years and the business earns her KES 11,000 per month.
 
She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fertilizers for topdressing her crops so as to increase the productivity for family use and others for sale in the market.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her child. 

Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for topdressing her crops so as to increase the productivity for family use and others for sale in the market.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Eva works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Eva is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

Eva has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from dried fish making. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net and maintenance for the fishing boat for her fishing business.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net and maintenance for the fishing boat

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gina is 35 years old and has two children who are in school.

Gina has a general store business in the Philippines. Gina requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Gina has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe works hard to support her family. Ma. Fe is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of motorcycle.

Ma. Fe has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Ma. Fe would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of motorcycle

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith works hard to support her family. Judith is widowed and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines.

Judith requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials and fishing equipment for her business.

Judith has been in this business for 10 years now.

Judith would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and fishing equipment for her business

loans.name: Daphne

texts.en:
Daphne works hard to support her family. Daphne is married and has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines.

Daphne requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional unit of bicycles for her business.

Daphne has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Daphne would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional unit of bicycles for her business

loans.name: Ebe

texts.en:
Ebe is 43 years old and married with two children. Ebe works very hard to provide for them.

Ebe runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks like coffee, sugar, noodles, biscuits, soft-drinks, beers, snack foods, etc. to sell.

Ebe has been in this business for 1 year and sells a variety of items such as coffee, sugar, noodles, biscuits, soft-drinks, beers, snack foods, etc. 

Ebe would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks like coffee, sugar, noodles, biscuits, soft-drinks, beers, snack foods, etc. to sell

loans.name: Juan Omar

texts.es: Juan Omar  tiene la edad de 65 años, está casado   y vive con  la esposa y un  hijo   actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de unas vacas de doble propósito .El espera poder obtener  leche y queso para vender a los negocios y vecinos y engordar las crías  y venderlos con el peso ideal y  así tener mayores ingresos económicos. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Juan Omar is 65 years old, married, and currently lives with his wife and one child. He wants the loan to purchase some dual purpose cows. He hopes to be able to have milk and cheese to sell to businesses and neighbors and fatten up the young to sell them at the ideal weight to maximize earnings. 

He hopes to provide for his family in the future a better quality of life and greater economic stability, and to be able to continue raising cattle. This is the first loan he'll have received from FUDECOSUR. He has not previously taken out loans from state-run banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided a loan with greater facility and much lower interest.

loans.use: purchase dual purpose cattle.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, coffee, eggs, etc for her general store business.

Judith has been in this business for 3 years. Judith earns more income from farming vegetables.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, coffee, eggs, etc

loans.name: Melaluna

texts.en:
Melaluna works hard to support her family. Melaluna is married and has a ice cream making business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like milk, salt, ice cubes, sugar, etc..

Melaluna has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Melaluna would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like milk, salt, ice cubes, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is a food producer from Kitale Kenya. He and his wife Veronicah have 3 children, who help them with the farming activities. For the last 8 years, he has been growing maize/corn of the highest quality. He has also been engaging in dairy, poultry and tree farming to diversify his farm and generate more income. Titus' wife runs a small retail outlet at the local market.

Titus needs external financing to produce more food on his farm. He is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as seedlings and fertilizer for planting more maize. His goal is to obtain a better yield and be able to produce high-quality crop produce. Your loan investment will pay off after harvesting when his family will have improved diets and more income to offset the loan.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as seedlings and fertilizer to improve his maize crop

loans.name: Muziza Central Farmers Association Group

texts.en:
Muziza central mixed farmers group is found in a trading centre –bugarama- Ibanda district. The group is comprised of men and women who deal in agriculture and some small scale businesses.

Lawrence is a married man with two children which are all in school. Lawrence sells agricultural products like matooke, yellow bananas and cereals to the nearby towns of Katafari and Bugarama. He runs his business with a small amount of capital. He has requested for a loan of UGX.700,000 to add in his working capital so as to increase his cash flow. He will use the rest of the money to pay school fees for his children and buy them a few basic needs. His customers are people around those towns who come and buy her products from home. His major challenge is harsh weather conditions like drought, pests and rain which affect him during his business operations.

Despite all these challenges, Lawrence is a very hard working man who is striving hard to provide a good education and a good standard of living for his children. The group appreciates Kiva and UGAFODE support.

loans.use: To boost food sales on his stall where he sells fruits, cereals and local dishes

loans.name: Nueva Ticamaya Group

texts.es: Wilfredo, tiene 29 años de edad, esta casado, tiene dos hijos, reside en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Puerto Cortes. El se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de maíz, además realiza trabajos de jornal en corte de palma africana. Lleva 5 años de obtener sus propios ingresos para su familia y su meta es aumentar la producción del cultivo de maíz para mejorar los ingresos y dar mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Wilfredo ha solicitado un préstamo en forma grupal, formado por 11 personas y cada uno ha solicitado 4,500 Lempiras haciendo un total por 49,500 Lempiras, con este préstamo piensan hacer reparaciones y mejoras a la Iglesia cristiana Evangélica de la comunidad con el propósito de beneficiar a muchas personas que asisten a la Iglesia. Todos los integrantes del grupo se dedican a la agricultura y viven en la misma comunidad. En la foto están a la izquierda María, Francisca, Marlen, Gema y Ana a la derecha. Atrás están los hombres a la izquierda esta José David, José, Melvin, Ubaldo, Esteban y Wilfredo a la derecha.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is 29 years old, married, and has two children. He resides in a village pertaining to Puerto Cortes municipality. Wilfredo is a farmer who grows corn and, in addition, works as a laborer, harvesting African palm oil. Wilfredo has done this for five years, earning an income for his family. His goal is to increase corn production in order to improve his income and offer his family a  better quality of life.

Wilfredo is requesting a loan for his group, made up of eleven people, each soliciting 4,500 Lempiras, for a total of 49,500 Lempiras. With this loan, they plan to make repairs and improvements to their community's Christian Evangelist Church.

All of the group members are farmers and live in the same community. In the photo are left to right in the front row: Maria, Francisca, Marlen, Gema and Ana. In the back row left to right are the men: Jose David, Jose, Melvin, Ubaldo, Esteban and Wilfredo.

loans.use: make repairs and improvements in their community's Christian Evangelist Church.

loans.name: Nuha

texts.en:
Nuha is a 36-year-old married woman from a village near Nablus city. She is a mother of two sons and two daughters. Three years ago, she started her own business doing traditional sewing. She makes very beautiful pieces and sells to the local clients.

Nuha took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new sewing machine for her business. This will increase her productivity and also her sales.

Nuha appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For the purchase of sheets of metal and wood to finish the remodeling of his home.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean is a young mother to three children aged two, four and five. She is from Alegria, Cebu. Jean is a Sari-sari store owner, a business she started three years ago. In her store, she sell sachet items like coffee, detergent powder, soy sauce, chips, biscuits, noodles and canned goods. She is asking a loan of PHP6000 to buy additional stocks of shampoo, conditioner, chips, canned goods, eggs and seasoning. Jean plans to include variety of items in the future for better profitability.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, conditioner, chips, canned goods, eggs and seasoning

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Viginia is 60 years old, married and lives in Bigaan, Baliangao Misamis Occidental. She has a little banana farm beside her house in Bigaan which is the primary source of income for her family. To generate a bigger income, she wants to plant more bananas and grow root crops to make her land space more productive. She wishes to have more produce and be able also to supply agri-products in the market so she recently requested to loan to pay for the cleaning, plowing and holing of the land and planting of seedlings. She borrowed from Paglaum MPC.

loans.use: To pay for the cleaning, plowing and holing of the land and planting of seedlings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more retail stocks for sale for more income gain.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs like fertilizer and cereals seedlings for planting in order to yield high production and more income gain

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 62 years old and single.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her general store.

Ofelia has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future Ofelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ladylou

texts.en:
Ladylou works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Ladylou requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.  She has been in this business for twenty years now.

In the future, Ladylou would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 37 years old and married with two children. With two children currently in school, Lorna works very hard to provide for them.

Lorna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, soft-drinks, candies, breads, eggs, etc. to sell.

Lorna has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, soft-drinks, candies, breads, eggs, etc. 

In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, soft-drinks, candies, breads, eggs, etc. to sell

loans.name: Asina

texts.en:
Pamella is 43 years old, married to Peter and she supports 9 children. 

She has been a livestock keeper such as goats for the last 16 years and the business earns her KES 11,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to supply milk to clients daily and meet their demand in milk supply.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her child. 

Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to supply milk to clients daily and meet their demand in milk supply.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 29 years old, married to Rashid, and supports a family of two children. She has been practicing small-scale farming for the last 12 years, earning KES 14,000 per month.

Hellen has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy farm inputs for use on the farm, for high production and supply for more income gain.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and to start a retail shop in the area. Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs for use on the farm, for high production and supply for more income gain.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply more milk with her motorcycle for more income gain.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie works hard to support her family. Rosie is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her general store.

Rosie has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Rosie would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rolaine

texts.en:
Rolaine is 25 years old with one children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, can goods, chips, etc.

Rolaine has borrowed and paid 1 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, can goods, chips, etc

loans.name: Sreynet

texts.en:
Sreynet is 25 years old and a married factory worker with two children. She lives in the Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. She has worked in a factory since 2012. Her husband is 25 years old and works as a worker who makes concrete sewers. Sreynet and her husband can earn around $15 a day.

The place where her husband works is not very far from home, and his work is not very busy, so she wants her husband to fatten animals at home. Now Sreynet is requesting a loan to buy a cow and piglets for her husband to fatten and sell.

This loan will help improve her family’s finances. In the future, she is going to save money to build a new house and help her children in earning high school diplomas.

loans.use: to buy a cow and piglets for her husband to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Emiliano

texts.es: Emiliano tiene la edad  de 46 años, está en unión libre, vive con la esposa y un hijo. Con su crédito pretende comprar algunas plantas de almácigo para hacer resiembras a inicio de lluvias esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Emiliano is 46 years old, is in common-law marriage, and lives with his wife and child. With his loan he will buy coffee seedlings and transplant them into the fields once the rainy season begins, with the objective of increasing the plant density per area. With these improvements to his crop, he hopes to obtain greater earnings, and in doing so be able to improve his quality of life and to accomplish some of his life goals.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He had not previously had any other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him the loan with more services and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy coffee seedlings.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 31 years old, married, and supports a family of four children.

She has been practicing farming for the last eight years, earning KES 14,000 per month.

Caroline has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy certified seeds and farm inputs to use for a better harvest and more income.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and to expand into a retail business in the area.

Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy certified seeds and farm inputs, to use for high production and supply for more income gain.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a fifty-six-year-old married mother of four children. Forty-two years ago, when she got married, she started farming to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their family. Today, she practices poultry and lumber farming for subsistence and commerce respectively.

Throughout the years, she has learnt a lot about agribusiness and how to make loyal customers. She is requesting a loan to buy more poultry to shift the poultry farm to being commercial. This is in a bid to increase the income she makes from selling poultry products so that she can take care of her family's increasing needs.

Mary's aspiration is to improve the living conditions of her children and grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Ana Noemi

texts.es:
Ana Noemí tiene 19 años de edad, conviviente, con un hijo a su cargo, vive en casa familiar, domicilio en la AV JOSE OLAYA ubicada en el distrito de OYOTUN, provincia de Chiclayo,Región Lambayeque, Costa Norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, hace 02 años, negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo; compra de cerdos, patos, gallina, cuyes, el préstamo le ayudará para tener una mayor inversión, esto con la finalidad de hacer crecer su negocio ssatifacer las necesidades de sus clientes así generar mayores ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana Noemí is 19 years old, resides with a live-in partner, and has a child under her care. She lives in the family home, located in the Jose Olaya Avenue in the Oyotun District, Chiclayo Province, Lambeyeque Region, on the northern coast of Peru.

She has worked in the raising and sale of barnyard animals for 2 years. Her business is located in her own home. She requests a loan to purchase working capital; pigs, ducks, chickens, and guinea pigs. The loan will help her have a larger investment, which will serve the purpose of making her business grow and satisfy the needs of her customers. By doing this, she will generate a greater income and so improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase small animals for fattening and afterwards be sold.

loans.name: Yorleny

texts.es: Yorleny  tiene la edad de 38 años, está en unión libre   y vive con el esposo y cuatro hijos   actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de unos cerdos pequeños y el concentrado para su alimentación .Ella espera poder engordarlos y venderlos con el peso ideal y  así tener mayores ingresos económicos. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Yorleny is 38 years old and is in a common law relationship. She lives with her partner and their four children.
She wants the loan to buy a few small pigs and the feed to nourish them. She hopes to be able to fatten them up and sell them at the ideal weight and in this way have a better economic income. She hopes that in the future she will be able to give her family a better quality of life and better economic stability as well as to continue growing. 
This is the first loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR. She has not had any previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR has given her a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: San Martin De Tours Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE TOURS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Huarocondo, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Asunta Eudiz ella es casada y tiene 46 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes y restaurant, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas.
La socias que estan pegados a la foto grupal se le tomo la fotos despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The lending bank "San Martin de Tours" is located in the district of Huarocondo in the province of Anta and the department of Cusco.

One member, Asunta Eudiz, is 46 years old and has four children. Her business is a grocery store and restaurant. She sells basic goods like rice, sugar, milk and cookies. She wants to make progress through her business. She is a hardworking and dedicated woman, and her dream is to be able to grow the grocery store. She asks for a loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

The women whose photos are separate from the group had to take them after the meeting due to work commitments. The other members of the group have businesses including: selling food, animal sales, grocery store, restaurant.

Asunta Eudiz is grateful to those who are a part of her dream through this platform, and promises to make her payments in the established time period.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

loans.name: Leonardo Sixto

texts.es: Leonardo es un hombre de 64 años que vive junto a su esposa que se llama Alva. Ambos viven juntos desde hace mucho tiempo en la localidad rural de Pausa ubicada en el departamento de Ayacucho. Ambos se dedican a la agricultura, pero también a la cria de ganado vacuno. Leonardo solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar dos vacas pequeñas orgánicas, dado que ellos venden en su localidad carne de res orgánica. Parte del crédito sera usado para comprar alimentación balanceada orgánica y natural. En el futuro Leonardo espera poder darle a su esposa una buena calidad de vida y sobre todo estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Leonardo is a man of 64 who lives with his wife, who is named Alva. They have lived together in this rural area in Pausa, in the department of Ayacucho, for a long time. They both work in agriculture but also in the raising of cattle. 

Leonardo is applying for the micro-loan to be able to buy two young organic cows, given that they sell organic beef in his area. Part of the loan will be used to buy balanced organic and natural feed. In the future, Leonardo hopes to be able to give his wife a good quality of life and above all, economic stability.

loans.use: to buy two young organic cows and their feed

loans.name: Rosibeth

texts.es: Rosibeth  tiene la edad de 58 años, está casada y vive con el esposo actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de almacigo y abono y dar asistencia a una plantación de café que quieren iniciar. Ella desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo para que este le permita tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Rosibeth, 58, is married and lives with her husband. She wants a loan to buy seedlings and compost to help a coffee plantation that she and her husband want to start. She wants to be able to maintain the crop well so that they will have greater production and therefore greater income.

Her hope for the future is to give her family a better quality of life and more financial stability, and to be able to keep growing as a person and as a producer.

This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR. She hasn't had any other loans from traditional banks, but FUDECOSUR has given her a loan more easily and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Jardines De La Luz Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “JARDINES DE LA LUZ”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Margot Darleny ella es soltera y tiene 43 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de comida, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere que sus hijos que terminen de estudiar, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant grande. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pollo, verduras, arroz y carne.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de tortas, negocio de imprenta, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de cosméticos.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The lending group "Jardines de la Luz" is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Margo Darleny, 43, is single and has four children. She sells food. She is a dedicated woman who wants her business to enable her children to finish school. Her dream is to have a big restaurant.
She asks for a loan to buy chicken, vegetables, rice and beef.

She is grateful to those who are part of her dream through this platform and promises to make her payments in the established time period.

The pictures that are added to the group photo had to be taken after the meeting because of work commitments.

The other members of the group sell sandwiches, cosmetics, groceries, and offer printing services.

loans.use: to buy chicken, vegetables, rice and meat.

loans.name: Ghazala

texts.en:
Ghazala is a 47-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her one child. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Ghazala is also providing sewing services and earning an income to contribute with her husband to manage the household. 

She needs different kinds of goods e.g. needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc. for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these accessories and will help her to increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Ghazala is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified seeds to plant and then sell and gain more income

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is 48 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell of nipa roofing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional nipa roofing to sell.

Aileen has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell of nipa roofing business for 15 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Serengeti Group

texts.en:
MARY, who is in her late 50s, is married with one grown-up child and is staying with grandchildren who are still in school. She has been running a grocery store for ten years now. She works from 10am to 09pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be MARY's 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to keep on increasing drinks in the store and started selling spirits and wines.  She is doing fine and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees for her grandchildren, take care of a grandchild's wife, repay loans, save some in her bank account and cover household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy the fast moving drinks for her grocery store.  She dreams of owning a successful business.

Mary will share this loan with her loan group Serengeti which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the fast moving drinks  for her grocery store.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a 37-year-old married mother of four children. A few months ago, she opened her own grocery shop in an attempt to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children. She is a hard worker and ambitious lady who is trying hard to develop her business. Lina's children are her priority and she is always trying desperately to improve their living conditions.
 
Today, Lina is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her children's school tuition fees and increase her merchandise with new summer items to satisfy her customers' requests in the upcoming holy month of Ramadan.

Lina hopes to expand her business in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees and to increase her merchandise with new summer items

loans.name: Keremensia

texts.en:
Keremensia is a 54-year-old married mother of five children. Forty years ago, when she got married, she started farming to help her husband provide for their family. Currently, she practices dairy, poultry, horticulture and lumber farming. Throughout the years, she has succeeded in growing the business and gaining loyal customers. 

As her children are growing up, the family needs are increasing. She is requesting a loan to buy more poultry to increase the income she makes from selling poultry products.
   
Keremensia hopes to grow her farm business in the future in order to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional stock of cooking oil, sugar, salt and baking flour for making snacks for resale

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 40 years old, married to Wilfred and she supports five children.
 
She has been a livestock keeper for the last 13 years and the business earns her KES 11,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase a dairy cow for milk production to supply milk to clients who have increased in the region daily.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her child. 

Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow to supply milk to clients who have increased in the region daily.

loans.name: Truphena

texts.en:
Truphena is 50 years old, married to George and supports a family of 5 children. She has been selling farm supplies for the last 9 years, earning KES8,000 per month. 
Truphena has applied for her first loan of KES25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy more stocks of farm produce for sale to increase her income. She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and to start a retail shop in the area. Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of farm produce for sale for more income gain.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is married and has 2 sons and one daughter. He is a part-time-teacher but his monthly income cannot cover his family's monthly expenses. Mohammad started a cleansers shop to increase his income and he requests a 5000 EGP loan to buy more cleansers for his shop to expand his business, increase his sales and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy cleansers.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a hardworking 41-year-old farmer from Kebeneti village in Kenya. She has been doing dairy farming for so many years to help her husband in providing for their family. Throughout the years, she has succeeded in growing the business and gaining loyal customers. 

As her children are growing up, the family needs are increasing. She is requesting a loan to buy cow feed and start keeping poultry. She hopes to make more income from selling poultry products. She will also use a fraction of the loan to give her animal shed a face-lift. Irene hopes to grow her farm business in the future in order to increase her income and improve her family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy poultry and cow feed

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 29 years old, married to Jeremiah and supports a family of two children. 

She has been practicing farming for the last 12 years, earning KES 12,000 per month. 

Joyce has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy farm tools like a digging hoe, shovel and fork for use on the farm for high production and supply to gain more income. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and to start a retail shop in the area. 

Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy farm tools like a digging hoe, shovel and fork for use on the farm for high production and supply to gain more income

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is a caring 35-year-old farmer from Kuserwo village in North Rift Kenya. She has been doing farming for many years and using the income to cover the needs and expenses of her family. She practices dairy farming but is looking to start poultry farming. 

Stella is requesting a loan of KES 80,000 to start poultry farming. Of the amount borrowed, KES 40,000 will go to acquisition of chicks, KES 20,000 will be used to buy chick mash (feed) and another KES 20,000 will be spend on a special house for the chicks.
  
As her children are growing up, the family needs are increasing. She is going to work hard to ensure the poultry venture takes off so that she can increase her family's income from selling poultry products. 
   
Stella hopes to grow her farm business in the future in order to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy chicks, poultry feed and a chicken coop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Pius

texts.en:
Pius 57 years old, is married and supports seven children. He is a small scale farmer earning an income of KES14,000 per month.
