He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase farm inputs to increase his revenue. He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and improve family living standards. His hope is to lead a better life.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Faramalala

texts.fr:
Faramalala est une femme débrouillarde et travailleuse de 40 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants dont trois d'entre eux qui sont âgés de 18, 10, et 6 ans sont actuellement scolarisés dans des écoles privées.
Faramalala a une double spécialité: pâtisserie et couture. L'activité de confection de vêtements est plutôt récente car elle ne l'a démarré que depuis le mois d'octobre 2014 tandis que la pâtisserie est son occupation depuis toujours.
C'est une femment ayant de la volonté qui ne cherche qu'à améliorer le niveau de vie de la famille par le biais de ses activités.
Sa priorité actuelle est l'éducation de ses enfants surtout le 18 ans qui est en classe de terminale et en préparation de son baccalauréat et son objectif est d'ouvrir un atelier de couture.
texts.en:
Faramalala is a self-sufficient, hard-working 40-year-old woman.  She is married and has four children.  Three of her children are eighteen, ten and six, and they all attend private school.

Faramalala is skilled in two activities, pastry-making and sewing.  She has always made pastries but recently (October 2014) started sewing as well.  Her one aim is to improve the standard of living of her family through her activities.  She is currently trying to provide for the education of her children, particularly the eighteen year old who is preparing for the final year baccalaureat exams.

In the future, Faramalala would like to open a sewing workshop.

loans.use: to buy an overlocking sewing machine, a saddle stitcher, 100 metres of fabric and different coloured threads.

loans.name: Safina Group

texts.fr: Kitunyema est commerçante, conseillère de la banque communautaire «Safina», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, veuve, âgée de 48 ans, mère 6 enfants dont 4 étudiants et 2 sont mariés. Elle est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires dans le centre commercial de la place depuis 32 ans. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de sa famille. Elle va s’approvisionner en 4 sacs de manioc et 4 de maïs. Elle souhaite augmenter son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Kitunyema is forty-eight years old, widowed and has six children.  Four of her children attend school and the other two are married.  She is a trader, advisor with the community bank 'Safina' and works with the field partner, Hekima.

Kitunyema has been selling basic food stuffs in the local commercial centre for thirty-two years.  She began her business with funds from her husband.  She has requested this loan to increase her working capital and buy four sacks of cassava and four sacks of maize.  She would like to be able to provide for the education costs and food for her children.

Kitunyema is grateful to Hekima, for the support they offer to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 4 sacks of cassava and 4 sacks of maize for resale.

loans.name: Wariti Group

texts.fr: Siherya est commerçante, membre de la banque villageoise «Wariti», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 65 ans, mariée à un pasteur d’une église locale, mère 6 enfants dont 5 étudient 1 est deja mariée. Elle est vendeuse des pagnes au marché de la ville depuis 10 ans. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son fils. Elle va acheter de 15 pièces de pagnes. Elle souhaite maintenir son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Siherya is sixty-five years old, married to the pastor in the local church, and has six children.  Five of her children attend school and the other one is married.  She is a trader, member of the 'Banc Villageoise' Wariti, and works with the field partner, Hekima.

Siherya has been selling pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) in the local market for ten years.  She began her business with funds from her son.  She has requested this loan to maintain her working capital and buy fifteen pagnes.  She would like to be able to provide for the education costs and food for her children.

Siherya is grateful to Hekima, for the support they offer to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 15 pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) for sale.

loans.name: Matumaini Group

texts.fr: Esther est commerçante, membre du groupe de credits «Matumaini», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un agent de l’ordre, âgée de 29 ans, mère de 5 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse des divers produits manufacturés et propriétaire d’une boutique a son domicile depuis 10 ans. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle va acheter du sucre, riz, savon Omo, huiles, etc. Ainsi, elle souhaite construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.Nous tenons à signaler qu’une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en:
Esther is twenty-nine years old, married to a law enforcement official and has five children who all attend school.  She is a trader, member of the loan group Matumaini, and works with the field partner, Hekima.

Esther has been selling various products from the shop in her home for ten years.  She began her business with funds from her husband.  She has requested this loan to buy sugar, rice, Omo soap, oils, etc.  She would like to use her earnings to build a house and provide for the education costs of and food for her children.

Esther is grateful to Hekima, for the support they offer to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

It should be noted that one person in the photo is holding a child.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, Omo soap, oils, etc for resale.

loans.name: Uktamkhon

texts.ru: Эту сильную женщину зовут Уктамхон. Ее девиз "начинать никогда не поздно". С такими словами она начинает свой бизнес. Уктамхон будет заниматься продажей фруктов. У нее уже есть свой бизнес план и только осталось получить финансирования на совершения плана. Уктамхон вдова и много сил потратила на воспитание детей. И всю жизнь посвятила им. Сейчас у нее четверо сыновей и все они находятся на заработках в загранице. Уктамхон в жизни через многое прошла и уверена, что сможет справиться с новым бизнесом. Она уже нашла место на базаре и договорилась с поставщиками товара. Ей только нужны средства для приобретения фруктов на продажу. Поддержите Уктамхон в ее начинаниях.
texts.en: Meet Uktamkhon, a strong woman whose motto is: "it's never too late to start".  Following her own words, Uktamkhon is in the process of starting a new business and will be selling fruits.  She already has a business plan and only needs to receive some financing to carry out her project.  Uktamkhon is a widow and she has worked very hard to raise her children.  She has devoted her entirely life to them.  Her four sons are now all working abroad.  Uktamkhon has gone through a lot in life, and she is confident that she will be able to handle her new business.  She has already found a retail outlet at the market and she has come to an agreement with merchandise suppliers.  The only thing that she still needs is the money to buy fruits for resale.  Please support her in her new endeavor!

loans.use: to buy fruits and start a new activity.

loans.name: Baraka Alanine Group

texts.fr: Venancie  est commerçante, conseillère du groupe solidaire «Baraka Alanine», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 62 ans, mère de 7 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse des divers produits manufacturés au marché de la ville depuis 10 ans. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle va s'approvisionner en piles, biscuits, laits, sucre, riz, savon Omo, huiles, etc. Ainsi, elle souhaite construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Venancie is sixty-two years old, married and mother to seven children who all attend school.  She is a trader, member of the loan group 'Baraka Alanine' and works with the field partner, Hekima.

Venancie has been selling various products at the town market for ten years.  She began her business with funds provided by her husband.  She will use her loan to buy batteries, biscuits, milk, sugar, rice, Omo soap, oils, etc.  Her earnings will be used to build a house, and educate and feed her children.

Venancie is grateful to Hekima for the support they offer to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy batteries, biscuits, milk, sugar, rice, Omo soap, oils, etc for resale.

loans.name: Nyota Group

texts.fr: Marie est commerçante, membre de la banque villageoise «Nyota», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 35 ans, mariée à un agent d l’ordre, mère 7 enfants dont 6 étudient et 1 est encore gosse. Elle est vendeuse des pagnes et bijoux au marché de la ville depuis 16 ans. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle va s’approvisionner en pièces de pagnes et bijoux. Elle souhaite accroitre son chiffre d’affaires, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Marie is a trader, a member of the Nyota Group and works with the field partner, Hekima.  She is 35 years old, married to a law enforcement official, and mother to seven children.  Six of her children attend school and the seventh is too young.

Marie has been selling pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) and jewellery at the town market for sixteen years.  She started her business with funds received from her husband.  She will use her loan to buy pagnes and jewellery.

Marie would like to increase her working capital, educate and feed her children.  She is grateful to Hekima for the support they offer to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy supplies of pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) and jewellery.

loans.name: Zawadi Group

texts.fr: Idi mamy est commerçante, membre du groupe de crédits «Zawadi», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un chauffeur, âgée de 30 ans, mère 4 enfants dont 2 étudient et 2 sont encore gosses. Elle est vendeuse des oignons dans un dépôt du centre commercial de la place depuis 4 ans. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle va s’approvisionner en 10 sacs d’oignons. Elle souhaite augmenter son chiffre d’affaires, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Idi Mamy is a trader, a member of the Zawadi Group and works with the field partner, Hekima.  She is 30 years old, married to a driver, and mother to four children.  Two of her children attend school and the other two are too young.

Idi Mamy has been selling onions at the local commercial centre for four years.  She started her business with funds received from her husband.  She will use her loan to buy ten sacks of onions.

Idi Mamy would like to increase her working capital, educate and feed her children.  She is grateful to Hekima for the support they offer to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of onions for resale.

loans.name: Asifiwe Group

texts.fr: Juzele est commerçante, membre de la banque communautaire «Asifiwe», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 22 ans, mariée, mère 3 enfants, dont 2 étudient et 1 est encore gosse. Elle est vendeuse de divers habillements femmes dans un marché secondaire de la ville depuis 5 ans. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle va acheter des jupes, pagnes et sous vêtements. Elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables. Nous tenons a signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en:
Juzele is a trader, a member of the Asifiwe Group and works with the field partner, Hekima.  She is 22 years old, married, and mother to three children.  Two of her children attend school and the third is too young.

Juzele has been selling women's clothing at a small, local market for five years.  She started her business with funds received from her husband.  She will use her loan to buy skirts, pagnes (traditional wrap-around clothing) and underwear.

Juzele would like to increase her working capital, educate and feed her children.  She is grateful to Hekima for the support they offer to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

It should be noted that several of the people in the photo are holding their children.

loans.use: to buy skirts, pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) and underwear for sale.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en: Emelita, is aged 38, married to a tricycle driver and they're blessed with three children. She owns and manages a food vending business in front on school campus for almost 15 years and earns a net income of PHP 600 daily. Due to insufficient capital on her business she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 30,000 to purchase food ingredients, sugar, vinegar, vegetable oil, flour, and others to use/cook on her food stall. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients, sugar, vinegar, vegetable oil, flour, and others to use/cook on her food stall.

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka is a progressive and hard-working 35-year-old farmer from central Kenya. For many years, Milka has been engaged in dairy, poultry and horticultural farming to help her husband provide for their family. Throughout the years, she has succeeded in growing the business and gaining loyal customers.

As her children are growing up, their family needs are increasing. She is requesting a 40,000 KES loan. She plans to use 20,000 KES to buy more poultry to increase the income she makes from selling poultry products. The other 20,000 KES will be used to purchase farm supplies needed for her farm to produce a stable quantity of food that will provide better income and improved diet for her family. 
 
Milka hopes to grow her farm business in the future in order to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stocks of clothes and mattresses for sale to clients to meet both client and family needs.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
A pastor’s wife is considered model to church members and the whole community in terms of her faith and integrity. Honesty is expected of her when she operates any business or endeavor. Wilma reminds herself about this always and she keeps up her faith to be a good example. She is married to Nardenito, a pastor, and they have children. They live in Talisay City, Cebu where Wilma operates a food stall for additional income. It is a known fact that being a pastor is a vocation, and monetary return is limited. Good thing is, a pastor’s family is rich in love and care from their parishioners. 

Wilma embarked on food stall business as additional income generating venture. She maximizes her cooking talent, and even the limited space in front of their house becomes useful. This is where she displays the cooked food, packed into servings for sale. This is more practical for her as she doesn’t need to maintain a big space for customers to eat, no need for eating utensils and equipments, no need for dishwashers or food servers. Her regular customers are her neighbors, the local community, students and working people. Profit derived from her business helps a lot in their daily expenditures but she still needs to save a lot for her children’s education. She’s planning to cook more meal recipes now that the school year already begun. More students are expected to buy from her and it will boost her income. This is why she prays for PhP 10,000 additional capital. She will use this to buy more quantities of meat, fish, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. May God knocks at your compassionate heart and may you be a blessing to her.

Wilma aspires that someday, she would be financially capable of helping others. She also wants to continue serving God together with her whole family. She is an inspiration to her co-fellowship members at CCT who regularly meet every week to reflect of God’s Words and share stories about life and their businesses. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more quantities of meat, fish, vegetables, condiments and seasonings for her food stall

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Talisay City in the province of Cebu has a bordering sea on one side which is the reason why fishing and fish selling are one of the most common occupations of the people. Martina, 56, started selling fish at her early age of 16. It’s been her source of daily living since then. She got married to Felix, a driver, and they were blessed with children.

Martina pursues her fish selling business despite the rigid competition because this is the venture that she knows. She patiently works hard for the sake of her children. Rain or shine, she keeps on. Hopefully all her efforts will be rewarded someday when her children are all professionals. With a college degree, she aspires that her children will have a better opportunity to live a better life.

As a step towards her dream, she needs additional capital of PhP 10,000 that she will use to buy different varieties of fish in volume quantity. It will surely increase her profit and will be of great help to her family.  

Martina is a devoted member of CCT Credit Cooperative and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy different varieties of fish in volume quantity for selling

loans.name: Discipline Group

texts.en:
Faustina, who is in her late-30s, is a married woman with 4 children who are all still at school. She has been selling underwear for 5 years now. She works from 7:30am to 6:00pm daily and is able to earn a very good monthly profit.

This will be Faustina's 3rd loan from ID-Ghana. She used her previous loans to buy assorted underwear and she has repaid all of her loans successfully. She used the profits she earned to pay school fees and loan repayments and cover her household expenses.

Faustina will use this loan to increase her stock of assorted underwear to sell to more customers. She dreams of making her business grow.

Faustina will share this loan with her loan group Discipline, which consists of 3 members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: To increase her stock of assorted underwear to sell to more customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more retail stocks for sale for more income gain.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dairy cow so as to supply more milk for more income gain.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs for use in the farm for high production and supply for more income gain.

loans.name: Rudi

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Rudi, one of Ruma’s agents. Rudi lives in Rembang, a suburban area in West Java located about 13 hours drive from Jakarta. He is happily married. Together with his wife, they have two sons. Rudi owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits for his community. He already joined Ruma for almost a year. He knew Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive that came to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to expand his business in technology. 

As the business grows, Rudi is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Rudi improves his business and accordingly, his community who needs access to such services. Rudi is the one who is seen in the photo. He thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to give his local community better access to communication service by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Nisreen

texts.en:
Nisreen is 46 years old, and lives in a refugee camp with her husband and her four children.  She is a very ambitious woman who wants to provide a living for her family, so she is trying her best to help her husband in the household expenses. 

Nisreen started buy ready clothes and sell it in her house, she begun with low quantity and now wants to increase the clothes therefore she decided to apply for a loan to help her buy more clothes to sell and increase her incomes.

loans.use: to help her buy more clothes to sell and increase her incomes

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Shagufta is 35 years old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of 7 children. Her husband has been running his own decoration and lighting business for 6 years, her husband is only responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family. Shagufta's husband wants to purchase different kinds of accessories e.g bulbs, wires, connecters and other tools for his business purpose. 

But due to financial constraints her husband is not in suitable position to buy all above these products for business purpose. Therefore Shagufta has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and also helpful for him to earn maximum profitable income to manage his house hold and business. 
Shagufta is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's decoration and lighting business, like bulbs, wires, connectors etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry for sale in her butcher's shop.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is married to a housewife and has 3 sons and 2 daughters. He is a motorcycle taxi driver and this is the only source of income to his family, so Mohammad started a small grocery store project to increase his income for his family. Mohammad requested a 5000 EGP loan to expand the project. The loan helps him purchase more grocery products such as oil, pasta and rice.

loans.use: buy grocery products such as oil, pasta and rice for sale in his new grocery store

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is 52 years old woman, she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her 4 children. Her husband has been working in public sector organization for many years, her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of family. Naseem is also providing sewing services and earn the income to contribute with her husband to manage the house hold. 

She is needs different kinds of goods e.g Needles, threads, pieces of clothes, machine oil and etc for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and also helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.
Naseem is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business she needs needles, cloth, machine oil and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase material cloth for making clothes for sale so as to meet client needs for clothes.

loans.name: Philomene

texts.en: Philomene is 47 years old. She is married with four children aged between 8 and 25 years. They all go to school and they are in private schools. She owns a shop and she has been doing in a business for the past 5 years. While her husband works in EWASAC. She is requesting for school fees loan and she would like to pay in installments. After paying school fees, she plans to expand her business in order to prepare her better future.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her four children in installments.

loans.name: Khamees

texts.en:
Khamees is 50 years old, lives in southern Ghour; he is single man and lives with her family.
He is from poor family, and wants to provide good life for his siblings, he owned a coffee shop that sells hot and cold drinks and some snacks, Later on, he expanded his business to sell accessories and baby dolls in addition to cosmetic products. now he wants to expand his shop, therefore he decided to apply for a loan to buy more supplies for the hot drinks and some snacks like biscuits, chips and chocolate.

This loan will help him to increase his incomes and help him to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for hot drinks and snacks like biscuits, chips and chocolate.

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
Noor is caring mother of two children and she is from poor family while her husband is working between Egypt and Jordan with low income. She is trying her best to help him to provide a good life and a good educate for her children.

She is selling blankets in her home to get an income.  She started this business a year ago and now she wants to buy more products from the south of Jordan to be able cover the largest possible amount of the costumer`s needs.

She applied for a loan to buy blankets and buy more bed clothes to sell and to buy more kinds of clothes and increase her incomes.

loans.use: to buy blankets and more bed covers to sell and more kinds of the clothes

loans.name: Medhat

texts.en: Medhat is 35, married and has 2 sons and one daughter. He is a part-time-driver but his income could not cover the family's monthly expenses, so he started a nuts and sweets shop to increase his income for his family. He requested a 5000 EGP loan to buy more nuts and sweets to increase his sales and meet the demands of his customers especially in Ramadan and feast seasons

loans.use: To buy more nuts and sweets.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is 30 years old lady and a responsible mother of four children and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running his own catering business for past 10 years. Zahida's husband needs to purchase different types of merchandises e.g crockery, wood tables, chairs and tents etc for his business purpose. But due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase these merchandises. 

To fulfill the need of her husband Zahida has applied for Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she will help her husband to buy these merchandises for business purpose. That will be good for him to earn more income and this income will support him to fulfill his family's needs
Zahida is very Thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's catering business by buying crockery, wood tables and chairs and tents etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, table oil, pistachio nuts, plastic bags and a pasta-making machine.

loans.name: University Link School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Muhammed. He is the Head teacher of University Link High School, a mixed school in the Urban area of Mbalewith 1000 students. University Link School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

University Link School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Muhammed  ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Saeda

texts.en:
A loan is offered to Saeda to improve her business and buy more ready clothes to sell. She has a business where many people come to buy every day who may be buying clothes.
Saeda has been involving herself in business activities for two years. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day and help her husband who is doing seasonal work with a low income.

Running a business has made Saeda a young independent woman because she can be responsible for herself and also helping her husband and provide a living for her children. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to improve her business and buy more ready made clothes to sell

loans.name: Jason

texts.en: Jason is 53 years old, married and blessed with 2 children. He also supports 4 family members. He is a small scale farmer. He has applied for his first loan from Vision Fund Kenya to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for use in his farm. He hopes this will enable him to get more farm produce for sell. He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate his children. His future hopes are to improve his farming, make more income and support his family.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for use in his farm. He hopes this will enable him to get more farm produce for sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply more milk for more income gain.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to be able buy more fabrics and yarns to make more traditional embroidered products to sell and also teach others embroidery

loans.name: Guérison Group

texts.fr: Kabuo est commerçante, membre du groupe de crédits «Guérison», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 61 ans, mère de 8 enfants qui tous étudient. Elle est vendeuse de la viande et propriétaire d’une boucherie dans la ville depuis 10 ans. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle va acheter 150 kg de viandes. Elle souhaite accroitre son chiffre d’affaires, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Kabuo is a trader and member of the "Guérison" loan group. She is a customer of IMF Hekima and is 61 years old, married and mother to eight children, who are all studying. She sells meat and has been the owner of a butcher's shop in the town for the past ten years. She began her business with funds given to her by her husband. She is going to buy 150 kilos of meat. She would like to increase her turnover and be able to educate and feed her children. Finally she is grateful to Hekima for the support it provides to entrepreneurs who cannot access bank funding.

loans.use: to buy 150 kilos of meat.

loans.name: Parvina

texts.ru: Парвина проживает в городе  Душанбе. У нее муж и двое детей. Сынам 9 лет. Дочке 2 года. Парвина вежливая, добрая, активная и ответственная женщина. Ее муж работает инженером в фирме «Ромсар». Парвина обладает мастерством кройки и шитья. 5 года она занимается пошивом женских платьев национального стиля. Парвина любить свою работу и хорошо справляется с ней. У нее имеется 2 ученицы. В работе Парвине помогает ее ученицы. В швейном деле Парвине нравится сшить больше платье и получить ежедневный доход. Парвина решила улучшить комнату, где они занимаются шитьем. Она собирается отремонтировать комнату, чтобы им было приятно и уютно работать. Ей нужно деньги для стройматериалы и для услуги мастера. Из-за нехватки денежных средств она просит кредит. Парвина верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Parvina lives in the city of Dushanbe. She has a husband and two children. Her son is nine years old and her daughter is two years old. Parvina is a polite, kind, active and responsible woman. Her husband works as an engineer for the Romsar company. Parvina is skilled at cutting and sewing. She has been sewing women's dresses in the national style for five years. Parvina loves her work and manages it well. She has two apprentices. Parvina's apprentices help her to work. What Parvina likes about the sewing business is sewing a lot of dresses and receiving daily income. Parvina has decided to improve the room where she sews. She is preparing to renovate the room so that it will be more pleasant and comfortable for them to work. She needs money for construction materials and to pay for the services of a builder. She is asking for a loan due to a lack of funds. Parvina believes in you and in your support.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and to pay for the services of a builder.

loans.name: Mukadas

texts.ru:
Мукадасу  30 лет. Она мать двоих детей. Мукадас около 5 года своей жизни продвигает торговую деятельность. Она решила заняться этой деятельностью, потому что Мукадас мечтала стать бизнес-леди. И она умная и шустрая женщина, ей подходит ее деятельность. Она справляется своей работой. Мукадас научилась  правильно общаться с клиентами и вести данный бизнес.
   Мукадас  занимается продажей ткани и детские разные обуви. Она решила расширить деятельность и увеличить товар. Мукадас надеется с увеличением товара, увеличится доход и может улучшить жилищные условия жизни своих детей.
texts.en: Mukadas, 30, is a mother of two. She always dreamed of being a businessperson and by now, she has worked in sales for about five years. She is an intelligent and quick woman with an entrepreneurial spirit, and she is good at what she does. Over these years, she has learned how to manage her business and deal with clients.  She sells fabric and children’s shoes. She is requesting a loan because she would like to expand her business by increasing the variety of goods that she sells. She hopes that this will increase her income and improve her children’s living conditions.

loans.use: to expand her business by increasing the variety of goods

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 46-year-old single woman from Gaza city. Seven years ago, she started her own business which is traditional sewing. she makes very beautiful pieces and sell to the local clients.
Hanan took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy yarns and textiles for her business. This will increase her productivity and also her sales.
Hanan appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy yarns and textiles for her traditional sewing and clothes business.

loans.name: Umarbek

texts.en:
Umarbek is a careful father. He was born in northern of Tajikistan in 1955 and is living in a village with his family. He is married and has four children and five grandchildren. He is an honest, responsible, hardworking and gentle man. He is a postman and hs wife is a housekeeper. Beside his work he has a business in agriculture. He keeps livestock and plants agricultural products. 

In order to help his family, his son every year flies to Russia and earns money to his family. Last year he got sick and came home, because he was unable to work. Umarbek worries about his son and wanted to treat him. But he has not the money. 

He appealed to IMON asking a loan to treat his son in hospital. He hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders and awaits your compassion.

loans.use: to treat his son in hospital

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en: Charlotte is a 48 year’s old married woman from Lebanon and mother of five children, only one of them is working. Her husband works as a carpenter and he is the income support in the family and working very hardly to always being able to fulfil his family needs and to live in a good lifestyle. In order to pay the first installment of her child university fees, she is requesting a loan from kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. she said that one of her greatest dreams is to see her children achieving higher positions.

loans.use: to pay the first installment of her child university fees

loans.name: Etleva

texts.en:
Etleva has been doing agriculture for almost twenty years. She is 43 and a mother of two, 16 and 14 years old. In the ten dynym of agricultural land she and her family own Etleva plants mainly beans and wheat that she sells afterwards, and makes fodder for her cow that gives her approximately 17 liters of raw milk a day that she then sells it to a dairy farm. 
Her husband does not have something to focus on; thus, whatever they have been doing so far has been with the labour work from both. Now, they wanted to add another dairy cow and this is where your financial help would be invested. In addition to the income from agricultural activity there is some retirement pension of the in-laws who live with them at about $288/month.

loans.use: to add another dairy cow to double milk production as her only income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her business of traditional sewing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stocks of plastic items such as mugs, basins for sale to clients and meet client and family needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs for use in the farm for high production and supply for more income gain.

loans.name: Eli

texts.es:
Eli tiene 32 años de edad, soltero, dedicado al cultivo de. Vive en el distrito de Callayuc,ubicada en la Región Cajamarca, Sierra norte del Perú, zona en la que la población se dedica mayormente a la agricultura,ganadería y crianza de animales menores.

Él se dedica al cultivo de café de la variedad catimor,desde hace diez años contando con muy buenas referencias en el rubro.

Ha solicitado un préstamo para darle mantenimiento a su finca, con la compra de abonos y de esta manera tener una mejor producción y calidad para ofrecerlo, generando mayores ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Eli is 32 years old, single, dedicated to coffee cultivation. He lives in the Callayuc district, located in Cajamarca Region, Northern Sierra of Peru, an area where the population is mostly engaged in agriculture, livestock, and small animal husbandry. He's been growing the Catimor variety of coffee for ten years, counting on very good references in the field.

He has requested a loan to give maintenance to his farm with the purchase of compost and thus have a better production and quality to offer it, generating greater income to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to maintain his farm with the purchase of compost.

loans.name: Handan

texts.en:
Handan is married and has two daughters who are university graduates.  Handan has been working since she was fourteen and in the meantime she has completed her education.  She has worked as a banker.  Then she quit and started her own business on tourism, real estate and insurance consultant.  The earthquake has torn down her business thus she has had financial losses.  She did not give up and opened a tea house.  In time she turned it to a cafe.  Later on she turned it to an internet cafe, then she closed it and opened a telephone company franchise.  She has been doing it for eleven years.
From now on, she wants to increase the variety of her products and grow her business.  With the help of her first credit she is planning to purchase telephone accessories.  She wants to spend her years of retirement as best as she can. 



Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Handan hanım evli, üniversite mezunu iki çocuk annesi.  Handan Hanım on dört yaşından beri çalıştığını söylüyor bu süreçte de eğitim hayatını tamamlamış.  Bankacılık yapmış, oradan ayrılıp kendine turizm, emlak, sigorta müşavirliği yaptığı bir işletme açmış. Depremde iş yeri yıkılınca iş kaybından dolayı finansal kayıplar yaşamış.  Yılmadan hemen çay ocağı açmış ve işletmeye başlamış zaman içinde burayı cafeye çevirmiş.  Daha sonra internet cafe yapmış ve burayı da kapatarak telefon bayiliğine başlamış.  On bir yıldır telefon bayiliği yapıyor.
Bundan sonra çeşitlerini artırıp, işini ilerletmek istiyor.  Aldığı ilk kredi ile telefon aksesuarları alacak.  Emeklilik hayatını en güzel şekilde geçirmek istiyor.

loans.use: to purchase telephone accessories for sale to the public

loans.name: Juntos Para El Progreso Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “JUNTOS PARA EL PROGRESO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.
La socia  Wendy  tiene 24 años y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias trabajando en una empresa privada, la socia a la vez tiene un negocio de internet, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando  para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de una computadora.
Los socios agradecen el apoyo otorgado y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Wendy belongs to the communal bank "JUNTOS PARA EL PROGRESO" (Together for Progress), located in the Huanchac district in the province and department of Cusco.

The member is 24 years old and single. Her daily work varies between working for a private company and having her own internet business at the same time. She has had her business for some time and it is going well, thanks to the effort she puts in every day with her partner. She wants to be able to continue working in such a way that she will be able to continue supporting her family. 

The member is requesting a loan to purchase a computer. 

The members appreciate the support they have been given and also commit to making her loan payments in a disciplined way.

loans.use: purchase a computer.

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar is an ambitious woman and an example for a will power pf women.  She has had a talent since childhood which is drawing by tattoo (Henna) and she is very good in that. She knows how to make soap. Actually she is a very talented woman.

Samar is 34 years old and caring mother of 5 kids. Her husband is working with low income, therefore she decided to use her talent to help her husband in the household expenses, she started to sell soaps for beauty salons, and drawing henna for the girls.
Samar wants to buy a supplies and what she needs from the materials to expand her work and develop to increase her work`s quality, therefore she applied for a loan.

loans.use: to buy supplies for soap making for beauty salons and henna drawing for girls

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cucumbers, olives, and eggplants to make more pickles

loans.name: Islam

texts.en:
Islam could not complete his education because of the financial crisis that his father has been faced.
He is 23 years old single, ambitious and fighter guy. He left school and start his own business to help his family and provide them livings which is stall for selling food supplies in poor areas, because he is working hard he could after short time to open more than one of the stalls, and now he has a grocery beside his stalls. 
Now Islam wants to buy more products to sell and increase his incomes to be able educate his siblings and help his father more and more.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products to sell and increase his incomes to be able educate his siblings

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.en:
Mavzuna is a generous woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1985 and is living in a place with beautiful scenery and hospitable residents. She is married, has a child and helps her mother to do business in the domestic market and sells fruits and vegetables. 

She has a wish to do business separately from her mother. She came to IMON and participated at training to start-up clients. She got fundamental knowledge and decided to open her own store where she would sell grocery products. She is asking financial support to buy first start up goods for her store. She wants to have a grocery store where she would trade and earn money to feed her family. She awaits Kiva lenders compassion.

loans.use: to buy first startup goods to her store

loans.name: Umedjon

texts.ru: Юному бизнесмену из района А.Джоми, Умеджону всего 32 лет. Он хороший отец троих детей. Умеджон очень старательный человек. Он самостоятельно добился много успехов. Он старается ради будущего своих детей, чтобы они не нуждались ни в чем. Уже седьмой год как Умеджон занимается куплей и продажей женской обуви. Сначала ему было трудно заниматься бизнесом, но со временем благодаря его упорной работе и трудолюбивости он расширил свой бизнес. Так как сейчас сезон продажи Умеджону нужно купить товар для продажи. У него есть свой капитал, к сожалению его сбережение не позволяет ему купить обувь. Умеджон надеется, что получить финансирование.
texts.en: Umedjon, 32, is young businessman from A. Jomi. He is a father of three small children. Umedjon is a good father who works hard for his children’s future. He is a very diligent person who has achieved a lot on his own. For seven years, he has been buying and selling women’s shoes. At first, it was not easy but through his hard work, he managed to develop and expand his business. Since it is the season of sales, Umedjon would like to buy more goods for sale. He has some savings, but unfortunately his own money is not enough. He hopes that his loan will be approved.

loans.use: To purchase shoes

loans.name: Xhensila

texts.en:
This is Xhensila; a 27-year-old married mother of two, 6 and 1 years old. She is seeking your financial help to buy fertilizers and seeds for plantations. She owns some land and also has rented from others some more where she plants potatoes, onions, beans, wheat and fodder. The production of the above is in large quantities, thus, she sells them to whole buyers except fodder that she keeps it to feed her own animals. In addition to agriculture, she also does livestock having two dairy cows at the moment and selling roughly 15 liters of raw milk a day.
“I work very hard all day, all year around. Rural activities are not easy at all; extensive labouring is required in order to do this. It was difficult for me in the beginning because I was young, but I came to understand that this was it: I had to do it,” said Xhensila to the loan officer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for planting to support her husband and children

loans.name: Rabeaa

texts.en:
Rabeaa is a 43-year-old married mother of four children. She has been working in her small cafe shop since thirteen years ago to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children. She is a hard worker who is trying hard to develop her business.

Today, Rabeaa is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy juices, coffee and new tables and chairs which will help her attract new customers for the summer season is always active and full of life.
Rabeaa hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and stay capable of satisfying her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy juices, coffee and new tables and chairs to cope with increased summer business

loans.name: Mtendere Group

texts.en:
Bertha is 54 years with two children and looks after four orphans. She sells second hand clothes to people within her trading center. She does this business in order to provide food for her family and to reduce the levels of poverty in her household.

 Wanting to expand her business, she will use the loan to buy more bales of second hand clothes in order to increase the supply to the market.  Her main intention of getting the loans is to improve her living standards by building a better house and owning a kraal of goats.  The loans have helped her to be food sufficient and she is able to help her relatives.

loans.use: to buy more bales of second clothes to improve her living conditions and buy a herd of goats

loans.name: Skin Success Group

texts.en:
Salama, who is in her early 40s is married with four children, three of them are grown-up and one of them is still at school.  She has been buying and selling fried fish for four years now.  She works from 04am to 10pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Salama's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to increase on the fish stock and has paid back her loan successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay loan and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy fish, cooking oil and charcoal for cooking. She dreams of increasing her fish business.  

Salama will share this loan with her loan group SKIN SUCCESS which consist of eight members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy fish, cooking oil and charcoal for cooking.

loans.name: Mera

texts.en:
Mera is a 33-years-old married woman from Khan Younis city. She is a mother for four sons and two daughters. Three years ago, she started her own business which is traditional sewing. she makes very beautiful pieces and sell to the local clients.
Mera took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new sewing machine for her business and will increase her productivity and also her sales.
Mera appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her business of making beautiful traditional clothing

loans.name: Jairo Enrique

texts.es:
Jairo es un hombre de treinta y cuatro años de edad, muy trabajador que lucha todos los días para sacar adelante su negocio, al lado de su esposa logro impulsar su idea de poner una tienda, compro ropa, accesorios y zapatos para niños. El decidió explotar su capacidad como comerciante desde su casa de habitación.
 
Para seguir creciendo y prosperando en su negocio necesita que se le otorgue un préstamo que le dé la oportunidad de surtirse nuevamente de mercadería de esta manera comprar camisas, pantalones, zapatos accesorios entre otros que estan a la vanguardia de lo que piden sus clientes. Poco a poco ha ido adquiriendo experiencia y mejorando su negocio. El va a continuar trabajando duro para mejorar y llegar a cumplir su gran sueño que es comprar su casa propia.
texts.en:
Jairo is a 43 year old, very hard working man who fights every day to get his business off the ground. 

Together with his spouse, he was able to set in motion his idea of running a store, and bought clothing, accessories and shoes for children. He decided to use his skills as a businessman from his home.

To ensure that his business keeps growing and prospering, he needs to be given a loan which will give him the opportunity to re-stock his goods. He will buy shirts, trousers, shoes, accessories and other things which are at the forefront of what his customers are requesting. 

Little by little he has been acquiring experience and improving his business. He will continue to work hard to improve and to be able to achieve his greatest wish: to buy his own home.

loans.use: to buy shirts, trousers, shoes, accessories and other things

loans.name: Surma

texts.ru: Сурма, 52 года, она замужем, многодетная мама 5 детей. У Сурмы среднее образование. В поисках дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 1998 году, благодаря упорному труду Сурмы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 5 коров, 5 лошадей, а на земельной доле мерою 0,31 Га собственной и 1,0 Га арендованной земли она выращивает ячмень для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Также на ежедневной основе продает молоко, экологически чистое оно пользуется большим спросом. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Сурма обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для откорма на пастбище и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Сурма планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества скота и ремонт дома.
texts.en: Surma, 52, is married and has five children. She has a high school diploma. Since 1998 Surma has been earning her living from livestock breeding and field crop cultivation. Through her hard work, Surma now owns five cows and five horses. She grows barley for farm consumption and sale on 1ha of rented and 0.31ha of her own land. She also sells organic milk, which is in high demand. Surma is requesting a loan of 150,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank to be able to buy a cow for fattening up and resale. She plans to reinvest the profit in cattle and to renovate her home.

loans.use: to buy cattle for fattening in the field and subsequent resale

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru:
Дилором  является предпринимателем продуктового магазина. Она занимается продажей продуктов питания.  Дилором продает сахар, конфеты, печенье и другие продуктов питаний. Она 10 занимается продажей. Дилорому нравиться встречаться с клиентами и продавать им продуктов питания. Ей нравится продавать больше и имеет больше продуктов питания.  Дилором старается ради семьи. Она делает все возможное, чтобы накормить свою семью.
Дилором родилась в районе Шахритус в 1967 году. Она живет в деревне вместе со своей семьей. Сыновья находятся на заработках в Российской Федерации, по причине, что они не смогли найти себе подходящую работу в стране.  
Дилором планирует расширить продуктовый магазин, и решила обратиться за кредитом, потому что у нее не хватает денег для расширения бизнеса. За счет кредита она собирается купить пироги, печенье, торт и другое сладкое  на продажу.  Дилором надеется на поддержку с Вашей стороны.
texts.en:
Dilorom runs a grocery store. She sells sugar, candy, cookies and other food. She enjoys interacting with clients as well as the very process of buying and selling. She works hard to provide for her family. She does her best to put bread on the table. 

Dilorom was born in Shahrituz in 1967. She lives in a village with her family. Her elder sons are working in Russia because they did not manage to find suitable jobs in Tajikistan. Dilorom is requesting a loan because she would like to expand the variety of groceries that she sells, but she does not have enough money for it. She is planning to buy pies, biscuits, cakes and other pastry for sale. She hopes that you will be able to help her.

loans.use: to expand the variety of groceries by buying more pies, biscuits and cakes for sale

loans.name: Uma

texts.en:
Uma is a 35-year-old rural woman. She studied up to grade 8 and after that she could not continue due to financial constraints. She is married and lives with her husband and two children (one son and one daughter) in Falakata. Her children are students at local schools.

Uma's husband owns a mobile phones repairing shop, but his income is not adequate to run a family of four in these days when the prices of essential commodities are increasing rapidly. 

Uma sells betel nuts to give her family additional support. Betel nut is a kind of mouth freshener that is used by the local people. As they do not have betel nut trees, she has to purchase raw betel nuts from the wholesale market or from the villagers and after removing the shells, she cuts the sun dried betel nuts into small pieces to sell in the local market shops and nearby pan stalls. She knows that the villagers are fond of betel leaves (taken with betel nuts) after their laborious work. So, there is a huge demand for betel nuts in her locality. 

Uma is a hardworking entrepreneur who is always concerned with her family’s well-being. She is seeking a loan from BJS, a Kiva partner, to purchase raw betel nuts in bulk. This will enable her to earn a larger profit. 

Her dream is to enhance the business and obtain a greater income that will enable her to provide greater opportunity for her family to get ahead.

loans.use: To purchase raw betel nuts in a bulk to expand her business.

loans.name: Belisbrando

texts.es:
BELIZANDRO DE 62 AÑOS, CASADO,CON CARGA FAMILIAR, VIVE EN CASA PROPIA DESDE HACE 35 AÑOS.VIVE EN UNA COMUNIDAD DEDICADA AL COMERCIO, AGRICULTURA Y GANADERIA, EN EL DISTRITO DE ZAÑA, QUE SE ENCUENTRA EN LA PROVINCIA DE CHICLAYO, REGION LAMBAYEQUE , COSTA NORTE DEL PERÚ.

ÉL SE DEDICA AL SERVICIO AGRÍCOLA Y A LA SIEMBRA DE MAIZ AMARILLO DURO. EL PRÉSTAMO SERÁ UTILIZADO EN LA INVERSIÓN PARA SU NEGOCIO, EN COMPRA DE HERRAMIENTAS PARA TRABAJO EN EL CAMPO Y OTROS GASTOS PERSONALES.CON ELLO TENDRÁ UN MEJOR Y MAYOR INGRESO Y POR CONSIGUIENTE MEJORA EN SU CALIDAD DE VIDA Y LA DE SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Belizandro, aged 62, is married and responsible for a family and has lived for 35 years in a home he owns. He lives in an area where commerce, agriculture and farming are popular, in the Zaña district, which is situated in the Chiclayo province, part of the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru.

He works in agriculture, and grows yellow corn. The loan will be used for his business, to buy tools for working in the fields and for other personal expenses. With this he will have a bigger and better income which will in turn improve his quality of life, and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy tools for working in the fields, and for other personal expenses.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Рустам житель города Куляб. Ему 54 лет. Он женатый мужчина. У него 5 детей. Одна дочка и один сын учатся в средней школе. Старший сын занимается водителем такси. Жена и старшая дочка домохозяйка. Сам Рустам водитель такси. Он занимается таксистом 5 лет. Рустам родился и вырос в городе Кулябе, и он хорошо знает каждую точку города. Данный момент Рустаб плохо себя чувствует, он болеет. Ему надо лечится, и вернуть здоровью. Он очень расстроен, признав, что у него не хватает денежных средств для купли лекарство для лечения. Рустам не знает как купить лекарство, и он решил обратиться за кредитом. Он очень нуждается на финансовой поддержке. Вы можете поддержать его!
texts.en: Rustam, 54, lives in Kulob. He is married and has five children. One of his daughters and one of his sons are at school. His elder son is a taxi driver. His wife and elder daughter are homemakers. Rustam has been a taxi driver for five years. He was born and raised in Kulob, and he knows his town very well. Currently Rustam is unwell and is in need of medical treatment. He feels very sad because he cannot afford medications. Rustam is requesting a loan to be able to afford medical treatment. He needs financial support. You can help him.

loans.use: to be able to afford medications

loans.name: Rumi

texts.en:
Rumi is a married woman of 26 years. She lives in a small mud house with her family in Falakata of West Bengal. She has a daughter who reads in grade 1.

Rumi's husband is a farmer. He cultivates varieties of seasonal crops on his farm land according to the market demand. After harvest, he sells the products in the market at wholesale rate. Rumi helps her husband in this activity, especially in the time of reaping the seedlings and harvesting. They work from dawn to dusk to give a good future to their daughter. Now they decided to cultivate cucumber, which has a great demand in summer season. They need some financial help to execute their plan. 

Rumi came to know that Kiva’s partner, BJS, gives enterprise loans to poor rural women, and she applied for a loan. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies like seeds, fertilizer, etc. to grow cucumbers. Rumi hopes this loan will give a lift in their business and increase in their business profit. In future, Rumi wants to construct a concrete house for the family. 

She is appreciative to both BJS and Kiva for this financial aid.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural inputs to cultivate cucumbers.

loans.name: Lipika

texts.en:
Lipika is 32 years old and married. She lives with her husband and two school-going sons. They live in Deodanga village in Falakata, Alipurduar district. 

Her husband has involved himself in farming seasonal vegetables on his own farmland. Being a housewife, Lipika tries to help her husband in his farm work. They sell the harvest to the local market, but they are unable to earn enough to meet the family’s basic needs. 

Together the couple works hard, but day by day their financial condition is going down, and they are losing their hope for being successful at meeting the family’s basic needs. Since cultivation is the sole source of their income, they want to enlarge their business. So they decided to grow pointed gourds to generate more income. Being a profitable summer crop, this cultivation needs to be started soon to get a good harvest in this season because it has a lot of demand in her rural area. 

As they have their own farmland and experience in the agricultural field, Lipika approached Kiva’s partner, BJS, to purchase good quality seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides to start cultivation of pointed gourds. 

She is hopeful that the crop will earn good enough revenue to alleviate their poverty and enable her to ensure the financial stability of her family. 

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for standing beside her.

loans.use: To purchase necessary farm supplies for pointed gourds cultivation.

loans.name: Leodan

texts.es:
leodan tiene 38 años de edad, soltero , sin hijos a su cargo , vive en casa familiar; domiciliado en SEC. EL PROGRESO, DEL CASERIO MACUACO, UBICADO EN EL DISTRITO DE OYOTUN,REGION LAMBAYEQUE, COSTA NORTE DEL PERÚ. La cual es una zona rural, dedicada mayormente a la agricultura, crianza de animales de corral entre otros.

Él se dedica a brindar servicio de jornaleria; hace mas de 10 años, negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, solicita préstamo para invertir en activo fijo; compra de una palana y una mochila a motor; esto le servira para brindar mejores servicios, así incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Leodan is 38 years old, single, has no children under his care, and lives in his family's home.  He resides in the El Progreso sector of the Macuaco hamlet, which is located in the Oyotún district of the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Perú.  This is a rural area that is mostly dedicated to farming and raising barnyard animals among others.

Leodan makes a living offering services as a day laborer, which he has done for more than 10 years.  His business is located in his home.  He is requesting the loan in order to invest in fixed assets by purchasing a shovel and a backpack power sprayer.  This will allow him to offer better services and thus increase his income and improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy work tools like a shovel and a backpack power sprayer.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es:
MILAGROS DE 37 AÑOS, VIVE EN CASA DE SUS PADRES DESDE HACE 30 AÑOS. CUENTA CON CARGA FAMILIAR 2 HIJOS.VIVE EN UNA COMUNIDAD DEDICADA AL COMERCIO, AGRICULTURA Y GANADERIA, EN EL DISTRITO DE ZAÑA, UBICADA EN LA PROVINCIA DE CHICLAYO QUE PERTENECE A LA REGIÓN LAMBAYEQUE, COSTA NORTE DEL PERÚ.

ELLA SE DEDICA A LA CRIANZA Y VENTA DE ANIMALES DE CORRAL PARA NEGOCIO. ADEMÁS, SE DEDICA A AYUDAR EN UN CONOCIDO RESTAURANT EN EL CASERIO OTRA BANDA – ZAÑA.

EL PRÉSTAMO TENDRÁ COMO DESTINO LA COMPRA DE ANIMALES PARA NEGOCIO Y GASTOS PERSONALES, CON ELLO TENDRÁ UN MAYOR INGRESO Y POR CONSIGUIENTE MEJORA EN CALIDAD DE VIDA.
texts.en:
Milagros, 37, has lived in her parents' house for thirty years. She has a family load of two children. She lives in a community dedicated to trade, farming and livestock in the district of Zaña located in the the province of Chiclayo that belongs to the Lamayeque region on the north coast of Peru.

She is dedicated to raising and selling barnyard animals for her business. Additionally, she is dedicated to helping at a known restaurant in another village of Zaña.

The loan will be destined for the purchase of animals for the business and for personal expenses. With it, she will have greater income and thus a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animals for her business and for personal expenses.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is working hard to complete his education; therefore, he decided to work near his university to ensure his daily and educational expenses. Mohammad`s father is retired from the army, and his pension does not cover all household expenses. To help his father with these expenses, Mohammad is working in a shoe shop near his university. Mohammad is facing financial problems that led him to apply for an educational loan to pay for his university fees and achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to pay for his university fees.

loans.name: Casilda Nataly

texts.es: Casilia es una mujer emprendedora, tiene 33 años de edad y vive junto con sus 3 hermosos hijos en la localidad rural de Pampamarca, ubicado en Cotahuasi en la cuidad de Arequipa. Ella es madre soltera y afronta sola la responsabilidad económica, se dedica a la cría de animales de granja y agricultura, en esta ocasión solicita el préstamo para poder sembrar kiwicha orgánica en su terreno agrícola. Espera que cuando realice la cosecha, pueda vender su cultivo a un mejor precio en el mercado. En el futuro espera seguir esforzándose con la finalidad de darle a sus hijos una buena educación. Su mayor deseo es poder ver a sus hijos como profesionales.
texts.en:
Casilia is a resourceful woman, she is 33 years old, and lives with her three lovely children in the rural district of Pampamarca, situated in Cotahuasi, in the city of Arequipa. 

She is a single mother, and is solely responsible for the family economy. She works in agriculture and in raising farm animals. At this time she is requesting a loan to be able to grow organic kiwicha on her land. She hopes that after the harvest, she will be able to sell her crops for a better price at the market. 

In the future she hopes to continue working hard so that she can give her children a good education. Her greatest wish is to see her children become working professionals.

loans.use: to grow organic kiwicha in the town of Cotahuasi

loans.name: Rekha

texts.en:
Rekha is 39 years old and lives in a small village, Harinathpur, in the district of Alipurduar. She was dropped from school after primary level education as her parents did not have enough financial resources for school costs. She is married to Sukumar, who is a 44-year-old farmer. Rekha is a mother of three children (one son and two daughters), and all of them are attending school.

With the help of Rekha, her husband earns a living at agricultural work, especially sowing basic paddy rice for consumption in the home as well as for sale. But, the present income from this agribusiness is not sufficient to cover all the necessary needs of the family. They need to extend their cultivation in order to earn better for the family. She needs financial help.

Rekha heard about Kiva’s partner, BJS, and has taken a loan to buy good-quality paddy seeds and fertilizers to enrich the area where they are growing paddy, and thus get a good harvest so that their quality of life is improved. Rekha hopes for a good harvest of her crop with the help of this loan. 

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers for growing paddy.

loans.name: Shyamali

texts.en:
Shyamali lives in a small village of Falakata, West Bengal. She is a 29-year-old married woman and a mother of one son. Her son reads in grade 2 in the local village school. She lives with her husband and son in a small mud house.

Shyamali's husband, Pratap, is a farmer. He grows seasonal vegetables on their farmland. Shyamali helps her husband in agricultural activities after managing her household jobs and especially at the time of harvesting and selling their products to the local markets. Due to the seasonal nature of her husband's job, his income is unsteady and insufficient for the household. In this season, Shyamali plans to cultivate paddy rice because paddy is an all-season crop and has a high demand in the market. They are looking for a loan to purchase the necessary agricultural supplies.

Thus Shyamali has applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS. She wants to use the loan to purchase good quality paddy seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and other necessary farm supplies for paddy cultivation. The loan will help Shyamali keep her family afloat and stable financially and expand her agribusiness. Her future plan is to buy more agricultural lands with the profits of this business. 

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva for their financial help.

loans.use: To purchase necessary farm supplies for paddy rice cultivation.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is 26 years old, married, and a mother of 2 children. She started farming when she was 16. Today, she continues to farm in order to help her husband cover the increasing needs and expenses of their family. Currently, she is practicing poultry and lumber farming. She has succeeded throughout the years in growing the business and gaining loyal customers. 

With her children growing up, the family's needs are increasing. She is requesting a loan to buy more poultry to increase the income she makes from selling poultry products. Annah hopes to grow her farm business in the future in order to increase her income and improve her family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Zacarias

texts.es:
ZACARIAS tiene 46 años de edad, cliente vive en casa propia de material rustico, con su conyugue y su hijo de 20 años de edad el cual estudia en el Istituto superior Pucará. Zacarias y su familia viven en la parte rural del distrito de Pomahuaca que pertenece a la provincia de Jaén, Región Cajamarca, Sierra norte del Perú.

La actividad que realiza es el cultivo y comercio de cacao, frutas, asi como tambien el comercio de ganado vacuno, negocio se ubica en caserio Mosqueral – Pomahuaca.

El destino del crédito sera para ivertir en su negocio en compra de abonos, fertilizantes; asi como también en alimentos para ganado, con ello le generará mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Zacarias is 46 years old. The client lives in her own house made of rustic material with her partner and her 20 year old son who studies in the Pucará Superior Institute. Zacarias and his family live in a rural part of the Pomahuaca district that belongs to the Jaén province, Cajamarca region in northern Peru.

The work that he performs is the farming and trade of cocoa, fruit as well as trading cattle, a business located in the Mosqueral-Pomahuaca village.

The loan will be invested in his business by purchasing organic and chemical fertilizer as well as food for livestock. With this, he will earn more income and thus be able to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy organic and chemical fertilizers as well as food for livestock.

loans.name: Tulsi

texts.en:
Tulsi is a 27-year-old lady from Baganbari, which is a very remotely located rural village in the district of Alipurduar in West Bengal. She lives with her husband and two children (one daughter and one son). One of her children attends school and the other is a toddler.

Most of the people of this village are poor and depend upon cultivation and labor. But some of the people have adopted other sources of income for development of their families. Tulsi is one of them; she rears cows. 

Though Tulsi does not have much formal education, she is a very active woman who wants to raise the financial status of her family. She has been running her dairy business for many years. She sells milk in her neighborhood. For additional income, she also sells cattle byproducts like cow dung to her customers. 

Tulsi has so many dreams, but due to her scanty income, she could not even think to fulfill these. Therefore, she wants to increase her income by expanding her dairy business, as there is more demand for milk and dairy products in the nearby towns. 

Tulsi is planning to buy another cow. Thus, she is asking for a loan from BJS, a Kiva partner. She feels that this will add some extra income to her present income. 

Tulsi dreams of upgrading her mud house to a concrete made house with the profit earned from her business.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for the expansion of her dairy business.

loans.name: Iganga Progressive School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Peter. He is the Deputy Principal of Iganga Progressive Secondary School, a mixed school in the urban area of Iganga with 1,200 students. Iganga Progressive School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistently clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 liter tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Iganga Progressive School will repay their loan using their school fees, which they collect each term. Peter ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Dipali

texts.en:
Dipali, 43, lives at a small village named Harinathpur in Falakata, West Bengal. She is a hardworking mother of three children (two sons and one daughter). Her sons work to generate income for the family and her daughter is married now.

Dipali's husband's occupation is farming and he works hard to meet the family needs. Dipali's husband cultivates beans, gourds, cabbages, peas, and other seasonal vegetables to sustain his family. Dipali also helps her husband in cultivation during busy seasons. The crops they grow are sold in the market, and that is the main source of income for the family. 

Now they want to grow bitter gourd, which is a full summer crop. She wants to get a huge profit from this crop in this season, so that rest of the year she can manage their household smoothly. She wants to buy farm supplies to execute their plans. 

So Dipali applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS. The loan money will be used to purchase necessary agricultural inputs for bitter gourd cultivation. 

She is thankful to her lenders for their help.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural inputs for bitter gourd cultivation.

loans.name: Juana Yris

texts.es:
JUANA YRIS, DE 21 AÑOS, SOLTERA, SIN HIJOS. VIVE EN CASA DE FAMILIARES, SUS PADRES EN CONDICIONES SENCILLAS EN SECTOR SANTA SOFIA DEL DISTRITO DE CAYALTI, QUE ESTÁ UBICADO EN LA PROVINCIA DE CHICLAYO QUE PERTENECE A LA REGIÓN LAMBAYEQUE, COSTA NORTE DEL PERÚ.EN DICHA COMUNIDAD LA POBLACION SE DEDICA AL COMERCIO, AGRICULTURA Y GANADERIA.

ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ROPA Y PRODUCTOS DE BAZAR DESDE HACE 1,5 AÑOS. EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO ES PARA LA INVERSIÓN EN COMPRA DE ROPA DE INVIERNO PARA VENDERLA (CASACAS, FELPAS, BUFANDAS, ETC.), PARA DAMAS Y NIÑOS.CON ELLO TENDRÁ UNA MAYOR ATENCIÓN A CLIENTE E INGRESOS Y POR ENDE MEJORA EN SU CALIDAD DE VIDA.
texts.en:
Juana Yris, 21, is single and has no children. She lives in her parents' home in simple conditions in the Santa Sofia sector of the Cayalti district which is located in the Chiclayo province that belongs to the Lamayeque province on the north coast of Peru. In this community, the population is dedicated to trade, farming and livestock.

She has been dedicated to selling clothing and bazaar products for 1 1/2 years. The loan will be invested in the purchase of winter clothing for resale (jackets, headbands, scarves, etc.) for women and children. With this, she will have more attention for her customers and, in the end, a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of winter clothing for resale.

loans.name: Mahfirat

texts.ru:
Махфират 44 летняя жительница района Бохтар. Она замужем и мать троих детей. Муж занимается мастером по ремонту домов. Махфират талантливая  и шустрая женщина. Она занимается шитьем женской одежды. Махфират шьет национальную и разную женскую одежду. Ей нравится кроить и шить. Старшая дочка Махфирата тоже умеет кроить и шить. Она решила после свадьбы заниматься пошивом.  Махфират свою швейную машинку подарила дочке, чтобы она шила. Сейча ее дочка начала заниматься пошивом на машинке Махфират.
 У Махфират сейчас старая советская швейная машинка, но старая  машинка не очень хорошо выполняеть свою работу, и она уже устарела. Махфират хочет купить себе новую швейную машинку, и начать свою работу. По этой причине Махфират обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en:
Mahfirat is a 44 year old resident of the Bohtar area. She is married and the mother of three children. Her husband works as a home renovation specialist. 

Mahfirat is a talented and bright woman. She works in sewing women's clothes. Mahfirat sews national women's clothes and other women's clothes. She likes to cut and sew. 

Mahfirat's oldest daughter can also cut and sew. She decided to go into tailoring after her marriage. Mahfirat gave her sewing machine to her daughter so that her daughter would be able to sew. Now her daughter has started working as a tailor using Mahfirat's machine. 

Mahfirat is now left with an old soviet sewing machine, but the old machine does not function very well and is already obsolete. Mahfirat wants to buy herself a new sewing machine, and start her own work. Mahfirat has applied for a loan for this reason.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Махбуба 37 летняя жена и мать. Муж Махбубы таксист. Он с самого утра и до позднего вечера на работе. Вместе с мужем Махбуба становят детей на ноги. Махбуба 3 года назад начала деятельность продажи детской одежды. Благодаря этой деятельности финансовое положение семьи немного улучшились. Махбуба сама с поддержкой мужа начала бизнес. Махбуба теперь планирует расширить деятельность. Дети растут и расходы семьи тоже. Махбуда за счет заемных средств намерена купить сезонную одежду на продажу. Поддержите Махбубу!
texts.en:
Mahbuba is a 37 year old wife and mother. Mahbuba's husband is a taxi driver. He is at work from early morning to late at night. Mahbuba and her husband support their children together. 

Mahbuba started her own business selling children's clothes three years ago. Thanks to this business, the family's financial position improved a little. Mahbuba started her business herself, with the support of her husband. 

Mahbuba now plans to expand her business. The expenditure of the family has grown with the children. Mahbuba intends to use the loan to buy in-season clothes to sell them. Support Mahbuba!

loans.use: to buy new in-season children's clothes.
