loans.use: to purchase animals, feed, and cover other expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a weighing scale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase metal sheeting, wood and nails to be able to replace the roof on her house as soon as possible.

loans.name: Jacquelyn Beatriz

texts.es: Jacquelyn de 27 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y su pequeña hija de 7 años de edad. Jacquelyn es una mujer emprendedora que los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de pupusas, y los días de semana vende ropa y joyería fina, lo que le permite obtener buenos ingresos económicos. Jacquelyn siempre mostrando sus deseos de superación ha decidido construir dos galeras en su vivienda, una para atender mejor a sus clientes de la pupusería y la otra para iniciar el negocio de crianza de pollos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para construir dos galeras para sus negocios.
texts.en: Jacquelyn, 27, lives in her own house with her husband and 7-year old daughter.  She is a hard-working, enterprising woman with two businesses: a weekend business making and selling pupusas and a weekday business selling clothing and jewelry.  The businesses are an important source of income for the family.  Jacquelyn, always looking for ways to grow her businesses, wants to build two "galerias", one for her food business and another for keeping poultry.  She is applying for a FUSAI loan that she will use to buy nails, timber, roofing material and other supplies to carry out the project.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for improving her small businesses.

loans.name: Mollecato Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “MOLLECATO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Tomasa ella es conviviente y tiene 54 años y tiene 5 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales, la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias,la socia es una mujer emprendedora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere sacar adelante a su familia, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas.

Los socios que están pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto después de la reunión porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de ganados.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The Mollecato community bank is located in the Urcos district in the province of Quispicanchis and department of Cusco.

Tomasa is a member of the group.  She is married, 54 years old, and has five children.  She works raising and selling animals.  She raises guinea pigs and chickens, fattens them, and then sells them at different markets.  She is an enterprising woman who has helped her family get ahead with her business.  This small business has allowed her to help her children.  Her dream is to have a store where she can sell guinea pigs and chickens.  She is requesting this loan to purchase guinea pigs and chickens and feed for them both.

The group members not in the main photo had their photo taken after the meeting because they had requested permission to arrive late due to their work.  

The other group members work selling food, selling animals, at a grocery store, and selling livestock.

Tomasa is grateful to everyone who is a part of this dream and promises to make her repayments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs and chickens and feed for them.

loans.name: Simon

texts.es:
SIMÓN TIENE 60 AÑOS DE EDAD, CONVIVIENTE, VIVE CON SU ESPOSA E HIJO DE 17 AÑOS, EN CASA PROPIA, EN UNA COMUNIDAD GRANDE EN LA ZONA URBANA DE CAYALTI Y GOZA CON BUENAS REFERENCIAS PERSONALES Y LABORALES DE PARTE DE SUS VECINOS.CAYALTI, PERTENECE A LA PROVINCIA DE CHICLAYO, REGIÓN LAMBAYEQUE, COSTA NORTE DE PERÚ.

SIMÓN SE DEDICA A BRINDAR SERVICIO DE TRANSPORTE PUBLICO EN MOTOTAXI, CON MAS DE 9 AÑOS DE ANTIGUEDAD EN EL NEGOCIO, BRINDA SERVICIO EN CAYALTI Y ANEXOS. SOLICITA PRESTAMO PARA EL MANTENIMIENTO Y REPARACION DE SU MOTOTAXI. DE ESTA MANERA HACER CRECER MÁS SU NEGOCIO,OBTENER MÁS INGRESOS Y PODER MEJORAR SU CALIDAD DE VIDA Y LA DE SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Simón is 60 years old, partnered and lives with his wife and 17-year-old child in a house he owns, in a large community in the urban zone of Cayalti. He enjoys good personal and work references from his neighbors. Cayalti is part of Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.

Simón works offering public transportation in his motorcycle taxi, with more than 9 years of being in business. He offers services in Cayalti and nearby towns, and asks for a loan to maintain and repair his motorcycle taxi, in this way to grow his business, get more income, and be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to maintain and repair his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es:
Vidal tiene 74 años de edad, vive con su conyuge, en el Sector Servicentro.Es una comunidad rural y pequeña, que pertenece al Distrito de Cayaltí, Provincia de Chiclayo, Región Lambayeque, Costa Norte de Perú.

Él se dedica a la actividad de cría y venta de animales con más de 20 años de experiencia en el negocio, negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio, solicita préstamo para la compra de animales y comida para estos, dicha inversión le servirá para poder atender en mayor numero de ventas de animales, generando mayores ingresos y por lo mismo mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Vidal is 74 years old and lives with his wife in the Servicentro sector. It is a small, rural community which is part of Cayaltí district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. 

He works raising and selling animals, with more than 20 years of experience in the business. The business is located in his home. He asks for a loan to purchase animals and food for them. This investment will serve him to make a larger number of animal sales, generating more income and which will improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase animals and food for them.

loans.name: Arcenio

texts.es:
Arcenio tiene 47 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico junto a su esposa y su 2 hijos. La comunidad donde vive el cliente es una pequeña zona rural, en la provincia de Bagua, región Amazonas, donde los habitantes se conocen y dan buenas referencias de Arcenio.

La actividad que realiza él, es la venta de abarrotes. El préstamo lo utilizará para invertir en compra de mercadería y surtir su negocio. Esta inversión le permitirá ganancias para mejorar su condición económica y por ende invertir en mejores condiciones de vida para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Arcenio is forty-seven years old, he lives in his own house made of rustic materials with his wife and two children. He lives in a small rural area, in the province of Bagua, in the Amazon region, where everyone knows each other, and they all give Arcenio very good references. 

Arcencio sells groceries. He will use this loan to buy merchandise and stock his business. This investment will allow him to increase his earnings to improve his financial situation, and ultimately invest in improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock his business

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a woman from Kaplamai village in Kenya who is involved in dairy farming. Her work brings home an important source of income. Eunice is married and has 6 children. The children help her with the work.
 
Eunice applied for a loan because she needs to grow her dairy farm. She will buy an additional cow with the borrowed money. The cow, financed by Kiva lenders, will increase the quantity of milk she takes to the market and boost her monthly income.

Eunice needs more income to take care of her increasing family expenses, and that is why this loan is important to her.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in pants, skirts, blouses, t-shirts, baby clothes, and  other products to sell.

loans.name: San Isidro De Yungaqui Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “San Isidro de Yungaqui” perteneciente a la comunidad de Yungaqui en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta del departamento del Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Valeria ella es casada y tiene 59 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes y restaurant, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, negocio de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Valeria is a member of the San Isidro de Yungaqui community bank, located in the community of Yungaqui in the district of Anta, in the province of Anta and department of Cusco.

Valeria is married, 59 years old, and has three children.  She works at her grocery store and restaurant selling staple products like rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.  She wants her business to help her move forward.  She is an enterprising and hardworking woman.  Her dream is to expand her grocery store.  She is requesting this loan to purchase rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

The other group members work selling food, at an agricultural business, at a grocery store, and selling animals.

Valeria is grateful to everyone who is a part of this dream and promises to make her repayments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
ESPERANZA tiene 42 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico,con sus tres mensores hijos de lo cuales dos cursan estudios en el colegio de la zona. Esperanza vive en la parte rural del distrito de Querocotillo, en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca de la sierra norte del Perú. Contando con servicios de agua y luz.

La actividad que realiza es la cría de animales menores como cerdos, pavos, patos, etc, en el caserio de Huancas distrito de Querocotillo. Adicional también se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad. Cuenta con más de 4 años dedicándose al negocio en este rubro.

El destino del crédito será para invertir en su negocio surtiendo con mayor cantidad de productos con ello generar mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona y con ello obtiene mejores precios.
texts.en:
Esperanza is 42 years old, lives in a house she owns made of rustic materials with her three younger children, of whom two are students in the secondary school in the area. Esperanza lives in a rural district of Querocotillo, in Cutervo province, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru. She has running water and electricity.

The works she does is raising small animals such as pigs, turkeys, ducks, etc. in the village of Huancas, in Querocotillo district. In addition, she also sells basic pantry items. She has more than 4 years of working in this field.

The loan will be used to invest in her business, stocking it with a greater quantity of products with which to generate more income and be able to improve her quality of life. In this field, there is no competition in the zone and, so, she gets good prices.

loans.use: to invest in her business stocking it with a greater quantity of products.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
María Mercedes tiene 63 años de edad, casado, sin hijos, vive con su familia en este mismo distrito de Oyotún, en una zona rural donde su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, en la provincia de Chiclayo, Región Lambayeque, Costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales como patos,cuyes, cerdos, etc con más de 15 años de experiencia en el negocio, negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio, solicita préstamo para compra de más animales, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, con gran influencia en el negocio; cliente piensa incrementar su stock de animales para poder atender las diversas gustos y necesidades de los clientes de la zona,generar mayores ingresos y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Mercedes, 63, is married and lives with her family in Oyotún, a rural district of Chiclayo province, along the northern coast of Peru.  She has no children.  Farming, animal-rearing and small businesses are common occupations for the people here.

María Mercedes has operated an animal sales business for 15 years.  She buys and sells pigs, ducks, guinea pigs and other animals.  She operates the business from pens at her house.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy more animals.  The investment will allow her to raise a wider range of animals at a lower cost and better adapt to the local market.  She expects the improved business, in turn, to generate more income and a better quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy animals and animal feed for her animal sales business.

loans.name: Hairafi's Group

texts.en:
Hairafi's Group comprises two hardworking women. Hairafi is 17 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past five years, Hairafi has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells rice, sugar, flour, and Irish potatoes.

To help expand her business, Hairafi has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more rice, sugar, flour, and Irish potatoes, and will help Hairafi to generate greater profits and complete her fridge payment. Hairafi hopes that in the future, she will be able to become self-dependent.

Hairafi is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, flour,  and Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Pablo Joel

texts.es:
Pablo es un hombre de 30 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y su negocio es el servicio de fotocopias y librería. 
Él es emprendedor, buen oyente, solidario, fuerte, alegre, optimista, feliz, responsable y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Sopocachi’ ubicado al oeste de la ciudad, barrio bohemio, que vio nacer a numerosas generaciones de intelectuales y artistas. Es un barrio muy antiguo, uno de los primeros de la ciudad. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-15 grados centígrados.
Pablo es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y para el comercio que realiza. Vive en casa de sus padres que trabajan y está construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es el servicio de fotocopias y venta de artículos de librería como; cuadernos, cartulinas, hojas, etc., actividad que desarrolla de lunes a sábado durante el día, “mi negocio me exige constantemente nuevos materiales de librería porque existen universidades y colegios cercanos aquí…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con contratos con empresas para fotocopiar grandes cantidades, la desventaja es la falta de material de librería que exigen sus clientes. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio, él desea realizar la compra de material de librería como; hojas, cartulinas, lápices, marcadores, etc., para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y no perder ventas. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Pablo solicita un préstamo para la compra de material de librería para abastecer su negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Pablo is a 30-year-old man, single, with no children, and his business is a copy service and bookstore. 

He is enterprising, a good listener, supportive, strong, optimistic, happy, responsible, and very hard-working. His business is in the Sopocachi zone, located to the west of the city, a bohemian neighborhood which saw the birth of many generations of intellectuals and artists. It is a very old neighborhood, one of the first in the city. It has a cold and dry climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 0-15 degrees centigrade. 

Pablo has dark skin, dark eyes, short black hair, is short, has a thin physique, his native language is Aymará which he speaks with his family and he speaks Spanish due to the general culture and for the business he does. He lives in his parents' house, who work, and which is built of brick and cement with a roof of metal sheeting and a wood floor, and which has drinking water, electricity and sewer services. His business is making copies and selling stationery items, such as notebook, cardboard, paper, etc., work that he does from Monday to Saturday during the day. "My business constantly demands new stationery items from me because there are universities and schools nearby..." he says. The advantage of his business is that he has contracts with businesses to make large quantities of copies. The disadvantage is the lack of the stationery items his customers demand. His dream is to improve his business. He wants to purchase stationery items such as paper, cardboard, pencils, markers, etc., to meet his customers' demand and not lose sales. This is his first loan cycle with the institution in the 2 years that he has had this business. 

For these reasons, Pablo asks for a loan to purchase stationery items to stock his business and meet his customers' needs.

loans.use: to purchase stationery to stock his business and satisfy his customers' needs.

loans.name: Mayrambi

texts.ru: Майрамби 54-летняя жительница городка Куляб. В городе Куляб имеет хорошие погодные условия для ведения сельского хозяйства. Майрамби проживает здесь с детства. Она замужем и имеет двоих детей. Сыну 15 лет, а дочери 12 лет. Ее муж работает «ГАИ». Майрамби сама занимается разведением крупного рогатого скота в течение 4 лет. Она покупает молодых телят, откармливают их несколько месяцев, и потом вывозит на продажу. Ей в этом помогают ее дети. Ей нравится доить коров и обеспечить семью молоками и молочными хозяйственными продуктами. Майрамби планирует увеличить поголовье скота и тем самым улучшить условия жизни семьи. Она надеется на Вашу помощь. Вы можете поддержать ее сейчас.
texts.en: Mayrambi is a 54-year-old resident of the city of Kulob. Weather conditions in the city of Kulob are suited to agriculture. Mayrambi has lived here since her childhood. She is married and has two children. Her son is 15 years old, and her daughter is 12. Her husband works as a traffic policeman. Mayrambi herself has been rearing cattle for four years. She buys young calves, fattens them up for a few months, and then takes them away for sale. Her children help her with this. She likes to milk cows and provide her family with milk and home-made dairy products. Mayrambi plans to increase her herd of cattle and in doing so improve her family's living conditions. She hopes for your help. You can support her now.

loans.use: to buy livestock and increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Dúo Fragancia Viva Group

texts.es: Dúo Fragancia Viva. este grupo esta conformado por la señora Sandra Carolina de 34 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de refacciones desde hace varios años, desde muy temprano se levanta para emprender su jornanda cada dia, y asi ayudar en la economia de su hogar, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de insumos par la elavoracion de refacciones.esperando que ustedes le puedan ayudar en su negocio.
texts.en: One of the two members of the Dúo Fragancia Viva is Sra. Sandra Carolina.  Sandra, 34, has operated a business making and selling snack foods for several years.  She gets up very early to start her days and her income from the business helps to cover her family's expenses.  Sandra is applying for a loan that she will use to buy the supplies she needs to carry on her business.  She hopes that you will help to support her efforts.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food business.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a hardworking woman. She is 21 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past two years, Halima has been working hard to manage her clothing business, which deals in ladies’ clothes.

To help expand her business, Halima has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, and will help Halima to generate greater profits and pay for house help. Halima hopes that in the future, she will be able to open up another branch.

Halima is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Dúo Guatebella Group

texts.es:
Dúo Guatebella
Este dúo está formado por Flor De María de 33 años de edad, es propietaria de una venta de ropa americana ella solicita el crédito porque quieres surtir más su negocio en la compra de ropa Americana y así obtener más ganancias. Ella lucha a diario apoyando a su pequeños hijos en sus estudios ya que la meta de ella es que un día se lleguen a graduar y así puedan tener una base para trabajar y ser personas de bien. Tiene buen record de pago.
texts.en: Flor De María, 33, is one of the two members of the Dúo Guatebella group.  She has a business buying and selling used American clothing and is applying for a loan that she will use to stock the business with more clothes.  The investment will allow her to continue supporting herself with the business.  Her goal, the reason that she struggles every day, is to see her children finish school and land good jobs.  Flor De María has a good record of repaying past loans.

loans.use: to stock her used clothing business.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver is a hardworking woman. She is 23 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past four years Oliver has been working hard to manage her tailoring business, which deals in sewing clothes. 

To help expand her business, Oliver has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy another sewing machine, and it will help Oliver to generate greater profits and look after her family. Oliver hopes that in the future she will be able to become self-dependent. 

Oliver is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy another sewing machine

loans.name: Najuwa's Group

texts.en:
Najuwa's group is comprised of four hardworking women. Najuwa is 18 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past five years, Najuwa has been working hard to manage her clothing business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Najuwa has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, and will help Najuwa to generate greater profits and take care of her child. Najuwa hopes that in the future she will be able to start selling shoes. 

Najuwa is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes

loans.name: Jisela Maria

texts.es:
Jisela es una mujer de 40 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 3 hijas mujeres de 6, 8 y 11 años, y su negocio es la elaboración de mantas de vicuña. 
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, sincera, generosa, comprensiva, paciente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘San Nicolás’, 
caracterizada por encontrarse en un área central donde existen los cruces de calle para dirigirse a otras zonas alejadas, De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Jisela es de piel morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo trenzado, baja estatura, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), y su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja y con sus hijas que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera. Su negocio es la elaboración de mantas de vicuña; su trabajo consiste en caminar largas distancias en el altiplano en busca de lana de vicuña, la cual asea para luego hilvanarla, una vez que tiene suficiente lana se dispone a tejerla en un telar. La labor es netamente artesanal y cada manta lleva un promedio de 2 a 3 semanas en terminarla. “inicie mi negocio hilando las lanas, poco a poco aprendí el arte de tejer y ahora soy independiente…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que trabaja en su casa permitiendo cuidar a sus hijas, la desventaja es la falta de una máquina para hilar la lana recién cortada. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de tejidos, ella desea realizar la compra de una máquina para hilar lana y lana de vicuña por mayor para aumentar su producción. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que lleva realizando esta actividad de forma independiente. 
Es por esos motivos que Jisela solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina hiladora de lana y lana por mayor para aumentar su producción y abrir una tienda.
texts.en:
Jisela, 40, has a partner and 3 daughters, 11-, 8- and 6-years old, respectively.  She operates a business making and selling wool mantas, the traditional outer garments that many people here wear.  She is a good mom, enterprising, sincere, generous, responsible and hard-working.  She operates her business in San Nicolás, a crossroads of sorts in central Bolivia.  The climate here is cold and dry with average day-time temperatures that range from 0- to 12-degrees, Centigrade, or 32- to 54-degrees, Fahrenheit.
Jisela is brown-skinned with brown eyes and long black hair that she wears braided.  She wears traditional clothing that includes a sombrero and manta.  She speaks Aymará, her native language, and Spanish.  She lives with her partner, who also works, and her daughters, who are all in school.  The family lives in their own house.  It's a brick and cement house with a metal roof and wood floors.  
Jisela uses vicuña wool to weave her mantas.  She travels far and wide across the Altiplano to buy the wool that she uses to make thread.  When she has enough, she weaves the threads together on her loom to make a manta.  The work requires a flair for this traditional craft and each manta takes an average of 2 to 3 weeks to complete.  "I started out only making thread, then graduated to weaving and now I do it all . . . ", she says.  The advantage of the business, she adds, is that it allows her to both work at home and care for her children at the same time.  
Jisela's biggest challenge is turning wool to thread efficiently.  She wants to open a store, selling textiles, but she needs a machine to make bulk supplies of the thread she needs.  She has operated her business for 4 years now and is applying for a loan, her first, to buy a machine for turning wool to thread.  The investment will allow her to produce the volume of thread that she needs to open her own store.

loans.use: to buy equipment and supplies for her weaving business.

loans.name: Mujeres Luquenas Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Mujeres Luqueñas” is on their very first loan cycle. The eight women in the group are thrilled at the possibilities of generating income, sending their children to school, raising their standards of living, and leaving poverty behind. The group is located in the southwestern part of Guatemala. 

Rosa is the 55-year-old President of the Trust Bank. She has 11 children. She works hard, along with her husband, to generate enough income to send all the children to school, as she realizes that having a good education is a vital key to a successful future. Rosa has a traditional textile business and fabricates colorful blouses or “huipiles” and napkins or “servilletas.” She also sells snacks. The responsibilities of both of these businesses are shared by family members. Rosa is requesting a loan that she will use to buy high quality thread for her beautiful “huipiles.” She will use another portion of the loan to buy ingredients for her snack business.

Through the educational program of Friendship Bridge, Rosa and her friends in the Trust Bank are learning about the world around them and within them. Each month at their meetings, a facilitator from the organization shares practical information with them about relevant subjects like effective business practices, savings and indebtedness, violence against women, and teenage pregnancy. These informational sessions are given in the native indigenous language of the women using games, role playing, and diagrams. Friendship Bridge calls the combination of loans and education “Microcredit Plus.” 

The women of the “Mujeres Luquenas” Trust Bank are on more solid ground because of their perserverance and access to capital and education. Kiva investors play a vital role by funding these much-needed loans. Thanks to each of you for making a difference in the lives of Rosa and her friends.

loans.use: to buy high quality thread for making blouses and ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Akoélé

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 31 ans, Akoélé est une femme mère de quatre enfants. Akoélé habite à Baguida et vend des sachets dans son quartier afin de gagner sa rentabilité. Pour arriver à ses fins, Akoélé s’approvisionne cinq fois par mois au marché local. Pour commander des paquets de sachets, Akoélé  demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et disposer d’un revenu afin d’aider ses enfants dans leurs éducations.
texts.en: Akoélé is a 31-year-old married mother to four children. She lives in Baguida and sells plastic bags in her local area to earn a living. In order to make ends meet, Akoélé gets her supplies five times per month from the local market. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase more plastic bags so she has enough income to aid her children gain an education.

loans.use: to purchase 120 packs of plastic bags

loans.name: Dúo Pasajoc Group

texts.es:
Dúo Pasajoc

Es integrada por la señora Heidy Siomara de 36 años de edad,es originaria del municipio de San Juan Sacatepéquez, doña Heidi es madre de 3 niños los cuales cursan el grado de primaria, por varios años se ha dedicado a su negocio, doña Heidy en su venta de consumo diario y también de frutas y verduras negocio el cual ubica en su domicilio, el cual atiende todos los días en su domicilio. ella requiere y solicita su apoyo a través de capital para lograr invertir un poco mas en artículos que la gente buscan, como conocida y mujer trabajadora siente el deseo de seguir luchando y mantener sus negocio al servicio de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Dúo Pasajoc

Heidi Siomara, 36, belongs to the Dúo Pasajoc group. She is from the municipality of San Juan Sacatepéquez. Heidi  is the mother of three children who are in primary school. 

She has worked at her business, located in her home, for several years, selling products for daily household use, as well as fruits and vegetables.  She runs it every day from home. She needs and is requesting your support through a loan so that she can manage to invest a bit more in items that people are looking for. As a well-known and hard-working woman she wishes to continue striving and to keep her business going for serving her customers.

loans.use: To buy products (merchandise for daily household use,) to sell.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: A 35 ans, Akouvi est une femme mariée et avec ses quatre enfants, elle vit dans le quartier de Baguida. Akouvi est une marchande de chaussures qui se promène dans les rues de son quartier afin de bien vendre. Akouvi s’approvisionne trois fois par mois dans un marché local. Akouvi réalise une très bonne rentabilité dans son commerce. Akouvi nécessite ce crédit pour acheter des chaussures afin de gagner des bénéfices et venir en aide à l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en: 35-year-old Akouvi is a married mother to four children. She lives in Baguida. Akouvi earns a living through selling shoes. She wanders the streets of her local area in order to make a sale. Akouvi gets her supplies three times per month from a local market. She earns a good profit from this business. Akouvi needs this loan to purchase shoes and earn a profit so she can help her children receive a school education.

loans.use: to purchase three bags of shoes

loans.name: Alice's Group

texts.en:
Alice (first from the left) is 30 years old, married, and has three children. She lives with her family in Kibuga village. She is a farmer and mainly grows maize, beans, ground nuts, and coffee. She also has chickens and goats.
 
Alice and the group have attended several trainings organized by YICE on farming as a business, and they are ready to apply the knowledge and skills acquired. Alice and the group are requesting a loan that will help them to buy farm inputs like fertilizers and herbicides, as well as other necessary equipment, for improved productivity on their farms.

Alice’s dream is to become a leading female farmer training other farmers in modern farming technologies and providing them with viable farming information.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like fertilizers and herbicides, as well as farm tools for improved productivity

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a rotavator

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she grows tea. Her business is located in a productive place. She describes her family challenge to be lack of enough water. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy a water tank to store water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will expand the rice farm. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank to store water for domestic use.

loans.name: Dephoroze's Group

texts.en:
Dephoroza (first from the left) is a female smallholder farmer who is 41 years old. She is a resident of Kibuga village, married, and has seven children. Dephoroza grows maize, soybeans, millet, and beans. She also runs a small restaurant in her village. She earns her income from selling her crops and from the restaurant.

Dephoroza leads a group of five farmers that have acquired practical knowledge on farming and financial management. Dephoroza and her group members have learned how they can improve their crop yields and are seeking a loan to buy good quality seeds, herbicides, and fertilizers for their farms.

Dephoroza’s dream is to see her children study up to university level, and she is willing to save money in order to achieve this dream.

loans.use: to buy good quality seeds, herbicides, and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy diapers, pants, blouses, socks, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Dinavence's Group

texts.en:
Dinavence (first from the left) is a female farmer aged 32. She lives in Kabarodi Village, Kanamba parish, and is married with five children. She grows crops like maize, beans and groundnuts and raises goats, sheep and pigs. She earns her income through crop and animal product sales.

Dinavence leads a group of five farmers who actively participate in YICE’s trainings. Dinavence and her group members believe that YICE’s trainings helped them learn new ways of conserving their soil and improving their yields. They are now requesting a loan to be able to purchase fertilizers, farm tools, and good quality seeds so as to improve their gardens.

Dinavence’s dream is to become the leading producer of agriculture products in Kanamba Parish and she believes that with YICE’s support her dreams will be fulfilled.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, farm tools, and good quality seeds so as to improve her gardens.

loans.name: Iveri

texts.en:
Iveri, a 29-year-old married man, lives in Zestaponi district. He has a mother, wife, and sister, who get the only income among the family members. The family belongs to the subsistence poor category, as they don't have enough income and live under poverty.  According to the above-mentioned situation, Iveri lacks the access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting a business, as they require stable income and business experience. The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled him to get a loan of 5,000 GEL and start trading business. Iveri plans to purchase cattle in a low prices and re-sell in increased prices to the local market. 

The family's living conditions will significantly improve, and the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need. Iveri is a very enthusiastic and hardworking person with a great desire to ensure his family members with a good living condition.

loans.use: To start selling cattle

loans.name: Fiodora's Group

texts.en:
Fiodora (first from the left) is a 36-year-old married woman, with four children. She is a resident of Kanamba village in the Kanamba parish. She is a small farmer who grows millet, sorghum, maize, and Irish potatoes. She also rears goats, chicken and sheep. 

Fiodora mobilized her neighbors to form a group of five, and benefit from YICE’s farming as a business program. The group has attended YICE’s trainings on farming as a business, and they are now ready to apply the knowledge and skills they've acquired.

Fiodora and her group are requesting a small loan to buy farm inputs, such as sprayers, herbicides, and fertilizers, to improve their agricultural productivity. They plan to repay this loan through the sale of their produce, and their monthly group savings.
 
Fiodora’s dream is to start an Agro input shop in her community, and she is confident that, with the training organized by YICE and startup capital, her dream will be realized.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, such as sprayers, herbicides, and fertilizers, to improve their agricultural productivity

loans.name: Janier Basilio

texts.es:
Janier Basilio tiene 22 años de edad, conviviente, un hijo a su cargo , vive en casa familiar; domiciliado en el Distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, Región Lambayeque, Costa Norte del Perú, la cual es una zona rural.

Él se dedica a brindar servicio de jornaleria; hace 3 años,con buenas referencias, solicita préstamo para invertir en activo fijo; compra de una mochila para fumigar; esto le servira para tener en mejores condiciones sus herramientas, para poder brindar mejores servicios, generar mayores ingresos y así mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Janier Basilio, 22, is in a common-law relationship and he has one child. He lives in his family's home, in the district of Cayaltí, in the province of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru. It is a rural area.

He has been making a living for the past three years, offering his services as a day laborer. He has good references. 

He is requesting the loan to buy fixed assets; a fumigation backpack. This will allow him to keep his tools in better condition so he can give better service and generate a larger income. This will help him improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fixed assets; a fumigation backpack.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en: Rhoda is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be generous. She operates a farm where she grows french beans. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a productive place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price changes. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her family's well being. This her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Isdianto

texts.en:
Mr. Isdianto is the father of three children and grandfather of five grandchildren. He lives in a town in Malang City in Java, Indonesia's most heavily populated island. He works at the health department.

In Indonesia, you cannot drink city water, and most people don't even have access to piped water. Therefore, most Indonesians depend on purchasing or boiling water. Mr. Isdianto heard of a new option for disinfecting water when the promotion crew from Nazava water filters held a safe water training in his vicinity. Nazava Water Filters filter well, rain, and city water so it becomes safe to drink without boiling, without using fuel or electricity. Mr. Isdianto, who is also a healthworker in his neighborhood, seized the opportunity and became the sales representative of Nazava in his area.

This loan will allow Mr. Isdianto to buy about 30 filters and sell them to his neighbors on credit, making safe drinking water available to 150 people.

loans.use: to buy water filters in order to sell affordable water purifiers.

loans.name: Hanifa's Group

texts.en:
Hanifa (first from the left) is a mother of three, aged 30 and married, living with her husband in Kabaka Village Karusandara parish. She is a known food crop farmer in her community. She grows sweet potatoes, Irish potatoes, bananas, sorghum, and beans. Hanifa and her husband earn their income through the sale of crops, and Hanifa earns a wage as a local volunteer teaching farmers about modern farming in her village. 
Hanifa supports YICE to educate farmers on soil and water conservation in her community. She joined her four other groups to form a group of five and apply for a small loan at YICE so as to be able to buy farm inputs like good quality Irish potatoes, seedlings, herbicides, and farm tools. 
Hanifa’s dream is to create a movement of educated and self-sustaining farmers in her community. She has started recruiting farmers to join her group so as to benefit from many other development programs. She plans to use part of her income to fund this dream.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like good quality Irish potatoes, seedlings, and farm tools.

loans.name: Salima's Group

texts.en:
Salima (first from the left) is a female aged 27 who is married with two children staying in Kyalanga village, Kyalanga parish. Salima is a farmer and she grows beans, ground nuts, maize, and Irish potatoes from which she earns a living. 

Salima is the leader of a group of five farmers in her village. These farmers have attained training on better maize and bean farming. As a result of the knowledge learned, group members have established a 50 by 100 feet maize demonstration garden so as to teach other farmers modern farming technology. Their plan is to transfer the knowledge and skills from this demonstration plot to their personal gardens the coming season. 

That is why they are requesting for a small loan: so as to buy good quality maize/bean seeds, manures, and attain more knowledge to improve their gardens. They believe this would help them double their productivity and incomes.

Salima’s dream is to become a leading female farmer in her community, training other farmers in modern farming techniques.

loans.use: To purchase good quality seeds, herbicides, and attend more training in good farming practices

loans.name: Cresid's Group

texts.en:
Cresid, standing first from the left, leads a group of four men. She is a 37-year-old married woman, with six children. She is from Kabaka village in the Karusandara parish. 

Cresid and her husband earn their income from the sale of crops and livestock products. She grows onions, ground nuts, coffee, and tomatoes, and rears goats, sheep, chicken and pigs.
 
Cresid uses this money to look after her family, and bring about development to the entire community. She was chosen to be the leader of a group of five, because she is trustworthy.

Cresid and her group members have learned improved methods of crop production and financial management skills. They now ask for a loan as a group, to buy a water pump which will enable them to plant crops, especially onions, during dry seasons. With this loan, these enterprising group members will be able to also earn an income by renting their water pump to other members. They plan to use this income to pay part of the loan, and also for pump maintenance and repair.
 
Cresid dreams of being the role model farmer in the Karusandara parish, and helping others learn from her farm.

loans.use: to buy a water pump, which will enable her to plant crops, especially onions, during dry seasons

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a favourable place and his primary customers are locals. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to buy a taxi within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his business. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en: Suleiman is a married man. He describes himself to be trustworthy. He operates a farm where he keeps dairy cows and also grows vegetables and maize. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a productive area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy farm inputs. He hopes that in the future, he will be a large scale farmer. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a woman from Kipkaner village who is involved in dairy and sheep farming. Her duty to provide for her family and her love for domestic animals is what propels her to endeavor to grow her agribusiness to higher heights. Her work brings home an important source of income for her family.  

Agnes applied for a loan because she needs to grow her dairy farm. She will buy an additional cow with the borrowed money. The cow financed by Kiva lenders will increase the quantity of milk she takes to the market and boost her monthly income.  

Agnes needs more income to take care of her increasing family expenses and that is why this loan is important to her.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Peninah's Group

texts.en:
Peninah (first from the left) is a 56-year-old widow living with her six children. She is a resident of Kibuga village in Kasese district. Peninah grows bananas, millet, Irish potatoes, and maize. She also rears goats. She earns her income through the sale of farm yields and her wages as a traditional birth attendant in her community.

Peninah leads a group of five farmers who are beneficiaries of YICE’s trainings on farming as a business. Having learnt why their yields have been low in the past seasons, they seek to improve their productivity. That is why they are now requesting a loan to buy good-quality seeds, fertilizers, and water pumps so as to invest in their gardens this coming season.

Peninah’s dream is to complete her residential house, which her husband had not finished before he died. She also wants to educate her children up to university.

loans.use: to buy good-quality seeds, fertilizers, and a water pump to boost her farming activities.

loans.name: Gonca

texts.en:
Gonca is married and a mother of two. One of her children is autistic. She was worn out because of it. She says she had waited for years to hear her child's voice. But with the help of a good education they have gone a good long way. She is planning to do wooden paintings and sell them. With the help of a loan she is going to buy wooden materials. She is planning to sell them in her husband's shop and her friends' stands. 

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Gonca Hanım evli iki çocuk annesi. Çocukların dan biri otist. Bu da yıllarca Gonca hanımı çok yormuş. Tek bir ses duymak için yıllarca beklediğini söylüyor. Şimdi çocuğunu eğitim ile düzeldiğini çok yol katettiklerini söylüyor. Şimdi kendim için daha güzel şeyler yapacağım diyor. Ahşap boyama yapıp satmayı düşünüyor. Aldığı kredi ile ahşap malzemesi alacak. Ürünlerini eşinin dükkanında ve arkadaşının tezgahında satmayı düşünüyor.

loans.use: to buy wooden materials

loans.name: Birobiya

texts.ru:
Биробия разведена и одна воспитывает двоих детей. Биробия не только одна воспитывает и одна трудится, чтобы обеспечить детей, ей тяжело одна воспитывать и трудится, но ни смотря, ни на, что Биробия двигается только вперед. Она ради детей живет и так много старается. Биробия занимается одной видом бизнесом. Она  ходит по домам и продает ткани и детские одежды. В этом бизнесе ей нравится встречаться с новыми людьми, и она начала это бизнес недавно. Благодаря доходу за счет бизнеса она обеспечивает детей. 
На запрашиваемый кредит Биробия хотела бы увеличить ассортимент товара и увеличить доход. В дальнейшем она планирует открыть свою торговую точку и расширить бизнес.  Биробия сейчас верит и надеется на поддержку с Вашей стороны.
texts.en: Birobiya is divorced and is raising two children alone. Birobiya is not only raising them on her own, she also works alone in order to provide for her children. It is hard for her to raise them and work alone, but despite everything Birobiya only moves forwards. She lives for her children and tries very hard. Birobiya engages in one type of business: she goes around houses and sales cloth and children's clothes. What she likes about this business is meeting new people, and she began this business not long ago. Thanks to the income from the business, she provides for her children. With the requested loan, Birobiya would like to increase her range of goods and increase her income. In future she plans to open her own retail outlet and expand the business. Birobiya currently believes in and hopes for support from your side.

loans.use: to increase her range of clothing for sale.

loans.name: Hanan 2 Group

texts.en:
Samar is the featured borrower for Hanan 2 Group. She joined with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Samar is a 31-year-old married mother of three children. Ten years ago she started selling cosmetics to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children. She is an ambitious lady and sacrificing mother. Today, Samar is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of summer cosmetics to satisfy her customers' special requests. Samar is the first lady on the right of the photo.
With respect to the other group members, Dalia is the lady standing in the middle, and Najlaa is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with new collection of summer cosmetics

loans.name: Franck Jefferson

texts.es:
Jefferson es un joven de 20 años de edad, soltero, estudiante de bartender estudia 3 veces por semana, los fines de semana trabaja animando show infantil y hora loca,el préstamo que solicitó lo va a invertir en pagar las mensualidades del instituto y los materiales que le solicitan, Jefferson se siente muy contento de poder estudiar lo que le gusta ya que al futuro le va a servir para tener su propio negocio poner un Resto-Bar.
Jefferson ha logrado vencer los obstáculos de dinero gracias a Edaprospo y a Kiva con el préstamo estudiantil que se le otorgo, él agradece y dice sentirse contento por la oportunidad que recibe de poder estudiar,Gracias Kiva por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Jefferson is a single 20-year-old young man. He is a bartending student. He goes to school three times a week. On weekends, he works presenting a children's show and "hora loca" [crazy hour] performances. He will invest the loan he is requesting in paying his monthly institute fees and paying for the materials they are requiring. Jefferson feels very happy to be able to study what he enjoys, since in the future it will serve him well so that he can have his own business and set up a bar and restaurant.

Jefferson has managed to overcome the financial obstacles thanks to Edaprospo and Kiva. With the student loan that he has been granted, he feels very grateful and says he feels happy about the opportunity that he is receiving to be able to go to school. "Thanks, Kiva, for the support provided."

loans.use: to pay monthly fees and buy materials that the institute is requiring

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a farm where she grows french beans. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a productive area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price changes. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her family's well being. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.
